photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Brisket and fries ever!!!

XjNa2ZCu_Vk6zcJ4R6B4HQ.text: One visit is enough for me. The place is small and the service was friendly. I don't hold that agaist this place. I did not like the food. I ordered the maniac fries with brisket. The dish came with waffle fries, macaroni and cheese, sliced hot link, brisket and a white sauce. Everything was just ok. The dish came out just warm with some parts but warm at all. The hot link was not hot and the brisket was too chopped, like pulverized.  This place was just not for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot link sandwich with corn
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maniac fries with brisket

7LJURlh_VEbcSp7wbead-w.text: Literally this was absolutely delicious and worth every single calorie! I got the Jessie Rae sandwich and ate the entire thing. The BBQ chips on it give it the perfect crunch and you get the best of both worlds with brisket and pulled pork. My friend and I also got the Maniac Fries, which we ate maybe 1/4 of because the serving size is so huge! The Maniac Fries were amazing, too! I will definitely be back here when I'm back in Vegas!

9sgT4U9PZvFe9DUIYBCZmA.text: Food was delish!! My wife is normally a very clean eater, but today she decided that her ribs and brisket deserved to be picked up and eaten. That God Sauce is legit. We ended up buying a bottle ourselves cause it is amazing and will drive it back to the bay like it's a baby. Also shout out to the mom who was crazy nice and courteous

FxAcbIvDM5DwbjKuxRwB5Q.text: Jessie Rae's BBQ today before work. Had to come in to get the ridiculous Fortress! This dish is meant for 2, but since I'm single leftovers it is. With a full rack of ribs that falls of the bone. Mac & cheese, tater tots, sausage links and brisket! Oh Ma Gawd, so good  do yourself a favor and come on down and try this.

c-ggtfQiIykzbUNnMoLPpg.text: Authentic BBQ perfectly prepared. Rebecca always takes good care of us. DO NOT leave without dessert. Trust me.

Bw70EjlCx1fWDa-wTiRECg.text: So far this is the best BBQ place I have been in the area. The food is delicious! Be prepared to not being able to finish your portion, you might have to ask for a container to take your leftovers with you.   If you like BBQ and enjoy a nice service, this is the place for you to go.

Rbmys5JK5W7Z5XxV_oz-zw.text: We ordered a large maniac fries and man it was huge... prolly could feed 4 to 5 people. At first i thought its kinda weird because it has mac and cheese on it, but the bbq sauce and the sweet taste of mac and cheese is perfect! We will be coming back to try their other food feom their menu.

0QhiIh69YMYWz6cmTxBADw.text: Front desk is completely Narcissist!! Food came out fast because it was drowned in grease and fat part of brisket. If you come to Vegas please avoid this spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grease just soaking can you say heart attack?!

bUcW0jmW4LpAyyDHm1h0HQ.text: The food is a definite four. With that being said, it's a take out place. Even at opening the tables were all dirty. When bussing between customers they leave the very dirty tablecloths and half of the disposable ones. That includes the used paper placemats dribbled with bbq sauce. The good news is the meats. I ordered a half rack of the pork spare ribs. They were juicy and meaty. The tenderness left you eating every last morsel. The meats are flavorful and perfectly made.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half rack of pork spare ribs

28LAywWwz6Z0csJ-7QrXvQ.text: The pork was second to none in tenderness. The MAC was good as well as the fries. The service was very personable. Several items were forgotten from our order but the employees quickly fixed any issue. They were busy at lunch but we still found a seat. It's a pretty small building with not a lot of parking in the front. Could be additional parking elsewhere. Not sure. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. Expect a hole in the wall type restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SWzsRbHkAhT1wOH3nccAeQ.text: So the decision was Tc's Rib Crib.  We decided to give Jessie Rae's a try instead based on the rating (4.5 with over 830 reviews) they were carrying at the time.  My rating is going to be a 4 still because even with the disappointments, they weren't bad enough to bother me.  I wish I could leave a 3.5 or 3.7  1. Service  Service was quick, polite, and friendly but definitely not what I would call "experienced" or "professional" and that probablyisnt their goal which is fine also because it is completely a whole in the wall.    2. Food We ordered the baby back ribs, brisket, and mac and cheese.  The brisket was cooked the perfectly.  The ribs were tender but you could tell they'd sat under a heating lamp or something for a bit so therefore a tad dry on top.  The mac and cheese was kind of spicy and not for me.  The cheese reminded me of box preparation.  As a previous reviewer said, the meat was in fact bland and could've used some help.  I guess the star of this whole visit was the sauce, which I actually enjoyed.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef brisket
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby back ribs

TNVJnXBbdTfRxZP4ojMfNw.text: I have to update my review just to make it perfectly clear that Jessie Rae's is consistently amazing on multiple levels. The customer service is wonderful. The owner, Mike, leaves the front of house to his wonderful mother. She is a saint. So personable, welcoming, a straight shooter.   We had some family in town visiting from North Carolina and brought them here for lunch. We ordered quite a bit, as we were a super hungry party of 5, and were accommodated so quickly. My family was blown away. Totally loved it. Said it was better than any BBQ they had in the Carolinas.  But the ribs. Oh. My. God. The spare ribs are to die for. Literally, the best freaking ribs I've ever had. My 5 year old son would agree. I have never seen a kid that size put down that much meat and that many waffle fries in my life. He LOVED the pastrami special last month. I don't think I've ever seen a kid eat pastrami. I consistently have to argue with him to share because he is convinced he's going to eat a 3 meat combo with fries and a full rack of ribs by himself. In the end, he puts down half of it, all the fries, and asks for an additional side of fries to go.   Back to the ribs. Fall off the bone tender. Flavorful, juicy. PLENTY of meat. You definitely get your monies worth here. Anything you order will be good, I promise you. They have won LV's Best BBQ & Sauce for a damn good reason. Beef rib special on Thursdays, which I am dying to try!   Check out their Instagram for other special menu items, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sliced brisket!!! I have NEVER liked brisket until Jessie Rae&#39;s.
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 meat combo with waffle fries, sliced brisket, pulled pork and chicken
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another shot of the pork spare ribs

pIKytw9R-6OlbIAhjcK6jg.text: Best BBQ in town you gotta try everything  it's amazingly tender and staff is friendly and helpfull.

REwUEp3axadFJuUtZte4Ow.text: Just Wow. Amazing! You will love their different sauces. And their brisket is amazing...

IhK7-oHI-RUK1Cuq6zGXFw.text: The fundamentals of any restaurant is to first have clean bathrooms and dining tables. Sadly that was not the case with the bathroom and at our table. The server/hostess/busser left other tables with dirty placemats, someone over worked I could understand but they had just opened so our dirty table was from the day before.   But..the barbecue was outstanding!, tender, tasty, smoky, falling off the bone yet not mushy. Great flavor and very rich and complimentary barbecue sauces perfectly enhanced the great flavor. So I will return again, but only for takeout!

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty and falling off the bone!
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

TuJBmCIQ8VRdLeoZo6_02w.text: Yes!  Go!  The food is great, the sauces divine.  It's away from the Strip, not too small, unpretentious and as good as you are hoping based on the other reviews.  I come to Vegas for work, and have eaten everywhere along the strip, but with BBQ you want genuine mojo in your meal.  They deliver!  I came in half an hour before closing, and they served me right away with amazing graciousness and better food.  I got the 3 meat combo and corn.   I gave it 5 stars, find out for yourself.

l8E832JHiYP_c57-IkSRZg.text: WOWWWWW! GO! You won't regret it! Awesome stuff! Thank you Mike!

y56WT6JvAOupmj8G81PROA.text: How they have these 4 and 5 star reviews is beyond me, they should be closed!  As I always stress in all my reviews my husband and I are in the restaurant business and there are things we will overlook or be understanding about but when your serving food that can make people sick and your place is filthy I have a real problem.  Yes this place is a hole in the wall so I dont expect the ritz but your place can be clean! I was a restaurant owner both here and in NY, and my places were small but clean and safe. I took pride in my food and establishments. But there is no pride here, I mean this place looked like a redneck yard sale. The table cloths were sticky the chairs were mismatched and the seat covers were ripped and the sauces on the table tops were gross! The tops were crusted with old sauce so you know they haven't been washed in awhile and for covers they were using souffle cups... really? Also the sauces need to be refrigerated, and there needs to be labels There were sauces that we had no clue what they were because, no label. And I wasn't about to taste test that filthy mess.  Now the food. I see that the importance of food temperatures is lost on this place. They obviously dont understand that food that is not prepared to and kept at safe serving temperatures can be DANGEROUS. There is something called the Temperature Danger Zone. Pork, Chicken, Beef, and Seafood must be kept at proper safe serving temperatures to prevent the growth of food born bacteria. The fact is People can get very sick and can even die from undercooked or improperly held food. Anyone remember the fire fly restaurant incident?  But from what we experienced I can guarantee the staff and owner have ZERO understanding of proper health department procedures and policies. They dont even care about the basics, your place should be clean, safe and most important hot foods are kept hot and cold foods cold. It is that simple.  For this place I guess not so simple.  We ordered beef ribs, pulled pork, chicken, brisket, loaded mashed, mac n cheese and coleslaw.  All the meat was luke warm at best, and we sent it back TWICE. When it came out the second time it was clearly microwaved, with some fresh sauce thrown on it to "cover up" the mess. Also the coleslaw was luke warm.... coleslaw is a mayonnaise product and needs to be refrigerated that alone could make someone deathly ill.   The luke warm meat is a real concern, so either their steam tables are not holding Temperature or they are just leaving the food out. Either way we have a problem.  Also the staff was not the best. The cashier/server was just rude about the whole thing. He rolled his eyes when we complained about the food being cold.  Also when he returned the second time he dropped the pans on the table and walked off.  And he wasn't surprised when we complained it was cold again. He just gave me a refund and moved on.   He also claims he called the owner, yeah right. If he was concerned about the food being cold he wouldnt have kept ringing in and serving new guests coming in after us since he knew there was an issue with the food. But I guess he was more concerned about having to return at 4am the next day since he made it a point to complain to us about  his schedule.  This place is just horrible, and not safe.  And what is really scary to me is they have the contract to supply food to the raider stadium when it opens! So if this place cant keep food safe and hot for 20 people how are they going to keep it safe for 10,000 ?

eRVDbSOFC4TPTPapzv7Ikg.text: The Food is very tasty, the reason I am giving only 3 stars is the place is a filthy, disorganized hole in the wall. They could maje it nice, but they have lost their way here. Great BBQ, but I do not want to get sick either. The bathrooms are a filthy mess as well. Come on take care of your business  Visited the business at 2:33 p.m. today.

fAofOMKona_cF1K5tqgW-g.text: I've had plenty of BBQ all over the South as well as TX and Okla...I'd put this place up against any of 'em. The bark on the brisket and pulled pork were phenomenal and the meat tender and flavorful. Sauce and sides were top notch as well. Run don't walk to this place!

R0wFo9LNUlowNus6B5qTHw.text: Great food, waffle fries and chicken was an hit.. Will try to mke that at home back in Cali, for sure thanks for the idea.. Great friendly staff will come back for sure!!!

-MQl4FIgu2jOZyOSuoSylg.text: Don't be deceived by the location or decor, this place is incredible. Real bbq - the brisket is just melt in your mouth. Sides were perfect. Recommend highly.

wAI6B_wW-S7lE0qz4_2s8w.text: The food was great. You really need to look for the place, but when you find it, it's a gem. The God sauce is excellent. Will definitely be coming back.

e7a6EHnZ4Vh90Um_8DbL5Q.text: Wow... amazing the best barbecue I had in Wild small place buy wow again .. I totally recommend this place.. the stab was nice .. definitely you have to try this place..and yes I will go there again..and agian..

thnsk_zvCvV03cJpkqhEQA.text: Love these small hole in the wall places.  Quick and friendly service and food came out really fast.  Manager in front made sure we were satisfied (full) when we left.  We purchased the family pack for 3.  Came with 3 sides (baked beans, corn, and BBQ mash) All 3 were really good!  Meats we had were ribs, pulled pork, hot link, and chicken.  All had amazing flavor.  We'll be coming back on our next trip to Vegas.  Keep up the great work Jessie Rae's!

WWE6l12bfoy7Srx90eoC0Q.text: I eat BBQ everywhere I travel, and I must say this is some of the best I have had anywhere outside of the Southern states.  I had the two meat combo of Pulled Pork & Brisket, both were absolutely delicious, and talk about tender, it would be hard to beat!  If you are in Vegas, and craving great BBQ, find this little joint, it is right across the freeway from the airport one block north of Russell RD on S Valley View BLVD.

pRvkBScJQzXnqwKKlxXkoQ.text: Food was incredible. I can understand why they are an award winning bbq joint! Workers were very personable, friendly, and provided excellent service. Can't wait to come back for more and more and more!

B9diCIzXSVbwHvGgcoOLRw.text: I love Jessie Rae's!! Try something different every time, it's all amazing! And the staff and owner are really friendly. Their God Sauce is my favorite too, a must try. Obvious why they have so many awards

RdsDJ3CGJXiqlhZxS9cX_Q.text: So, it was OK. The ribs were very small. More like baby backs and one order is only 3! Flavor was good. The sides were very good. Baked beans and kernel corn. The link sausages were nice sized but kind of on the dry side. The chicken, instead of giving you a half chicken, like most barbeque places, was diced, shredded and the amount of meat amounted to probably less than a full breast. I really wanted to like this place. The owner came out from the back, introduced himself to everyone in his restaurant and thanked everybody for coming but that in itself is not enough to get return business. I may give them another shot. Maybe. Maybe not

QoC-nudMFhz78Q3w8ClSdQ.text: My husband and I went to the Cactus Jack's location yesterday to get some of the best BBQ I've ever had.  Hubby has eaten here quite a bit while on lunch at work, but this is my 2nd venture.  Loved it all.  1/2 rack of ribs, corn, bbq mashed potatoes.  YUM!  I ate two of the meaty, fall of the bone ribs and called it a day.  Took the rest home for dinner.  My husband had the sausage and brisket, both of which were super tasty.  The brisket was tender and delicious.  Mike, the owner, sat with us and BS'd for a bit telling us some of his future plans.  He has lots of great ideas, and is obviously ambitious and knows his food!  Great stuff. =)

bTte7_iVQmL_1IZ0vSdM1w.text: This place is my favorite and they never disappoint. Every time I've come in the food is fantastic, nyzah is fantastic and i just love the atmosphere. I will always recommend this place to others!!!

400Y-R7fZkRp7jGPolvtPw.text: Just tried this place out for the first time and all I have to say is move over Rolling Smoke BBQ.  Jessie Rae's BBQ is #1.

Rcw2eTAU-mV0ogAQpgp5hg.text: Always good stuff, I've never got a bad thing on the menu. Favorite lunch spot when I'm working on that side of town.

x_5cMMMxbymUGbStKyTkJw.text: The food is sooooo good! Seriously the best BBQ in town. The pulled pork is amazing. Very tender and juicy yet my bun doesn't get too soggy. The only thing keeping me from giving 5 stars is their hours. They need to be open for dinner. I can't usually get away for lunch and prefer the heavier BBQ meal at dinner anyway but they close at 4.

3J37VRyG4onmF9T8Lci9Rw.text: In visiting from Chicago,  came with some friends from Las Vegas - enjoyed an awesome meal that had filled us so well that we may not need dinner tonight!   The meat was banging!  Great flavor profile!  Plenty of food served too!  The sides - and we had a bunch - were absolutely fantastic too!  If you like Q then be sure to stop in here and meet Mike. You won't be disappointed!

FCq7xPAqIoM7X2BaHjDHMQ.text: Fantastic!!! Tasty, moist, perfect! I got the $15 sampler. They hooked me up as a first timer, and hooked me. Thank you guys, see ya soon

OMPKb8E9swu2CgRwJEPuAA.text: Delicious BBQ. Dope server/owner/host.  Don't listen to the haters on the other reviews. If you want delicious authentic unpretentious BBQ go eat here.

dRXNkmqmSXdXlYJXWdNnEQ.text: The BBQ is so good! Best BBQ I've had in Las Vegas. Awesome staff and great flavored. My favorite is the Pig Sweat sauce. If you love great BBQ you owe it to yourself to come here.

aB9ab7jGkyWQ08xr8DAzeg.text: I bought a groupon worth 38.00 and paid 26.00.  We bought 6 groupons for our Vegas vacation.  All of them were great deals, but not this one.  Why you ask?  Because we went in to order and got confused and spent 26.00 instead of 38.00.  The guy knew we had a groupon and he knew we were not spending enough, because we talked about how much we had to spend.  He knew it and he did not tell us.  I cannot give a good rating to anyone owner or employee that would do that to a customer.  I would not go back to a business like that.

c5Hzzp7PF8dnRjponeZbag.text: Poor customer service, pulled pork was very dry. Waited 5 minutes before anyone came to front to assist us, when they came out there was no greeting just asked what you want. The concept of the Jessie Rae sandwich is awesome; however pork was very dry and had to cover with God sauce to make it worth eating. God Sauce was good. Overall not a good experience, maybe I caught them on a bad day, will take a lot of convincing to go back.

pQFp4r26Yc1Q7xJhPhho-Q.text: First time ordering from here. They have the BEST baby back ribs!! The meat literally falls right off the bone when you pick up the ribs.   Will definitely order again in the near future.

0it3DhZjl8u5SP49zBtNWA.text: Saw lots of great reviews and stopped by. The restaurant is located inside an industrial complex. The interior is decorated with lots of awards. The menu is displayed on the wall . The atmosphere is a mom/pop style. The plates , forks, knives are disposable so no real dishes. I tried the yelp special (chefs choice of meats and sides). The special is $16 , but minimum is two so really $32 for the yelp special . The special today were brisket , pork ribs , pulled pork, chicken thighs, and link sausage. The sides were a piece of bread , corn and beans. The beans tasted like bushes beans from a can. The corn tasted like from a can but marinated in butter . The coleslaw was ok. The sauces are good. In interior climate was set to 81 degrees (that's the thermostat Reading from wall). It was hotter inside the restaurant than outside .  The overall food temperature was room temp and not hot. I'm assuming if you get here first thing in morning or lunch it may come out hot like a bbq. Customer service was good.

Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yelp special $32

KlXucma9xMEsWWUNZlwHlA.text: Foods good, but the chairs are falling apart and the place seems kinda dirty and the food isn't cheap, it's a real hole in the wall.  Despite that I wanted to return the next day I call to place an order, but they ran out of meat, so whatever I figure I come back tomorrow.  Next day I come in, same issue no meat other than spareribs, I find this out after waiting for two, " people" to ask every question under the sun about portion sizes.  These two somewhat minor inconveniences and the fact the location is out of the way is keeping me from ever returning again, there's a lot of good BBQ places here to spend money at that are much more convenient.  It explains why each visit I made only 3 people were there despite the food being good quality, maybe I'll try them again in 2019.  Quick update owner responded to my benign review, I decided to change to a 1 star from a 3 star, weirdest customer service exchange of my life.   He sends me string of snarky PM's then publicly post a professional response, one that I would have expected In the beginning, but did not receive until posting my PM's. Sure I can't wait to return lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4-dXuniVSpYwo0rv7KEH-w.text: I am skeptical of all bbq joints. I can never get consistently tender and juicy meat. I will have to go again to confirm the consistency but judging how above and beyond juicy and tender the meat was I cannot imagine it being tough and dry. I absolutely adored the rib tips and I'm never impressed by ribs but these were meaty and tender. The pulled pork was great as is usually the case anywhere. My only complaint was with the brisket it tasted great with a nice depth of smoke ring but it was sliced with the grain instead of against it. I've never seen this, it just makes it more difficult to eat. Overall the meat quality was outstanding and the bbq sauce was very good even the spicy one made with "the reaper" pepper.

JgO2LTFZ7kN_8KEn7eoRlg.text: Do not let the small size of the dining area or the short hour scare you off.  This place is the REAL DEAL and amazingly good.  We came at 5:00 on a Friday and while they were out of most of the sides, there was enough meats left to serve everyone who came in.  And can I just say the tater tots CHANGED MY LIFE.  They sprinkle them with powdered unicorn or something.  Pork spareribs, chicken breasts, chopped brisket and pulled pork were all AMAZING.  Dry rubbed like whoa, beautiful smoke ring on everything, and a char crust that soaked up sauce like it should.  We weren't brace enough to try the Fallen Angel sauce, but the sweet and sassy "God Sauce" was perfect for dipping, and the thin vinegar-based "Pig Sweat" was particularly good with the pulled pork and chopped brisket.  We will be back for sure to enjoy Jessie Rae's again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall Menu as of Oct 7, 2016

T4gdGDQLxe2ud59LqTFtkA.text: The size of the place was definitely smaller than I expected, but the food was delicious! I also wasnt sure if I would like the white sauce but I tried that out as well and loved it.

zLgqy6rwGZCFFwo0dlKM_g.text: There is no word but awesome!  Outstanding.  Award winning. Just add cobbler, pecan pie and real cutlery. Loose the VH1 tv!

n0zsxzIQ2kTVnrisLWNhag.text: One of the best bbq spots in town,the ribs are so bomb and  all the side dishes are delicious and the owner is friendly. And it has golden knights stuff all over the place, another reason i take my buisness there lol. #vegasstrong #goknightsgo

rdkRwb1P4_1Eg3og9YzKww.text: OMG, best bbq ever. Very tiny place with 6 tables but the food was fabulous. Small business with big heart,  and make sure you have a big appetite because they don't do small here. Very satisfied

dy5nqi30Ds3yICFW0lHQMw.text: I believe that I just had one of the worst BBQ dinners and service that I have ever had. First, I should blame myself for even thinking that I could get good BBQ in Las Vegas. I made an order through Grub Hub that was not delivered to the correct location despite the fact that I CLEARLY stated the delivery instructions when I made my order. When I finally received my order it was incorrect. I contacted Jessie Rae's and their response was that I have to contact Grubhub if I did not receive what I ordered. I found this response to be very disconcerting as Grubhub does not prepare the order. Finally, when I opened my order I found it to be nothing like the food that is advertised on their site. The meat on the sandwich was extremely dry and did not have any BBQ sauce on it. It was so dry that I did not even bother to finish the meal. I am sure that I would not try this place again even if they allowed me to eat for free. VERY dissatisfied with Jessie Rae's and Grubhub's response to my simple request. Save your money....and yourself from being disappointed....and try another place. They are not worth your time or money.  Bruce

aV2R5OgBdX-bdcBco7w_nA.text: Being from Houston, TX it's been hard to find a quality BBQ spot here in Vegas but this is the one! Glad I stopped in, has an authentic  mom and pop feel (always my favorite places to eat). Food  is great and fairly priced. With or without sauce, the meats are still moist and flavorful. Loaded fries are ridiculous !! Pretty much any type of meat you want served on waffle fries; a must try. Will be back often!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ chicken Baby back ribs Hot link Mashed potatoes Mac Loaded fries with chicken on top

Wj9m7uhYTnsdBpIlWywQ0w.text: Best ribs ever. Loved their corn and smoked butter and zesty potato salad. Def worth the trip

72mCdUwWxvp2qhVQukbYfg.text: Awesome spot. The maniac fries are unreal. Add on the sauces they have (gods sauce is the best), and you're in for a treat. The staff is super friendly, family run, and ensures that you enjoy your food. They've been open for 2.5 years and I wouldn't be surprised to see them expand in the future. Great spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NNwchintRl4eI92_kdeNFw.text: Best BBQ in the city. If you want fancy, go someplace else. If you want to enjoy some great food, spin on in.

GRh0DesznNERkOBsm8oeEQ.text: Found this place on Yelp and so glad I did! This is THE best bbq I've had in a really long time. Great food and awesome service!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tJLWbM6Z8Ld7_prYAKx_8A.text: Fabulous BBQ. Addicting sauces. Ribs are so tender. Bbq mashed potatoes are unique. Highly recommend

65xJQ8rXdOQRjWAwOrIxtQ.text: Ok food, cold when we got it...we were the last people to be served so I will give them that.  The lady was rude, and trying to close up for the night.

3Nhget2MNQDhoGtQWcK-pg.text: Kind of an interesting experience eating here for the first time. In town for a biz convention, got a hankering for some baby backs. Yelp retrieved this place with the improbable avalanche of suspiciously great reviews.  Uber dropped me at a hole in the wall that's cramped even by the limited standards of rib joints. Ordered the 1/2 rack of baby backs while dodging the elbows of the guy at the next table. Ribs appear quickly enough, but the sloppy, too-cool-to-want-to-be-good-at-his-job server promptly dumps them on my lap, staining my jeans.  The too-cool-for-this-shiznit dude hands me a couple of feet of the lowest spec of cheap paper towels -- the kind that doesn't actually absorb ANYTHING, much less bbq sauce -- and disappears.  Another guy (the owner? He seemed to care) has noticed and quickly brings out a damp towel for my jeans, which helped a lot.  So, not exactly a great first impression. And I was sitting there thinking I was going to one-star this place like nobody's business.  But then I bit into the first baby back. Holy crap. Kid you not, the best ribs of my entire life. Just amazing. Flawless, delicious, thick, meaty, juicy to the point of insanity.  My mind is still reeling, actually, and it's now hours later.  So count this as a ten-star review for the ribs, because they started five in the hole.    If I lived in Vegas I'd eat here a few times a week.  If you're visiting Vegas, you MUST plan to eat here.  You will NOT be sorry.

cXhqM91N2EAb-zTXzsfEKg.text: Great. Owner is really friendly and the Rae pork sandwich was really flavorful. I enjoyed their sweet BBQ sauce ; the fallen angel sauce is incredibly hot! You've been forewarned.   I also got to try one of their ribs , which also was tender.  Next time I will try their "we porked in Vegas" because during my five day excursion I wasn't so successful with the other type :(

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wN81gKESd9v9rDWi6MEINg.text: I will never eat here again! My husband and I went after work on a week night so we would not have to cook. We spent over 50 bucks for the high roller combo and the jive chicken sandwich combo. The high roller combo is misleading to think it is enough food for two people. It is not. We got the brisket and pulled pork. The brisket was dry and the pull pork tasted mushy. The jive chicken sandwich was good. It is over priced and you don't get enough food for money.

zneQs1IcCC1bjhNyb0sqhg.text: Came here on vacation. Stumbled into this amazing restraunt. The service was great. Rebecca served us. She was so fun and wonderful.  food was amazing. Had "The Duke" so good! Would definitely reccomend.  We will be back . Thanks again!

0Bf1v5szEVz1kIcSK0qO0w.text: Best bbq on the grid in Las Vegas! Small humble and slammin' with bbq and homemade sauces. Trust me on this one! Lets keep them alive folks. Just behind the  the soon to come Raiders Stadium.

6l5SfLoHTaLqic03BWh86w.text: I was in Vegas for the weekend and my buddy practically forced us to eat here for lunch and I must say, I'm sure glad he did. He had Jessie Rae's a couple days earlier, but said he wanted to eat it again since it was THAT good. I initially wanted to eat something on the lighter side but I thought what the hell, why not. I'll go to the gym to work it off (we'll see about that).  Ordered about $60 worth of food for 3 people (if you want a full meal with enough sides to go around, expect to spend around that much, which is normal for good bbq). We got ribs and pulled brisket for our meats and mac n cheese, coleslaw, baked beans, and corn for our sides.  Now I'm no southern BBQ connoisseur but I've tried a good number of places so I have a good sense of what's mediocre and what stands out. Jessie Rae's BBQ is the best I've had hands down. The sides were all delicious, especially the Mac n cheese. Cheesy but not gooey or mushy. The meat fell right off the bone for the ribs and when you dunk them into the sauces they provide, "MMMMM willy don't it make you wanna slap yo mama!!" (Friday reference, anybody?)   Will I make it to the gym tomorrow as I promised myself? Likely but not certain. Will I be returning here next time I visit Vegas? F*ck yes, without a doubt.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8uSpBXczJyqMpY74qADq6g.text: I don't usually give 5 stars because let's face it, very few things are perfect in this world. However, I have to give credit where credit is due and this place kmows its BBQ!   I had the three meat combo of brisket, pulled pork and hot link and all three were excellent! Nice smoky flavor and very moist, almost as good as what I make at home, LOL!  The side I had, the potato salad was definitely not made by Susan, LOL! I hope you get the comedic reference.  The only downside is the closer they get to closing the more likely they are to run out of various items.  It was strongly suggested by the cashier that for future reference to call ahead to make sure they have what you want and ask them to set it to the side for you.

A7_MFM9j926Gv9aRxDTDfg.text: I first went to this place when they were first opening sometime around early 2017. It was very small and only had like 3 or 4 tables. The food was good I remember thinking. A couple days ago I was reintroduced to it by my daughter. It has grown both in popularity and size. My daughter ordered brisket, pork ribs and Mac and cheese. I ordered pulled pork and cole slaw. The food was on point, and the servings are huge, well worth the price. JessieRaes BBQ, is doing big things. The staff is on top of their game, they know the regulars by name, and you generally don't find that level of service anymore these days. I hope they keep growing so we can get one closer to Silverado Ranch area, but until then I'll go where they are. Keep up the good work guys!

jXbKAegdhpYGv80t7RBa_A.text: I've visited Jessie Rae's a few times now and I feel confident is stating that their food is always awesome! Some of our favorites have been the Belt Buckle with waffle fries and brisket and an extra coating of their God Sauce plus the Two Meat with One Side Combo (I like Brisket and pulled pork plus mac and cheese). Try a corn muffin dripping in butte Portions are always so large, I need to bring some home! Food is served hot, juicy and just delectable!  Sauces are on the table for you to mix or find a favorite! God Sauce is not just a clever name but also created by the Sauce Gods! And the staff... Nifty Lady is super friendly and was quite patient with us on our first visit and Cute Boy was quick to the rescue when part of our order was accidentally incorrect. I will eventually try everything on the menu and I look forward to my upcoming visits to try something new!

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LOOK at this HUGE portion! Brisket, pulled pork, side of mac &amp; cheese plus a corn muffin! YUM!

bVmQ8cQZst-SS-uA0LM6ag.text: Had the brisket this time, absolutely wonderful. They truly nailed it. Nice thick cut PC's that had little fat. Tender as hell. Nicely done.

ClK77oOt5CXLv7VekLDviA.text: The food is awesome and the staff was great and very helpful and friendly especially the girl working the register

NS1K-uhQkuNoWQr3dtXK7g.text: I'm local... tried all the BBQ spots.. Jessie Rae's wins; what more do you need?   How about the amazing food!? I had the fortress and it was the most amazing thing I've ever owned. It was a rack of ribs, Mac and cheese, waffle fries, these amazing little meat thing, there was more.. oh geez t was just so much delicious I can't remember all of it.. darn it was good.. but they have an entire menu and I would order anything.. I will order everything, I just need more time!   If you're local.. this is your spot guys. The atmosphere is so chill you could hang out all day and the staff if awesome and engaging .. it's a fun place to be

vnK9yfGQR25ugR1dj3I_8w.text: The best BBQ I've ever had... Vegans better go near this place or they'll be converted to into a carnivores smoked meat inhaling monster with the slightest whiff of the smoky aroma that flows down the street, inviting everyone within a mile to come enjoy the delicious array of meats they have to offer. I'm in love I live in LA and haven't been to Vegas for 7 years but I'll be coming back extremely frequently for this amazing meat candy that melts in your mouth leaving you with an intense craving for MORE! The sauces are ridiculously amazing! The GOD sauce is BOSS! I had to bring some home with me for sure! I can't wait to try it on everything! Thanks for the BOMB GRUB!!! BTW  The service is great and extremely friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pound of brisket  Absolutely delicious !

FoPjxBN9l8Np5wsVQYr_MQ.text: The food is just ok. My wife had the brisket sandwich and I had a pulled pork sandwich. Neither of the meats were smoked. This is Ohio style barbecue, so expect coleslaw on your sandwich. Service was fine. The restaurant itself was a dirty hole in the wall and I felt grubby eating there. They'd have to change the interior before we would come back.

SAlseSQQEgAuYBoXBRNO6Q.text: Their food were really good! Chicken and pork are so tender! The host was really awesome! They are really great! We enjoyed the food and the services!!

DBYf76LeX-PI9edCXHOjrg.text: I came here with some of my family to have a late lunch. Miss Nancy was awesome! She knew the perfect size dinner some of us could share and even tweaked the Reaper BBQ sauce for my adventurous son to set his face on fire with! We had a couple different sandwiches (which were very generous on the meats) and a combo dinner with sides. Everything was soooo tasty but i gotta give those smoked mashed potatoes EXTRA love! Thanks again Nancy! We will all be back to see you real soon!

l88F3AGlwD4JCjZrD6rQlw.text: Without a doubt 5 star place. Best bbq I have had in my life. I ordered the loaded basket with waffle fries and brisket. Way more than I could eat in one sitting. The service was very friendly and food came very quick. I came in right after the lunch rush and the place was very cleanly tables were cleared within 2 minutes of showing up. 5 house bbq sauces are available to try at each table and they are all amazing. GET HERE NOW!!

1S0Y3FcOZUHdFVnege0stg.text: Very rarely anymore am I left dumbfounded and speechless with food. This was one of those rare times. I cannot begin to describe how delicious this bbq is! (My brother in Texas is going to kill me for saying that) . My husband and I were hooked from the very first bite. Great flavor combinations and sauces. They have four different bbq sauces to try and all are unique and good. Highly highly recommend. Great hole in the wall! And we found it through Yelp Pass it on.  P.s. TRY THE MANIAC FRIES

ON6_euoWOVy08NMDPMF9SA.text: I would give this place 10 stars if I could.  I love the tots with brisket.  The brisket is smoky, not dry, and has pieces of the bark that are like flavor grenades when you eat them.   Today, I had the smoked filet mignon.  The meat was juicy , tender smoky, spicy.   This guy is Rembrandt on a grill.  Don't let the crappy location, tables, and chairs detour you.  Underneath the rough exterior is some of the best BBQ you will ever eat.

VfXdo1wQATJ5I0SY_cCnEg.text: Best BBQ I've found in my 5 weeks in Vegas and surrounding area.  BBQ is a personal thing and people are full of opinions, but if you want good brisket, ribs, and chicken in very large portions, I highly recommend Jesse Rae's.

YU_nGMcIGaBpCgfa-UQdug.text: There times changed to 11:30 not 11. No matter I'll wait for great food and this place always is bomb.  In reply to mike: No worries man. I never minded waiting for your guys food. Good food takes time

9cxG0_B_hLMd3rGvMoX_8Q.text: In 2017 Jessie Rae's won a best in Vegas award for a sandwich.  Skeptically, we ordered the sandwich, and OH MY GOSH IT'S AMAZING.  We may go back again for a second time in 2 days to have this sandwich again.  IT'S THAT GOOD.  The restaurant itself is a little hole in the wall, in an industrial area - not much to look at from the outside.  Inside it's clean, the staff is super, super friendly, and the food is served hot and in generous portions.  5 kinds of barbeque sauce on the table. The winning sandwich was epically good. The maniac fries were unlike anything we'd ever had before, loaded with meat and mac and cheese - really fun.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

73evputOI35wxY4ANkb7Nw.text: Good ol' BBQ, the Beans & the corn! Where do you start? This is by far my favorite place to eat in The Valley.

ZAnrLhfDn1aZt_MhPl3TPw.text: These guys are by far the best ribs ive ever tasted and beleave me ive been to alot of diffrent places being a trucker always on the road thier ribs are just so meaty no fat at all and full of flavor brisket the best tri trip excellent chicken needs a lil work thier sides are dreaming good need to work on makeing them bigger though and thier filet migion also great pulled pork yummy i could go on and on about this place thier sauces are excellent

R24SLFEFh8U4LrqRcs5stQ.text: Awesome experience! Check out the video that I posted to see some of their meats that came with the "great variety" meal.

yXY8GP9zAaVy46gpORgmXw.text: AMAZING find. Everything we had was amazing. Great flavor, perfectly spiced. I loved the Maniac Fries, hot links, & Mac n cheese. Pig sweat sauce was phenomenal. Super friendly staff and quick service. Great lunch find.

5AAaQlonCmL5HiHS46xvrw.text: Food is great! I ordered the Duke, thinking it was a sandwich but it's not. Still very tender meat and tastes amazing. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because the menu is a little overwhelming. Hence the reason I thought I ordered a sandwich and did not. Overall great place for a quick bite. Very fast service.

qIYby6yw0D8DfFWkxiqnig.text: Yoooooooo this probably one of the best BBQ spots in town. Spent about $25 each with a group of 4 of us. And the food portion is unbelievably large. Definitely coming back! "The best part is the ass!"

zEkTIat-PRxRNI9HjKTV3Q.text: Wow! Brisket and waffle fries...and pulled pork. Gotta come back for the Mac and cheese.  Get there early.

mffMBkXsjFDlzd3WDfVa8A.text: Great food, comes out fast! Great place for a quick lunch. You can choose different portions depending if you want a light lunch or a heavy lunch

ugZjg-EhHyDJUlhxGSB0rg.text: Love Jessie Rae's BBQ!! The Duke fries are amazing and so is the God sauce!!! The owner is very nice and trust when you read other reviews they do run out of certain items everyday!! I will definitely be coming back and bringing a ton of people to try Jessie Rae's.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duke fries brisket sandwich and pork sandwich!

o_7cXBdK0CJDokv2UBdbAA.text: Best BBQ in Las Vegas. It feels like you grew up down the dirt road from 'em. Meat, sauce and sides couldn't be more delicious. Don't let the divey dining room discourage you from making this a weekly habit. All I want is for them to open up another location next to me again!

3hxJPSDAgVVzVRmgM0iPxw.text: Very disappointed. The food was underwhelming for the hype and the price. One sandwich that cost roughly 15 bucks, ($3 more because I made it a combo) was the size of a Mc Double with hard and dry pulled pork and very oddly flavored brisket. The Signature sandwich "The Jesse Rae" sounded fantastic, yet it did not have the cheese and the pork was like jerky there was no moisture besides the slaw. This was also upgraded to a combo for $3 more which was to include 1 side and drink. We got both of the sides, corn was ok, the mac and cheese tasted like boxed, but the drinks did not make the journey. Elements of this meal were good, the sausage was great and the slaw was cool and flavored well. When all was said and done I paid $46 ($60 after delivery, taxes and tip) for 3 sandwiches and 2 sides. The driver was kind and polite and the food got here very quickly, but the meal was a dud and there was no napkins, no utensils and no condiments. All in all, would not recommend.   This was a delivery order, so maybe some of the charm is lost by not being at the restaurant. But, buying lunch for your co-worker makes you look like a chump when you pay a ton and the food is caca with nothing to wash it down.

Ex1baMNBA2tYz8ojlBMUCw.text: Great BBQ, the belt buckle is a must-have. You won't be disappointed. I don't live here in Las Vegas but I stop by when I'm in town.

bLX9zmGjmdXHpU4ZVkKQqw.text: Great place. I am from North  Carolina  and this is best BBQ I have found in Las Vegas. Small place but big value. Would have gave five stars if place was bigger,which I am sure they will be as they grow.

WLuKyp1_5EqUS5Aj8pNKyA.text: Revised  7/20/2016  Well like I said the first time I went to this place it was awesome the second time it wasn't that great but I decided to give it another try and once again the food is awesome as well as the service I talked to one of the owners I don't know his name but he explained to me but they were going through a transition period and that was probably why my last visit wasn't that great, but as of right now thw food is awesome and I will defenetly will go back

00bYBWKjZvRREiy3So5fOw.text: This was my first (and definitely not my last) visit!!  The food is excellent. The meat on the baby back ribs melted off the bone. The BBQ chicken nachos are to die for!!! The special Alabama sauce that is on the is very good. The staff is very courteous. Even one of the chefs came out to see us.

0hOGDb-lGLMCb2jbWRzv4w.text: Great place owner was very friendly! We will definitely be back, two huge platers of food, you won't finish it all but be prepared to take some home. It's a small place so be sure to come at an off time or order pick up!

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Comes with a complete variety of meats and size, two huge platers of food fed 4 of us, completely stuffed.

-YtSaeBzUeC-u0DOwLyKXA.text: The food is always great and so is the staff. definitely a must for fans of good BBQ.

gG0yL7mO7nEe04jL_yWqdw.text: We had brisket, baby back ribs, and hot links. All three were great! Staff was friendly and ordering was easy. Place was a little snug on seating but the owner said they were expanding next door. When we are in Vegas this where I will go for BBQ.

ACx1B47_JVsCBpGxk_Oz9A.text: Excellent.  All the food was beyond excellent. I myself have struggled to find excellent bbq in Las Vegas so I feel very fortunate to have found this place. I am excited to try the baby back ribs the next time I come back. The brisket and spare ribs were fantastic.

AU52orKrX2335Cylb0FZ9A.text: My wife and I both had the Jessie Rae sandwich. Absolutely delicious! The BBQ was tender and full of flavor and the sauce was perfect-great flavor and a little spicy. Side of corn-good, mac n cheese-great! Delivery was quick also. Definitely recommend.

bBZ7xYg2wS2_m2WSik-LOg.text: Best bbq I've ever had. Waited till I went twice to write this review to make sure. I suggest you order the fries and their God sauce is the best bbq sauce I've ever had. The people who work their front are super friendly and attentive. Both times I came here they gave me extra food to try on top of what I ordered. This time it was the beef ribs. YUM. I'm not a religious man.......but these guys are doing gods work.

gJjb7_NSigWB-76LBBSqeQ.text: Great barbecue food and not expensive. We had the ribs, pulled pork, brisket and criss cut fries and they were all phenomenal. Very good quality and juicy meat and a simple great tasting barbecue sauce. Friendly, down to earth staff who create a nice laid back environment to enjoy some great barbecue.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 meat combo with pulled pork, brisket and ribs

AaHw1E_LKnHhcdUUn-eIfA.text: I'll give it three stars because they're trying, but I won't be back. 1. The place is SMALL.  It's not really worth it to try to eat there.  I was forced to eat outside at the picnic table.  A table that doesn't get wiped down too often BTW.   2.  The girl at the front counter needs to learn to stop texting when a customer comes up to order.  She also needs to learn to bring napkins with her when she brings food to the guy sitting outside. 3.  They ran out of Brisket.  How does a BBQ place run out of their most popular meat by 3:00PM? 4.  Their current location is in a sorta seedy part of town.  It's not very close to where anybody lives.  Since the store is so small they sort of depend on take out, but I don't really think the place is worth the drive.    I used to live in Texas and to be honest there really aren't any good BBQ places here in Las Vegas.  So I am hard to please when it comes to BBQ.  I wish these folks well.  I hope they can move to a larger restaurant soon for their own sake.

W3LNnvUzntpeY6RvunRZhg.text: I was recommended JESSIE RAES by a person that knows Food. The Food was so good, but that was before my wife pointed out the place needed some severe cleaning. Initially I wanted to blame the status of the place on a good rush but their wasn't an influx of people coming through and the guy that's stood at the front staring at his electronic devices was very capable of finding the time for cleaning a little.  Its sticky and dusty! Dust bunnies with more than A seasonal age were by the front order area. Nothing seems to get wiped down. Just imagine

u82bmf7lDOt4_kWcbmuseQ.text: Finally found great BBQ in Vegas. Great brisket wonderful flavor in the sauces. This will be my new spot.

1n7lFdwYUX6oWJvDbj1NHw.text: I ordered the 3 meat. Ribs,brisket, and pulled pork.  I also ordered cornbread. They didn't give me the cornbread for starters. They gave me a slice of brisket that was 99 percent fat. The ribs were very fatty, and the pulled pork was sitting in a half inch of grease. The food was not even edible. Terrible. Never again.

rroMuX5MNcAihO-pubxbkw.text: We used a groupon.  Pickup order.  We had the 2 person deal.  Supposedly $48. Worth of food for $31.  Plus $4.53 extra for ?  2 sides, 2 drinks.  We got 2 sides for 1 person, no drinks.  Sides are less than a quarter cup.  Meats are good, but very small portions.  I will never use another groupon, anywhere, as most businesses it's the kiss of death for portion size and service.  That statement is 100% True, here.  Between being pushed around for 5 star ratings by the owner's mother  who handles the front end...and the over confidence of how good their food is, this is not a place we will return to.  Don't take advantage of people who are earnestly looking for their new favorite bbq place.  I felt ripped off, we work hard for our money and the lack of respecting that here, is breath taking.

yiDYwDOBnfJeHnHfw_EXQQ.text: Well the day finally came, when finally made it here. I have been trying to get to Jessie Rea's BBQ since they opened for 3 reasons. One they're "Award Winning" sign out front, two they are super close the my work and three all the Yelp reviews.  Ever since they opened their doors they have been instantly getting raving reviews. Then one day my co-worker went there for lunch and she was hook. I got to try a piece of her brisket and burnt end that day and I too was hook ans was craving for more. I am a bit surprise it took me so long to try them out but I eventually did and I was very happy camper.  Pulling up into to the restaurant in an industrial office area where most cafes and food joint like this caters to surrounding business you don't expect much and as you walk in there's not a whole lot...just a couple of tables and chairs no fuss no muss just the essentials and straight to the point BBQ.   A guy name James took my order over the phone being super helpful and suggestive, as well as everyone there. I placed an order for 2 sandwiches with one being free because of a handy dandy coupon I had. After checking in on Yelp I also was suppose to receive a free a small kool-aid but they were out so I got a full bottle of soda instead, "sweet I scored thanks Jessie's BBQ". The amazing smell of BBQ when you walk in makes your stomach growl and your mouth water. I couldn't wait to dig in.  The Jessie's sandwich was full of juicy pull pork and amazing slaw and I hate slaw but their's was so good. The sauce was freaking awesome and even though I didn't get potato chips on my sandwich like I was suppose to it was still bomb. The Brisket sand was killer, of coarse it was because of the brisket, the Mac a cheese was cheesy and deliciousness. The sausage though tasted a little like store bought sausage when the the menu made it sound like it made made in house and amazing. I'm not sure if it is made in house or store bought but I really didn't care for it and. Any how all of that was sandwiched between two amazing buttery buns with softest warmest and not over kill with the dough.   Each sandwich costs around $11-$14 bucks with no sides or soda but for about $3 or so more you can make it a combo. A little too much for an everyday lunch for me but it was worth it and that's BBQ price for you. So the next time I want to splurge on lunch I will definitely splurge here.

ZptVxTm_3p6dgGTERc5Log.text: Thanks to my co-worker who took me here for the 1st time since it is down the street from our work.  I must say hands down to the BEST BBQ place I have ever tried.  It is a hole in the wall with not much seating,  but the food is amazing.  It can be a wait during lunch time, but let me tell you it is worth it!!!  I ordered the BBQ pork sandwich with waffle fries.  It seriously was to die for!!  The portions are huge and I had leftovers for the next day.  The pricing is worth it for all the food you get.  You definitely don't get ripped off here!  I must say this place is #1 in my book and when family or friends come to visit I am bringing them to this secret hideaway.  Forget Lucille's BBQ or Famous Dave's!  This place is above and beyond!

gJC_b_sk8oThF3OKcRmmBA.text: My wife ani are at Lucelies a few days ago and the brisket and ribs was good.  However today we ate at Jessie Raez and we will never go back to Lucelies again. NsXA7RoGtdlEabn57SFaZg.text: I wanted to give them a second chance, and I didn't regret it. But this time I placed my order directly through them, not a third party delivery service. It turned out great, delivery time was acceptable and the food was decadent.

NapyldwrLpmVQf2-EgB7Sw.text: Wife and I came here for the first time with a groupon. Got pulled pork, chicken and hot links. All were awesome!! Slaw and tots for sides also good! Can't wait to come back for the brisket and ribs!

e-LK5GmQB_ngKqLj7XlSlg.text: Yes, it may be small, but don't let the size fool you.  This is some of the top BBQ in town, almost as good as Texas BBQ, the portions are HUGE we shared a plate with an additional hot link.   The sauces were fantastic watch out for the hot one though, because it was HOT! The flavor was very good, but it was hot. The other sauces were excellent, also.   The ribs were excellent, we had the pork ribs and not the beef, but the table next to us had the beef ribs and they looked amazing as well. I haven't seen beef ribs that looked as good as these west of Houston Texas.   The brisket was cooked as good as any I have had in Vegas, you could tell it was done low and slow.   The pulled pork was cooked with care, you could also tell that this was done correctly and that the bone came right out with ease as the meat was tender and delicious.  The only thing that wasn't off the chain was the hot link, which I would have again, but I would prefer my hot links to have more spice to them. Also at a place such as this, I prefer to see them making the hot links & sausage in house, I do not believe that they are here.   Over all this is an excellent BBQ joint even though it is small. Good things do come in small packages.   -Allen

GqhWdVI2m_pkoBQRLrn30A.text: Jessie Rae's BBQ...what can I say...BEST BBQ I HAVE EVER HAD!!!!!!!!! The food was AMAZING!! The sauces to die for!!! We drive through Las Vegas six times a year, and each time we come from now on our first stop will be JESSIE RAE'S!!! If you are in Vegas do yourself a flavor, I mean favor, and EAT HERE!!!!

aZfCtULbA-1T-XLI8wALRw.text: Gluton. I am a gluten for punishment.   Ordered the High Roller 2 meat combo for 2 people, and the Cesar Salad via Eat 24 for delivery. Got the beef and pork ribs as my meats. For starters, no utensils, no bbq sauce, no salad dressing, and no napkins. Although I asked in the comment section for all but the utensils and napkins. (thought they would be automatic). First Pork Rib I pull out of the box actually great. All down hill from there, ever other piece was burnt beyond recognition, Same for the Beef Ribs, burnt beyond recognition. (See pics). This was borderline Jerky. Cesar Salad, was shredded cabbage with croutons and yellow and white cheese. No dressing. Who the heck makes a shredded cabbage Cesar Salad? This place might win awards for thier cherry picked items cooked to perfection for judges, but the day to day fare has no quality control and just generally sucks. To add insult to injury, smoked butter on the corn adorned all the the boxes and the bag. See pics for validation if I can upload them. .

SJlh3KbxhEWYBELgl36uTg.text: Growing up in Georgia, j know a thing or two about good BBQ and BBQ restaurants. It's so hard to find decently priced good BBQ in Vegas and I stopped eating Rollin' Smoke once they sold out to Pawn Stars and raised their prices. I was super excited to try Jessie Rae's after driving by it on my way to work and  decided to eat here yesterday, 11/15/17, for the first time and it will probably be my last. It was the lunch rush so it was crowded and considering how small the place is, this was handled pretty well. What I didn't appreciate was my food. I ordered the maniac fries which, as the menu says, are fries covered in mac and cheese, brisket, hot link, and bama sauce. I was charged a .75 up charge for the brisket, even though it was included with the item, and then I had to remove about 70% of the brisket as it wasn't meat, it was fat. It was a disgusting amount of fat that I tried to all keep contained to the wrapper my corn muffins came in, but it quickly spread outside of that radius and at it's peak, it was taller than the plate my food came in. I was there with a rather large group and the other person in my group who had brisket said he had the same problem, just not as severe as me. It was absolutely disgusting and over the top greasy food. I would steer clear of this "award winning" BBQ at all costs. I'm not a fan of Rollin' Smoke with how their prices have gone up, but at least the quality of their food is far superior to Jessie Rae's!  Edit: And what a helpful response from someone who works there! Seeing as how that was my first time there, how am I supposed to know that I need to specify what amount of fat I want for my food? I've been to TONS of BBQ places and that's never been a question. If that's an option, then whoever is taking your order should ask each customer when they place their order how much fat they'd like. And to say it's my fault that I didn't specify it because some of your customers like fatty meats, that's ridiculous. If you don't like the fact that I didn't bring it up to your staff when they were slammed and had a line out the door, or that I posted this review just one day after, then that's ok in my book. Classy customer support from the establishment. And yes, I mentioned your competitor and how 1, I don't go there anymore, and 2, about the quality of their food. If that's referencing them a lot, then I guess I'm guilty. Sorry the truth hurt with this review, but you won't have to worry about anymore from me as I won't be going back again, which I was willing to do because I wanted to try your pork and I think your sauces are great. Oh well, no loss in my book!

i8Wy5QjaJirt9X1fUAwhng.text: I went here with my fiance and the restaurant was easy to find, even with a small sign outside. We walked in an hour after opening and all the tables were filled. They only 3 or 4 tables so absolutely no room.   While we were standing in line to order, we were always in someone's way. Drink machine, or condiment table. I had to go outside and wait after we ordered just because you start to feel Claustrophobic.   We got our food and went home to eat it. Did we want to eat there, yes of course but no room...   The ribs and brisket were amazing. This is meat that needs no sauce because it's so flavorful! I did try the sauce and also good! The coleslaw was just as good! I could easily eat 2 more orders of that. So creamy!  The only thing I didn't like was the Mac & Cheese. It tasted like box mac and cheese... No salt, no pepper, wasn't gooey cheesey and pasta was overcooked. I would love to give the other sides a try for sure!   Thank you for bringing good food to vegas.

nNU2dm8pb6biQCo2RhBIwg.text: Alright this was an interesting experience. First off, I love BBQ, so much so that I created Campfire BBQs Yelp Page for them. Luv to you Stefan!  Came here on a Tuesday night, after hours. This other really cool Sarah got the owner Mike to open up for a Meet Up group of about 14, so we had a catered style event.  Appetizer - Big Belt Buster: Mac n cheese, burnt ends of the brisket, BBQ sauce, etc, overall it was good but I appreciate good meat so I didn't need it all combined.  Sides - Mac n Cheese: overall it was good, except the portion I had was heavily peppered, to the point I didn't eat it - Corn: absolutely amazing with their seasoned "queue the trumpets' butter - BBQ Mashed Potatoes: very good and heavy - Green Bean Casserole (cause it's my restaurant and I can): I love green bean casserole and this did not disappoint.  Meat - Chicken: amazing, juicy, moist, perfect  - Pulled Pork: great texture and worked very well with the BBQ Sauce - God's Sauce - Brisket: A-OK, but I'm a snob on this because of Stefan - Pork Ribs: tender and fell off the bone, good flavor - Rib Tips Sausage: wow - this was new to me, they make it in house, grinding and all, it was spicy and really different  Overall - I'd come back when I'm in the mood for a heavy lunch, super close to work and only open during the week for lunch. They do have another location inside Cactus Jack's Saloon so you can get their food there 11am - 4am in case you can't make it here. Check it out, when the weather is nice, they have a small patio as well.

Bad Location:  In the middle of the raw construction supplies district where there are no other restaurants or residences for miles, very inconvenient.  And there are only 5 parking spots.  The inside is just big enough for 5 dirty tables and a sticky floor.  Poor Service:  The girl behind the counter was so inept that I almost felt sorry for her.  It was like they randomly picked a girl at a shopping mall and threw her behind the register to take orders 10 minutes before I arrived.  She was completely aloof.  The menu is not user friendly, some items don't describe to you what they are.  I asked other people in line and they agreed the menu was difficult to understand.  Overpriced Food:  It would take a lot of BBQ sauce to cover the mistakes with the dry $12 brisket.  My order was incorrect but since my first interaction was such a pain I said screw it and tried it.  So bad I just got up and left.  "God Sauce" is a stupid name and is mildly offensive.  I would not recommend this place.

JmRZlDTzHrN-ZmBGFFZ8IA.text: Barbecue takes patience and know how. I'm not graced with either gift, so I prefer to grab smoky succulent meat out when the craving strikes. My love of barbecue was unleashed in Austin, Texas. I can't get there as often as I'd like, so I must search for meaty goodness near home. I don't like chains so for a long time the valley was lacking in options.   Thankfully, times have changed and the valley is now home to some pretty great barbecue. While some are growing by leaps and bounds, others are just getting their start like Jessie Rae's BBQ. They are a small operation putting love into everything they do. Open for lunch Monday thru Friday, plus an occasional Saturday.   Just minutes from the strip on Valley View, you'll be greeted with a waft of smoke that fills the air when you pull up to the quaint building that is home to Jessie Rae's BBQ. A friendly "hello" welcomes you at the door, the menu is simple but offers variety. If you're lucky, the owner Mike will suggest daily specials. You'll find the best selection if you go early. When they run out, that's it for the day. It's also worth a mention that all sauces are made in house. Prices are not cheap, but real barbecue never is.   The dining room is tiny so they have a steady stream of carry-out business. My brother and I were fortunate to find a seat. It took only a few short minutes before Mike brought out our grub. My combo was Pulled Pork and sliced Brisket ($14). He opted for the Double Brisket sandwich for ($12). Both had the choice of one side, we each chose the Mac N Cheese. The combo offered a hearty portion of meat, more than I could finish. Both meats were very good. I don't know that I could choose one over the other. Which is going to make the choice difficult on future visits. The brisket was extremely tender, it had a nice smoke ring and it was loaded with flavor. It was great on its own and even better with God's sauce or Fallen Angel for a more fiery bite. The Pig Sweat was the third sauce option, and I know it is customary for pulled pork, but it's too vinegary for my liking. My brother enjoyed his sandwich too; tender brisket with the extra benefit of bold and flavorful burnt ends. The bun was fresh and it was dense enough to support the weight of the meat - which can be a feat in itself. Good eatin' for sure. I just love these mom & pop gems.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sliced brisket and pulled pork with mac n cheese

vKKU5o-6Jv-pqn7X-HzE-A.text: Badass bbq packed into a tiny little space. I had the brisket and the pulled pork. Brisket was pretty good but the pulled pork was fantastic. Wife had Mac and cheese loaded with pulled pork which she loved. Their "fallen angel" reaper sauce is super flavorful and packs a punch but the heat doesn't overpower the flavor. The "god sauce" was just no BS bbq sauce, super tasty.  Owner is straightforward and blunt while still being polite, which is refreshing in today's world of being scared of words. Next time I'm in Vegas I'll be back.

Ah4FmhfKe9HeQLrMGrfW3g.text: How did I like Jessie Rae's bbq? I don't....I loved it!    I still remember my first time visiting them. My friend and I were super hungry...munchies to say...and agreed that the best decision for food at the time was good old bbq. Started talking about what would one get such as rib tips or baby back ribs or brisket. Talking got us even hungrier, so we looked up some joints. These guys came up with some good reviews, done.   First time going in I got the duke. Fire. This time around I got the maniac. Flame. Hot links on top of a bed of Mac and cheese on top of waffle cut fries with a choice of meat, I chose brisket. This, this was goodness. You had cheesy fries, creamy cheese with a tangy bbq taste from the brisket sauce. Going to need to order another soon. I also ordered the large portion for around $25. It's well worth it. It can feed up to 6 people if eating the right portions.  In my case i could've made it into 4 decent sized portions.  They also offer some nice sauces. White sauce was my favorite and was recommended by the lady working there. Kudos. I'll be back.

kAnNUqWRPivtDAdDBUHYUw.text: Jessie Rae's BBQ is our go-to spot to fill our BBQ cravings. I was starting to give up on this town ever having decent BBQ until we discovered Jessie Rae's. I think since we have been patronizing the business we have sampled pretty much everything their menu has to offer.   I cannot say there was a single item that was disappointing -- sure, some were over indulgent items that my old, beat down body can no longer handle, but that does not take away from the sheer deliciousness and innovative nature of some of the times. Some of my favorites consist of Maniac Fries  which are loaded with mac n cheese sausage and brisket, The "Jessie Mac" sandwich, their brisket, pulled pork and hot links. As far as the sides go I always enjoy the corn with smoked butter and BBQ beans. You also do have an option to choose from their three signature sauces. if ordering the additional sauces do cost extra and you have to keep scrolling and select the sauce of your choosing at the bottom. The staff is courteous but most of my orders have been delivery or take out. You cannot go wrong with Jessie Rae's when needing that quality BBQ fix.

0a94n6vlOQ2xXyshHUPqDA.text: Vegas has another great BBQ joint! While I am big fan of Rollin' Smoke BBQ on the other side of town, Jessie Rae's BBQ just knocked my bib off! The steady stream of regulars and visitors alike come to get their big, bold and tasty smoked meat fix here for good reason. I observed several meals come out while waiting on mine featuring Ribs, Brisket, Chicken, Pulled Pork and Hot Links to their Large Sandwiches & Sides with EVERY platter piled high. Bring your appetite.....Jessie Rae's fills your plate like your Grandma did with her Sunday Dinner with Family!   Now, the moment I've been waiting on for three weeks since I caught my first glimpse of Jessie Rae's BBQ on IG...the Fortress has arrived....BOOM!!! The gluttonous genius who created the Fortress has my respect, gratitude and admiration for this brilliant BBQ Feast! It all starts with a meaty, full rack of St. Louis Ribs, which were masterfully rubbed and stood upright into a circle making a bowl. Take that as a base and stuff it full of Mac & Cheese, Waffle Fries topped with Brisket & sliced Hot Links and you my friends have a Fortress!  Jessie Rae's BBQ is 100% LEGIT! Next time you're in Vegas stop on by for a meal that will satisfy your BBQ lovin' lips! #vegasbbq #fortress #jessieraesbbq

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fortress at Jessie Rae&#39;s BBQ!
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yup....that&#39;s a full rack of ribs stuffed with Mac &amp; Cheese, Waffle Fries topped with Brisket and Hot Links!

Don't judge this place on location, interior, or customer service. Just go for the food, because that is all that matters. This isn't The Capital Grill.

ljKMtHgwuebOnYSQu93XnA.text: Haven't eaten here yet, but it's a for-sure the next time we're in Las Vegas. Anything good enough for James Brownstone is sho'-'nuff worth a try!  LATER:  I did eat there, and everything was fabulous -- a bbq fanatic's dream. And the God Sauce lives up to its name. Extra special touch: when I told the counter lady I was there because of James Brownstone, she handed me a paperback copy of Feared by Hell, signed by Anderle. The restaurant is well off the strip, but definitely worth the short trip.

UZQdTdaTKK2pTlzGzmsaJg.text: I don't like barbecue yet this place was delicious.  I mostly am not a fan of sauce so I tried the brisket without sauce and it was fall off the bone good.  Whatever it was seasoned with without sauce was amazing.  The corn, macaroni and waffle fries were all yummy.    My kids loved the macaroni too (2 & 4yo). My 2yo meat eater liked the brisket and fries also.  My 4yo more plain carbohydrate water just ate macaroni (she didn't like the sauce on the corn but she was fine).  My husband and cousin bathed their brisket in a mixture of the sauces they had on the table, utilizing the paper towel roll on the table more than my kids.  It's a small, kind of hole in the wall place but the girl serving us/at the register was really nice and the food was good.  Overall I was impressed and would definitely come again.

Wcly1RpYcu472FN8-RgfvA.text: One of our must go places when we visit Las Vegas. Best BBQ I've ever eaten. So delicious. Can't stress it enough. The ladies there were also very nice & helpful.

I had the pulled pork and chicken over tots with bbq sauce and ranch on top.  Was very good.  New Vegas BBQ place of choice!

J2r8RTwbUrd3mgp0dZZ9bQ.text: I was raised partially in the Memphis & St. Louis/KC BBQ scenes and am a fan of not going too heavy with sauce as the flavor of the meat itself should be sufficient to carry the experience. I lived in California for ten odd years and the best they had to offer was Lucille's BBQ (a nice experience, but very subpar BBQ in general). This is the best BBQ I've had on the West coast period. And every sauce they offer is disgustingly good. They have some oddball menu items that are insanely overpriced (get the BBQ fries sometime and I imagine you'll be as disappointed that a 20 dollar dish comes with a bed of 11 fries) but are good nonetheless. Their biggest downfall is just that they're too popular. Whether it be a pickup order or a delivery through a third party, expect it to be late and expect it to be missing something.

x51UPWMWqP1CL64SlKsTog.text: 2nd time coming here and it's the best for hometown BBQ in Las Vegas. The ribs are finger licking good and the meats just fall off the bone. Just the right amount of smoke and their sauces are on point. They expanded their eating area and they also have a puppy for a party of 6 too. If you want it delivered, they use all of the food delivery services.

aQVeW6Inevn_L0issJdwew.text: The top notch service would bring me back to give it a retry but the reality is, it has to be the Ribs, Brisket and hot links. I  travel a lot and would pit this to any. Extremely good and the hot bbq sauce was an awesome warmth with great flavor, not just burning like most.

wqvTdBDLHK-5LLk87J8GVA.text: To be perfectly honest, I'm from a huge skeptic on bbq. I have had some of the best. I've been to Kansas City, Kentucky, Alabama, and grew up in Texas close to Louisiana. I'd stack the brisket I just had here toe to toe with any other cut of meat I've ever had. Great work, I'll definitely be back. 10/10 recommend

ykWncmLvWkb7jCLPB25CKw.text: I just moved back to Las Vegas from North Carolina. Out in NC it is not hard to find good bbq. However, after moving back to Las Vegas it didn't take long for me to get the usual bbq craving. I tried out another place here in town that competes with Jessie Rae's. It was pretty good, but nothing special. I then tried Jesse Rae's and boom!! This is the real deal. My pulled pork sandwich drenched in God's sauce and the eastern NC sauce could not have tasted better. I had some good bbq out in NC, but I am pretty sure this is the best I've ever had. Get the Jesse Rae sandwich with waffle fries on the side and you won't be disappointed.

V46mg7rMcFCRQ6tZ64io7A.text: Just tremendous. If I could give this place six stars I would. no atmosphere but the food is some of the best I have ever had. If you're in Las Vegas looking for great food fair prices and large portions this is your place

_fPQWirPLeaC7AF2_h1glg.text: If your looking for a filling meal with great portions size give this a shot. Staff was friendly, and quick. Brisket was really good, sausage was t bad either. JuKtVuBHN_AcCnKzVjqTCw.text: Stopped in last nite after the gym, after driving by so many times and smelling the smoke I couldn't take it no more, they have tons of different options but I ended up going for brisket and spareribs with mashed potatoes. That brisket tho is ridiculously good, they give you a lot too, not to fatty and very tender and flavorful. The spare ribs were also seasoned perfect and put that spicy bbq sauce is the perfect pair. (Thanks manny for suggesting that ) the mashed potatoes were bomb as well and I think I'm gonna get this combo every time I go back in there. The total was around 18 dollars but you won't feel cheated when you leave and you won't be hungry either when your done. You get what you pay for and it is worth it for sure. You should give it a try.

QGNBD17nV2tW72-_bKSHbA.text: I ordered food through post mates;  corn, macaroni, ribs, and chicken. The food I received was delicious however I did not receive my corn. I also asked that the sauce be on the side because I was sharing with my daughter which they disregarded. Overall an 8 out of 10

A-HaKz2fZt6En8JTZw2bvg.text: The best bbq I have ever had! Moist, tender, fall off the bone baby back ribs and rib tips. The God sauce is a must as well! The macaroni and cheese and mashed potatoes are AMAZING as well as the pulled pork sandwich! If you are in Vegas, you need to eat here, you will not be disappointed. I wish this place was in Orange County. Highly recommend eating here.

aeutrslQ96IhkyzwKkhIqg.text: Boy I must have came at a bad time. How can you serve dry tough brisket. Mac & cheese no flavor. Was very disappointed for my first time going by the reviews. My next trip to Vegas I'll stick to Rollin Smoke. Two stars for the sauce, real good.

xB3Bg7ufAaz2ueUtgFEDmw.text: Best BBQ I've ever had....and I've grown up and lived in the south my whole life. The pulled pork was so moist that it didnt need extra sauce. Definitely worth a visit!

JbZVkuyvJBmbDMZTDNJGbg.text: Ugh, I hate to say it but... it wasn't good... I've been eyeing this place for a while, all of the reviews and pictures had me drooling. So my friend and I made our way over yesterday and... behold disappointment! We tried the meat and side sampler that's available with a Yelp check-in ($16pp). It came with Brisket, Pork Baby Back Ribs, Beef Ribs, Pulled Pork, and BBQ Chicken. The sampler produced lots of food but honestly wasn't worth it. Most of the meet was really dry. The brisket and pulled pork were least dry but just OK. Both turned out pretty fatty. The pulled pork was actually juicy in some parts and was fall apart consistency but dry and chunky in other parts.  Sides were OK, we got Mac n Cheese, Corn, Beans, Potato Salad, and some weird chunky potatoes - kind of like breakfast potatoes that had mash mixed into them? Mac n Cheese is my favorite side but it was not cheesy at all. It actually did not resemble what I have seen in other pictures at all. My favorite side here was the potato salad which I am usually not a fan of but it was the best side here. Food tasted like it wasn't fresh, especially the meat. The beef ribs were especially dry. Like super stiff pieces, dry. The food is nothing I would come back for but the home made BBQ sauce and the nice owner is what added a star. I actually felt bad because the owner asked how we liked the food and I wanted to tell him! I felt bad doing so in front of other customers. It's a tiny place and you will not have a conversation at your table without all the other tables hearing it. Think, size of a master bedroom. Who knows may be if the food was fresh it would taste better? I can't see how it wouldn't.
