T0BM5hHXYtjOgPEf1ROwYw.text: Jessie Rae's has some flavorful BBQ with exceptionally tasteful bbq sauce. The staff were friendly and helpful as it was my first time at this place. I tried the two meat combo with rib tips and brisket with mac and cheese which I was surprised by how well the different spices and flavors blended so well with meat. I also had the Maniac Fries with pulled pork which was also delicious.The only reason why I'm not giving it 5 stars is due to them not having cornbread, and I really wanted to try their cornbread after seeing pictures on yelp, which they apologized for stating that the bakery didn't make any, but other than that one of the top BBQ places in Las Vegas.

zSNfzzz8M5EHJ8zwsJKk2g.text: I completely forgot to do a food review on Jessie Rae's BBQ. Back in April 2016 Jessie Rae's catered our "After Wedding Hangover BBQ" and the food was absolutely delicious. We had a budget and they provided more than enough food plus extras. Some places could have sold me everything and be just shy over or under my budget but i felt we got more Jessica gave me exactly what we wanted for a great price.   The food was delivered on time and the person that delivered it "I believe he was the other owner" was awesome he was very helpful getting all the food setup and answered all of our questions as we were hung over and drooling ready to eat.    We had 55 guest to entertain and they all were blow away about the bbq. If I could write 55 reviews for each person that attended they would all give Jessie Rae's 5 stars with great comment.   I apologize Jessica that I didn't right a review sooner but I will stop by next time my wife and i are craving BBQ which is all the time :)   S

x9FBHYt1lf10RpuVCv86_A.text: I tried this restaurant a month ago with 3 other people. We were all blown away of the taste, quality and portion sizes of the plates we ordered. It was very very good. I will definitely be going back.

l-TCzIyXog-c8VsU1ppyBg.text: Best. Pulled. Pork. Sandwhich. EVER!!!!!!!! It was so good! And the bbq sauce took me back to bbq I. North Carolina!!!!!! I will be back very very soon!

EC1uOdi0v9Dczk8HyMj9ug.text: Highly recommended. The food is delicious. I would recommend looking at the menu before ordering. The only two negative things that I have to say is the mother-in-law that answers the phone could be a lot more customer friendly and when they package things to be delivered that they take time to make sure that nothing is going to spill. I highly recommend the house barbecue sauce, our family doesn't care for the pigs sweat sauce. The Angel sauces pretty delicious. The beans are tasty and the corn is perfectly cooked. I've tried everything on the menu and have had them cater a couple company events. We really like the owner and the way that he's taking care of us.

Qsex8JXkiZWnGZhmXLvkgg.text: I am currently eating the best BBQ I have ever had in my life. This place is amazing! We ate the brisket, ribs and the Duke fries. Everything was phenomenal. He also brought out some smoked corn which was the best.   The dining area is small, but don't let that stop you. It's so worth it! The owner was so friendly and genuinely cared about his customers and wanted to be sure everyone loved what they were having.  We will be regulars :)  OH! And the prices were great too. Especially for legit bbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These Duke fries put carne asada fries to shame. SO YUMMY!

gIHZjiD_EYfhgnEOChTkbA.text: Don't let the industrial area fool you, Jessie Rae's BBQ is da bomb! If you try the Maniac fries- it's a meal in itself (small one easily feeds two...my sister and I split) waffle fries on the bottom stacked with delish Mac n Cheese, incredible pulled brisket, sausage link slices with 2 home made BBQ sauces drizzled on top. As if THAT wasn't enough, we scored the Yelp $16 prefix meat combo plate.  Another split option- chopped BBQ chicken, whole sausage link, 2 fall off the bone pork ribs and a hefty side of Mac n cheese.  Small joint (5 tables) some outside picnic tables with super friendly staff and patrons. Can't wait to go back! Worth your effort!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maniac fries?  Oh hell yes!

VXOFJM_mRNlx76tWZAhD7w.text: Come stop by Jessie Rae's BBQ and give Las Vegas style BBQ a try. You won't be disappointed! For years I've been searching for that one BBQ joint to brag about and say "I've got the perfect place we can go."  That place is Jessie Rae's BBQ. You'll find yourself coming back for a regular fix.   I had the Jessie Rae pulled pork sandwich! It hit the spot and although I was full, it left me wanting more.   The owners make everyone feel like a VIP. They are also very personable and friendly. Save your receipt and get 10% off your next visit. Also, include your email at checkout and receive a coupon once a month!   They also cater! In addition to their store, you can find them at the local farmers market in Thursday's at the gardens park located off of 215 and town center.

Fallen angel and god sauce are both tasty (fallen angel has a nice kick, but isn't overwhelming). I had a Jessie Mac - basically what a Big Mac dreams it could be. Top half brisket bottom half pulled pork, full sandwich incredible. Had a side of Mac n cheese that was extra cheesy and good. We all left full and happy. It's a little hole in the wall so don't be surprised if it's hard to get a seat!

bu3gbxjzYonG9tDFSBREWw.text: We had such a great experience with this restaurant. We needed a venue for small family birthday party of 25 and called for recommendations. They volunteered to hold it right in the restaurant for us and it was just right. The food was excellent and there was more than enough for our party and 2 or 3 more. Several family members bought at least one of their sauces to take home. In a town of chain restaurants, it's nice to find a local, family run spot like Jessieraes.

M7HdrtMtoQaV4aUY9lNrDQ.text: OMG! I've eaten BBQ my whole life but I wasn't prepared for how amazing this food was. I honestly can't put into words how good the food was. Best BBQ I've ever eaten by miles. Don't miss out and try everything in the menu! You won't regret this

lsHqAq0xyob4M8kIwJAsCA.text: This place is AWESOME, I've been in Vegas for 2 weeks and I've been here four times (because I found out about too late). I even bought a 3 meat combo to take back home to my wife in L.A. I will definitely be making a trip back every time I'm in Vegas.

xcfu_-0Kfyscfr3tbzFrog.text: If you are rating solely the BBQ sauce then it hit the mark perfectly God Sauce is really something close to heaven.  However if you are seeking price value, customer service and food quality this place fell short of my expectations with such high reviews from others.   I took my family of four for a new BBQ experience only to walk away really disappointed. We all ordered the meat combos and what was served on they trays wasn't worth the price at all. Really the trays were half empty. I ordered chicken and brisket with potato salad. The cashier yelled from the kitchen door they were out of potato salad then walked up to the table and asked what else I wanted which was nothing however the rest of the family got a mac and cheese to share. I got five chunks of dried chicken and a slice of brisket that was 1/3 fat slab. My mom did say the hot links were good and my little did enjoy their mac and cheese. They gave us complimentary corn bread that was served cold with a slop of butter on top which really wasn't a treat; honestly I thought it was to makeup for items that weren't available but no she did it for everyone in the restaurant. It was just really mediocre and I am disappointed we spent $100 for a meal that left us leaving feeling blah and even worse when we walked out we still were not satisfied of having our craving for BBQ fulfilled.   Also with my oldest son aspiring to be a chef himself one day he found it really disappointing when the kitchen door opened and the prep area was filthy and food was being kept in crock pots.   As I sit here writing my review the hostess is bragging that no one ever complains or is disappointed leaving well we decided that the four of us won't need to eat here again.

BWMcjCZcz1u2IDI1gFdI3g.text: Accidental find for us as we were driving through Las Vegas- we LOVED it!! The Belt Buckle on Mac & Cheese with the God Sauce was Amazing!! Beef was very tender - melts in your mouth :)

JiWXEl4OE5-ui-3bYGKgbQ.text: Wonderful bbq & great portion sizes. The host/server was very nice. I over heard other guest mention how much they enjoyed the food & had made it a regular spot. The 3 meat combo was awesome with plenty of food for possibly 3+ ppl to share!

MrI30P_rOYGGHxoHchXwFQ.text: Was in Vegas for vacation and my son brought me here.  Ordered the BBQ pork ribs.  The ribs literally fell off the bone. Even the gristle was tender.  Great food, would highly recommend.

NL7b7o8goGCfuUldqxohRw.text: I could sit here and explain to you the blissful oblivion Jessie Rae's has turned my lunch breaks into. But it's not something words should be used for - you just have to experience it.   First time, get you a Belt Buckle with the God Sauce(their sig. sauce). Second time, snag you a Jessie Mac sandwich and rain on it with the Pig Sweat(sauce). Third time, bring your loved one, your family, your boss, your pet, your ancestors, guardian angels, or whoever you roll with, and share a dine-in platter with them they'll never forget (drip it all over with the sauce).   Las Vegas, you're welcome.

SdI_dtCtr3-jTPnkD4keFg.text: The problem with most BBQ places is that they try and get big way to fast. When they do this they lose the passion for the food. Then they turn into an assembly line and portions get smaller to cut cost and jack up profits.   This is not the case for Jesse Rae's. The passion is truly alive in the food that is served. I have had almost every BBQ place in town and I can not express how much I love the food here.  Fair prices for a great meal!    You must take the time and stop in for lunch. Amazing food!

bLVfjJHEfFWNm7wWxs1OpQ.text: First time here and was definitely not disappointed! Nyzjah greeted us and helped us figure out what to order and was very friendly. Very relaxed environment. We ordered the maniac fries and they were incredible! So much delicious food. The brisket was perfect.

mf0II7z8ecWdQnXlAxefCw.text: What a find! The brisket was delicious and the baby back ribs were to die for. Dad's pulled pork sandwich was perfect with the dollop of coleslaw. Sauces are amazing. Staff was super friendly. I couldn't go 5 stars because of the beverage situation. Pepsi only fountain and no beer!

CthnJofKH7JFc0BM4PaCdw.text: This is probably one of the best things I've had to eat in a long time. It was amazing. If you haven't been to Jessie Rae's BBQ on valley view/Russell rd than you need too. Absolutely amazing food this time I had the Big Belt Buckle but I've also tried the Jessie Rae sandwhich and it was great too. The God sauce here is absolutely heavenly(pun intended). rsOAcVMAr-ut8bT5eOfveQ.text: A few months ago, I was in BBQ capital Kansas City. I went to a restaurant that had been declared the best BBQ place in the country. Wrong! Jessie Ray's is better! udm8Uob7ebo1vwif26FJvw.text: Came for my first time. Their bbq brisket is amazing along with their waffle fries and Mac & cheese. Also their gods sauce and fallen angel sauce was really good. Highly recommend

3K17_E4Ot9ec-hwGWGMl7Q.text: Where do I begin, this place is amazingly good in every way possible Please do not overlook the small building and dining room this is a must try for anyone that loves REAL bbq  The staff were excellent and helpful and did a wonderful job. I Ordered the Jessy Rae Sandwich  ( Pulled Pork ) sandwich, which was delicious and well portioned, A couple others in my group decided to try the ribs as well as sides I must say by sampling all the items ordered the food was great  Best bbq place in Las Vegas Sorry  for the amateur writing skills as I am working on them lol...

08tzO8XTmMLRaBme_bhIeg.text: The choices on the menu all seemed delicious, we were a bit confused on which to try. However, I'm pretty sure everything would satisfy your tastebuds! Definitely telling all my friends and family about this place. The owners are definitely great people as well which is a plus!

Lcif4GiAjyyneipkkiIOoA.text: Double Brisket sandwich = delicious. As far as the Caesar salad goes, would not recommend again. Did well on the BBQ but would not go there just for a salad.

6Sk2eftHeXoR0uya8M-0Uw.text: Like most, I thought the BBQ sauce was terrific.  They are going to be selling it in the bottle soon and definitely would buy it.  The pulled pork was delicious though the portion was a little small.  The other item I had was the chicken and it was two legs.  I like legs but that wasn't what I expected.  If it is only going to be legs, that needs to be stated up front.  I ate there and was pretty disappointed with the facilities.  Like a number of BBQ places, cutlery was plastic.  I don't like that at all!  In their case, it was only a fork.  Jessie said the place was a pick it up with your hands type place so no knives.  I could even handle that if there were either napkins or decent quality paper towels.  There were no napkins and there was a roll of paper on the table that wouldn't soak up water and wasn't perforated.  You just tear off a sheet wherever you can.  If I am eating with my hands, I want more than this.  There were no towelettes either.  I left sticky.  The small eating area itself wasn't clean.  This easily could be a 5 star review but there needs to be improvement in the services.  It is a much better takeout place than eat in.

sIQPU1UKnVxttO9EfqHrVA.text: This is authentic bbq. We came on a great groupon deal and they give you what you pay for in the amount of food. There's 5 different sauces you can put on the food and I loved every last one. We will definitely be back for more and to try the ribs!

AR3JKPTB3LhhHtVcG8kSeQ.text: The most AMAZING BBQ spot in town! I love this place! Meat falling off the bone and don't you dare touch my plate...I will bite. God sauce and Fallen Angel sauce are so amazing; the perfect amount of heat with the perfect amount of lots of flavor. I've had pretty much everything off the menu but my favorites are the pork ribs, beef short ribs, brisket and corn with that delish rubbed flavored butter. Did I mention how the meat falls into your mouth, so moist and flavorful Oh my.... Let's talk about the catering, I had my birthday catered for about 20 people of family and friends and everyone fell in love just as much I was. I also pick up lunch here for me and my co-workers and they are in love as well. Prices are awesome and so are the portions. If you want to support a True local that just so happens to have amazing food look no further than Jessie Rae's.

Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork sandwich, ribs, corn, beans and watermelon... Wow! So delish!

MKenZ_MfA6gMQ7VRebDpRQ.text: I have tried many Bar B Que place here in Vegas. This has to be one of those hidden gems. I think I have found my new lunch stop.

Coleslaw good too. Only thing missing was a dessert. Very small place but the order taker was super helpful and nice!! I'll be back!!

kaFqSENH24QULwkNmSje3A.text: Absolutely spectacular bbq.  The pulled pork sandwich was the perfect portion and it was delicious.  The sauces are original and very tasty.  Excellent experience, friendly staff, I'm happy customer for sure :)

8gHF698o4PzkVGVNGM5Czw.text: Awesome ribs!!!  The meat fell off the bone. I've been here since 1979 and I've eaten at all the BBQ joints in town. This one is no doubt the best. They even deliver. Definitely recommended!!

A4rpkAFvdyq6R7h5Q08YLA.text: This place is awesome! I ordered the Duke (brisket over tater tots) and let me tell you it was amazing! I added God Sauce to it and it is a combination of Alabama, Memphis, and KC rolled into one I believe. I ended up ordering a bottle of God Sauce to go, it was so good! They have only been open for about a year and a half but have been voted the best BBQ in Vegas the last 2 years. The restaurant has 3 tables inside and the location is off the beaten path, but to me those are the things that make it great. I will definitely be back and I see this as a restaurant that will continue to grow!

4LlRsIIkoboZyZFUxFYZtA.text: There aren't a lot of great BBQ places in Las Vegas. To be honest, the best brisket in Vegas is in the Caesar's Buffet, which should tell you something. Jessie Rae's is a bit of a diamond in the rough.  Went for lunch, the wait was reasonable but the location is small. There are two picnic benches outside, but you probably want to grab an go unless you have the time.  The Duke and the Big Belt Buckle are both great served over waffle fries. Good sauce, decent meat to starch ratio, and a pretty hefty portion.  The sides are pretty solid as well, the corn is amazing, the green beans are green beans and the mac and cheese leaves something to be desired but is a solid dish for a colder day.  As most have said, the sauces are good. The God Sauce is amazing and has a great balance to the sweetness, the Fallen Angel is not for the faint of heart (if you don't say to people "I like spicy" don't try this sauce), and the Carolina style sauce should remind you of good East Coast BBQ (assuming you believe that exists).  Now to the most important part, the meats:  1. Brisket - solid brisket, sliced in relatively thick chunks. Good smoke development and usually a fattier cut (seems like the didn't trim off as much as other places to, the flavor thanks them for this). Not great bark though.  2. Pulled Pork - Another solid meat. The juiciness and the texture is what you want from a pulled port, very soft but not chewy. The flavor is somewhat lacking and probably requires sauce (not that you wouldn't just opt for the great sauce anyways).  3. Ribs - These are the best part. Honestly, they fall off the bone and taste spectacular. I got the three meat plate just so I could try the ribs, and the only thing I realized afterwards was I should have gone three meat just ribs. If you're a fan of ribs, you want some of these, stop looking at those sandwich options, get the ribs.  4. Burnt Ends - I'm really sorry to say, this is the low point of the menu. Not only is there a significant upcharge for the burnt ends, but they just aren't True burnt ends. Some places trim the bark and call those burnt ends, most places don't even try, the burnt ends here are just smaller pieces of the end cap. NO bark, NO juicy/fatty goodness. Do NOT fall in the trap of getting burnt ends (see above, just get ribs).  5. Chicken - Wasn't able to try the chicken, but if everything else is any reflection of the quality, this should be good.  Service: This was pretty excellent. The people were great and the food came out in a reasonable time.  Side Note: if you hop around back you can see a more traditional smoker and a pretty big Traeger. I'm willing to be that these key ingredients keep things pretty moist and flavorful. Big plus.

2VkwRt-CcSKk6EkCbhR9ow.text: I was having the worst day ever. I came to this small spot, but realized it just has so much more to offer don't let the size fool you! The Jessie Rae sandwich blew me away. The sandwich didn't have an overbearing sauce so I tasted the amazing rub flavor and the unique bread was some of the finest on the strip . The potato mash w Bbq sauce was ideal. I love potatoes with some of the skin left on so this won me over.  You can choose from either a god award winning sauce or fallen angel with the reaper "hottest pepper in the world". There's def something for everybody and I will be back. This is now my fav new Bbq place in Las Vegas! Thank u Jessie Rae your the best!

P6QBkRtzFfsLl9kmITRXrA.text: We had a variety of all of the meats.  The ribs were good as well as the chicken and brisket, pulled pork was nice and tender but could've been seasoned a bit more.   I'm a homemade link kind of girl so they were just alright. I love stagg sausages (HINT HINT) I think these were farmland though, which still have a good flavor for commercial links.    The tator tot appetizer was good and filling. The three sauces were good and flavorful as well.  A good find if you are looking to eat off the strip.

gc7kFK62ps8p1GXa2261mg.text: Best bbq period. Don't leave without getting the The rib sandwich. Jessie is hands on with his guests makes you feel like he cooking for family.

qao0RM64qII-9pHAOk1THQ.text: Great food. Look forward to more next time in Vegas. Many unique and tasty dishes.

8u--moPzOv5-CXsIGla7eA.text: My family loved this place the homey atmosphere was great  the food was amazing I ate brisket which I don't like and pulled pork i dont like either but  they were amazing my 14 year old son loved it and he wants to go back as much as we do thanks Mike.

I was early and he literally almost gave me 2 full orders of food for the price of one! Great place and great service. I recommend this spot constantly and will continue to frequent this place until my cholesterol knocks the roof off, lol.

J1NpU_TbkwnW1SwKKOCZRQ.text: WOW!   I have been to almost every BBQ place in Vegas and this is the best.  I thought I knew good BBQ before I went to Texas and had real BBQ. uMMOwub3BVOPBFYNhBJ3dQ.text: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! The portion size is worth the cost! Great service on top of delicious BBQ. Very good quality food! Definitely best spot in Vegas for BBQ

i85-VmICBlTCfODpoK4PiA.text: First time trying out this new BBQ place after hearing about it! The place is a hidden gem outside strip near Mandalay Bay, easy to get to but parking is small. They have all the usual things BBQ places have pork, brisket, chicken, ribs etc. I decided to try something different, one their loaded combo's  - the Maniac fries (waffle fries, Mac N Cheese, loaded with Pulled pork & Hot links) - It was good! Pulled pork was very tender, smokey flavor, Mac was cheesey and links were add bonus - but what this place has that is different was there sauces - The Reaper / Fallen Angel (a hot, spicy- sweet sauce), God sauce is the regular BBQ sauce, but the Bama Slama white sauce was the king. Sandwiches like Jessie Mac looked good, a friend let me try  the rib tip -which was moist and tasty. Now I need to go back and try the rest -with all three sauces. A must try in Vegas!

hEUu9VMhY8pYLxicka6xGw.text: This was a second choice food spot for us today and I'm glad the first spot was filled with a little league team. Walking in I was def put back with how tiny the place was. And was sad there wasn't baked beans..... but DAMN the food was good. I got the pulled pork sandwich which I thought was good but what hit out of the park was the short rib! There was no way to be prepared for this huge melt in your mouth piece of meat!!!! The seasoning was great! I mean it was sooooo tasty!!! The brisket was good too! For sides we had tater tots and Mac n cheese..... we got the opportunity to say hello to beautiful family who owns the place. Only negative for me was that I was sitting right under a vent and was freezing! But that did not take away from the tastiness of the food! Def will go back and suggest that others give it a try too! Hope they expand! Seating is very tight!

EBfG6MH27MxAzpALL94qwg.text: NEG'S:  *Extremely limited seating: Probably total for 12-14. *Seating outside looks like furniture from the side of the road  *Dirty floors, dirty plates(bowls)  * mac and cheese tasted like craft  * food cold   Positives:  * great sauces  * trip tip good  * link good  * waffle fries good  *baked beans good

xx6zZmaj7N_PBo7pQJMaUw.text: Jessie Rae's BBQ is practically a small shack just off the 15 near Russell, but they have a ton of meat. Coming in on Veteran's Day since the place is only up from the morning til 4 on the weekdays, I wasn't surprised to find out they had run out of a number of meats.  I did get to try the brisket, pulled pork, and rib tips, but I really did want to try some baby back and beef ribs (the latter of which is not available every day). Confusing as it is, they are also open on alternating Saturdays. The BBQ I did get to try was quite good. The quality of the brisket stood out, as well as the taste of the rib tips. Pulled pork works well with their sauces, which is really the highlight of Jessie Rae's. The God Sauce, ironically, is my least favorite because it is quite sweet. I enjoyed the hot sauce and the vinegar heavy sauces much more. They were probably the tastiest BBQ sauces I've ever had.  The sides were just okay for me here. Because someone hadn't picked up their order, I got to try some green bean casserole, waffle fries, and corn. I had expected corn on the cob but got some corn in clarified butter instead which came out a little too heavy. The green bean casserole was okay but the waffle fries were probably the best, but nothing particularly special.  Service here is friendly and being a small joint makes it have some of that charm that gets lost at big BBQ place. I definitely hope I can come by and get some baby back and beef ribs sometime soon.

WZJQpLbBGKlqQUWwTplagA.text: I ordered and paid for my meal on the yelp app because my coworkers were going to be picking up lunch here and I didn't want to drive anywhere. I got the hotlink sandwich w/ a side of macaroni and cheese. My coworkers ordered ribs, and BBQ chicken meals w/ the same pick up time, yet they had to wait for my order after receiving theirs. The sandwich was pretty good, but the macaroni and cheese could've used some seasonings (onion salt, garlic powder, paprika...something). I would consider having their hotlink sandwich again. However, I was really grossed out by how DIRTY the containers my food came in were! It looked like whoever served my Mac n cheese was handling the food from the grill with their bare hands and never washed them. The container my sandwich was in was greasy and had drip marks on it. Not only was my food not ready at the time selected on the app, but it was filthy!

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hotlink sandwich
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The disgustingly dirty box my sandwich was packaged in. Gross!
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bland macaroni and cheese.

KKk9AAY-npug8F_Lu4uzTA.text: Talk about literally the definition of hole in the wall restaurant. But one well worth going out of your way too try! I came for late lunch for recovery meal after long training day. The bad thing about coming for late lunch is most of the good stuff is out. They only open for lunch service and am sure since small operation just started up might make limited amount everyday The owner assume telling me the sausage one of the first things to go. =(( Talk about mouth watering description making the sausages fresh everyday incasing them and the whole works. Really nice! More times then not see sausage on the menu it not in house made fresh everyday. I feels like speaks volumes about not just the sausage but talking about my pulled pork sandwich I ordered. You can tell the amount of passion the owner has for bbq and love that in any business owner more less small business owners just starting up. I love talking about food.   So the pulled pork sandwich (We Porked in Vegas) talk about hearty sandwich. You know its hearty when the meat is overflowing from the bun and the cole slaw on top doing the same. The names they have for the dishes I think is pretty cool idea. The natural dripping added another flavor and brings it all together. I reading about the God Sauce. I feel like totally legit. I honestly put that up there with just by itself! Top bbq sauces of all time. The other two sauces honest thought was ok but the GOD sauce. You need make sure get some when come visit. It had little kick but just the right about of balance that not pure heat in bbq sauce. The waffles fries was good. I really the enjoyed the seasoning that was on it.   Say hole in the wall. There was no cars in the parking lot when pulled in. I walk in no one at the cashier stand no one around. I see bell ringer like checking in hotel or something. It felt odd for me hit it. Not very long then someone think owner came out of the kitchen. I told him first time explaining me the menu. I went with the pulled pork sandwich. He went back made it served me and cashier. Now if that not small business?? What is?? The place only has two tables of four and three bar stools. So if planning on eating in all about timing or just order food to go. No fountain machine. The drinks not sure since came late if full selection. You pick something out of stand up refrigerator. I had iced tea. They do make three fresh gallons of different juices or something that pour into cup. I forget the names of them. I just got bottle drink. The prices are very reasonable and get great portion. Not sure about the sides. I never really notice much of selection. Everything was new too me.   Not doubt plan on coming back really want try some of the sausage. I know there been push of bbq joints around Vegas. I love this small hole in the wall places that not about environment. Food stand out. The owner has passion for bbq, friendly, and really looking forward trying more of the menu. Only reason not five stars is only tapped the surface of the food here although really more like 4,5 stars. If in the area or not got come out try Jessie Rae BBQ.

mah1tOe8EVk0iGbtGwIfKA.text: Great food, good price, friendly service. A little hole in the wall, you should definitely visit. Food came way faster than expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiny little street sign guides you to the deliciousness within

8z7c71A0w31bBMAvE6M5Zg.text: My sister and I decided to try this place out... Having moved from Virginia last year we've been searching for some good BBQ. Unfortunately this place did not quite live up to the hype. My sister got the Duke fries with a side of cole slaw and I got the two meat combo with spare ribs, chicken and Mac n cheese. The sides were pretty good, but nothing extraordinary... Typical choices for BBQ joint, I guess we like our southern BBQ with some greens. My sister enjoyed the fries and noted how they definitely don't skimp on the meat. For me the chicken and ribs were pretty average as far as the meat and cooking go. We both agreed that the draw for this place is definitely the sauces. We really enjoyed mixing the Fallen Angel and the God sauces.  All in all it's pretty average BBQ for us... Better than Famous Dave's but not quite up there with the best

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two meat convo with spare ribs and chicken, mac n cheese side

WmzOqfC5bCm33dTPTTfRfQ.text: As soon as my boyfriend and I walked in, the owner Mike introduced himself and made us feel welcome right away. We decided to go with the 3 meat combo. They were out of sausage and chicken (next time we better go earlier), so we got the pulled pork, brisket, and ribs, with coleslaw as our side. Mike also recommended the pulled pork sandwich and we didn't hesitate to get that too because we were starving.   Everything was delicious, I mean everything. Usually when I go to BBQ restaurants there's always a food item that I wouldn't order again. But here, I would order everything again. The ribs were smoky and fell off the bone, the pulled pork was extremely juicy, and the brisket was cut thick. The different BBQ sauces they had were a perfect addition to the meats. My boyfriend ate the whole pulled pork sandwich without giving me a bite so in guessing it was amazing too. They even have grape Kool-Aid, sweet tea, and strawberry lemonade.   They only opened a week ago and some days they have a line out the door... Yup, I would totally wait in line for this BBQ! Even in the 100 degree Vegas heat

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket, ribs, pulled pork, and pulled pork sandwich

aNyN8Jt77a_EUITD_YOfag.text: Now here's the thing, I'm not a huge fan of BBQ sauce but that changed the day I met God Sauce!  What is God Sauce you ask?  It's the best sauce ever!!  What do I smother in God Sauce?  Better question is what don't I smother in God Sauce...pancakes, eggs, tacos, spaghetti, salads, ice cream, my husband and of course Jessie Rae's amazing BBQ!    Jessie Rae's has won many awards and trophies rightfully so!  I don't eat pork but I make an exception while visiting Jessie Rae's!  The pulled pork sandwich...OMG!!!  The brisket, I don't even think I can put into words how delicious the brisket is!  The beans, the chicken, the ribs...the yumminess just goes on and on.    They just moved into their new location and renovations are being completed.  I can't wit to see the full menu.  Mike (the owner) is a BBQ Master! They officially open to the public on September 7, 2015.  Don't miss out on this finger licking' good Las Vegas Style BBQ!!

cDssVTZTFJIJ53MMIsnzAA.text: I wanted to get off of the Strip to try something a little more authentic. I tried the pulled pork and brisket with bbq mashed potatoes, and have no regrets. I tried most of the bbq sauces at the table, and their award-winning bbq and the carolina mustard-bbq sauce were my faves. 2Mi6DiISNCkJ6Ctn4j680g.text: I know That people call this the best BBQ in Vegas and as I catch up on my reviews this week I want to talk about this little hole in the wall on Valley View and Dewey. Now I don't eat all that much BBQ and I contribute that to how picky I am about BBQ sauce, also if I'm eating BBQ it better be brisket. One of my first jobs was at Tony Romas so I don't get too excited for ribs.  I ordered a two meat combo and a Pulled Pork sandwich no Cole slaw for my fiance. He always orders pulled pork sandwiches and said this one was really tasty. The brisket was cooked really well and was so tender. I also got the baby back ribs and they fell right off the bone. I know you're wondering how the sauce was and their original is now one of my favorite BBQ sauces of all time! I would recommend you make this spot your next BBQ destination!

PPGjBDFSKKe-Api7ig3Lzg.text: Wow, seriously good BBQ near the Las Vegas strip.  Located in an industrial setting, this non fancy little place has some of the best barbecue I've ever tasted! My wife agrees, though hesitant at first by its looks.  All was quickly forgotten after smelling and then tasting. The barbecue sauce is house made and should be sold to the masses as it seriously fantastic. the brisket, pulled pork, and chicken all tasty.. so much flavor.  Didn't care much for the baked beans.. I'd skip those next time. Eat in or carry out, this is a must stop for any barbecue enthusiasts

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

71geswFTWcs3BDDhLO1l2g.text: Finally got myself over here to check out this, fast becoming famous, joint.  It's the 2017 Las Vegas Gold Winner for BBQ.  In a town that is now being able to pride itself, to some extent, on its barbecue (see, for example, John Mull's, Rollin' Smoke, Sin City BBQ, et. al), Jessie Rae's earns its place among the best.  Like the other top Vegas offerings, Jessie doesn't stand on ceremony.  What you are getting here is honest-to-goodness barbecue, no froufrou, hipster bro (with a man bun), quaintness.  You will find really regular folks here who are not trendy foodies.  (BBQ, btw, is like super trendy everywhere in the U.S. right now, so it bears noting).  The minute you come in you are embraced by the serious smoky and sweet odors wafting your way.  The service is friendly and sincere, and engaging.  The environment is nothing to speak of--again, a True BBQ joint!  Round and square tables this way and that, with red and white checkerboard plastic table cloths, mismatched chairs (including one that seemed to have a hole in it), and random posters and funny placards on the fake paneled wall.  A couple TVs were playing "Sabrina, the Teenage Witch."  You don't come here for the atmosphere.  The food.  Quite worthy of its title.  The brisket was tender and flavorful.  The chicken was not dry! (This is my own personal taste test for a BBQ joint).  The pulled pork was also not dry, with a nice balance of seasoning.  Both the chicken and the pork were well livened up with the amazing BBQ sauce that you get a big cylindrical container of.  Go for it! I selected the mild, and it was perfect.  Truly something special.  The BBQ pork ribs did not need the sauce, nor the hot link, which was my favorite.  I really dug that hot link, y'all.  It was spicy, but not so much that the heat overpowered the flavor.  To cool it down, I ate some of the delicious beans that came as a side.  Wow, they were good.  I pretty much "hogged" these at the table.  I also enjoyed the thick pieces of white bread that came with. (Yeah, I'm off keto).  The corn and mac and cheese were respectable, too.  It's a little on the pricier side, to be honest.  Yes, we got a lot of food (see the photos).  But it came to $70.00 with the tip.  I would have expected it to be about $15-20 less, especially with the "special," which we got from checking in on Yelp.  (We pay about $55-60 for the same, comparable portions, with tip, I think, at Rollin Smoke and Sin City BBQ).  But I understand that's not out of range, and they have a proper chef, and have to pay their rent, too.  And I am glad that we went.  It's not your neighbor's backyard bbq, that's for sure!

7BD-4XGidmcJBubuts9ILw.text: The best bbq I've ever had, hands down. We are from the desolate state of North Dakota. One to two times a year, we are lucky enough to visit the great city of Las Vegas. This is always our first stop any time we visit the city. We have always received the best service. Even more important the best food. Words can't describe how good this place is. God sauce is an accurate description of the heavenly bbq sauce they create. I typically eat an embarrising amount of food here, because it's impossible to decide on one thing. I am hours away from entering heaven on earth again. Can't wait!!!

vZMnw6oB9NXceFzbcZentg.text: I kept seeing friends check into this spot and the pictures they were posting literally had me drooling. I had to try it out.  After browsing the menu for a bit, I called in an order for pickup. I  spoke with James who was very pleasant. He took my order and told me it would be 10-15 minutes. Jessie Rae's is approximately 2.6 miles from work, so I jumped in my car on my lunch break on 2/15/16 and headed over. If you have any kind of navigation device on your phone it will lead you right to the place. Yes, it's small and the location is in a commercial complex, but there is visible signage from Valley View. Matter of fact it's right off Valley View and Dewey.  ANyway I ordered a 2 meat combo, and went with the sausage and brisket. The combo comes with one side and I choose slaw, but opted to get an additional side of mac and cheese.   The Good -Customer service was great. As I said James was very pleasant both over the phone and in person when I picked up my order. He hand delivered the food to me and showed me the food before closing up the box. You can tell he takes pride in what he does. -The pig sweat bbq sauce was amazing. It's a vinegar based sauce which happens to be my fav, and it was fucking delicious. It was so good that  I drank it out of the little cup (don't judge me). -The sausage was really good. It was chopped up into bite size pieces, perfect for popping into my mouth. It was a bit well done but that is actually how I prefer it. It had just the right amount of spice and a lot of flavor. I would order this again. The slaw-oh em gee this shit was amazing. It was tangy and creamy and the cabbage was fresh and had a nice crunch to it. I would order this again. -The price was super reasonable. I ordered a 2 meat combo and 2 sides for around $17.50.   The Bad -The mac and cheese was not good. Although it looked tasty, it tasted like when you were younger and your mom would make you eat reheated Kraft mac and cheese the next day. It was very dry and had a lot of pepper mixed throughout. I can't see myself ordering this again. -The brisket. Contrary to other reviews this brisket was not dry at all, in fact it was very tender and had good smoky flavor. While it was tasty, it was very fatty. You will have to see my pic to understand what I mean. I would think twice about ordering this again.   All in all though I think this place is pretty good. I love supporting local businesses and there are a few things I want to try out like the ribs and pulled pork. I will for sure be back.

IjT2hc6tpra1wT_VMIolwQ.text: For a long time, I would be asked what I thought was the best BBQ in Vegas and respond Rolling Smoke. I have tried a variety of places and stumbled on Jessie Rae's.   I recently ate there and loved the food. I especially enjoyed the beef rib which had a great taste and texture to it.   Reading through the negative reviews of the place are typically people complaining about the location, delivery, and the look of the place. Most great BBQ is found in not so great locations.   If you are looking for a sit down restaurant for BBQ with waiters etc, I don't think this is where you want to go. If you want great tasting BBQ, then this is the place to go.

The bbq sauce one the other hand was pretty tasty.  But we won't be returning.

9zZ-1WEWLu3Kh6a71Wel4Q.text: Got the two person sampler plate for about $45 with 4 drinks. The meat was really good and the pulled pork was my favorite I would definitely come back and get a pulled pork sandwich if I had another BBQ craving. Get the side of corn it was definitely the best. Definitely enjoyed the three different sauces none of them are overpowering and they are all unique in there own way. Try them all the hot really isn't hot.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat sampler for two.

Ocstyvh94Z68thnXV-0e_w.text: Dont be fooled by the tiny little restaurant., everything was delicious. We had the pork ribs, tender juicy fall of the bone, the waffle fries with brisket, delicious if you like fatty brisket, I prefer mine a little leaner but still great flavor and finally we had the beef ribs, my absolute favorite, huge & great flavor! Excellent BBQ and excellent service.

aZH0eHH7G9wgAXrpBVoOiw.text: the food was over boiled, it spent to much time being boiled before it was grilled. The meat was mushy with a powdery feel to it as meat does when over cooked. Mac and cheese was good but the side was very small, felt like it belonged in a happy meal so for the money I would say take a pass and skip it

HPU8YTyG6mV8ZiAv8K1j9A.text: Phenomenal! Old school bbq pit feel when you walk in, nothin fancy, but clean. I was a little put off when I saw the prices, but I wasn't going to judge them on that after seeing the good reviews. While we waited for the food to come, we tried the sauces which there are 3 of...absolutely amazing. I got the Mcdowells Mic Ribb, my wife and son got the Jessie Mac. I got a side of mac 'n cheese and my son got a side of bbq mash, those sides alone were fantastic. Now let's get to the good stuff, my sandwich had deboned baby back ribs that were incredibly tender, no fat and sweet; the sandwich was perfectly sweet and smokey. My wife and sons pulled pork with brisket had no fat and were packed with meat. After hearing them moan, I tried a bite and it was so tender and juicy. We will for sure be coming back and next time, I'll remember the pics.

L76cgty7CgdAJ3FX1tEfiA.text: Been going here for awhile now and hands down the best BBQ I've had! The brisket and spare ribs is what I always get

jDx0OZxrbPzTM1ABBylpcQ.text: This hole in the wall (4 small tables, maybe 12 chairs) has to be one of the best, if not the best, bbq joints in town! Mike definitely knows his q. Get yourself a 2 meat High Roller. Pulled pork and hot links are great, as are the baby back ribs. Sides, get the corn with smoked butter and fries. Meats are tender and flavorful, but if you want more their award winning sauce is readily available. Highly recommended!

J4xJh_gQler1JIFiiti26w.text: Best bbq in town. I recommend the fries and brisket. It's delish. If you like spicy try the reaper barbecue sauce. Don't underestimate this spot by its size.

SwgxFMQTNAbfa_IhlvPCww.text: I'm from Dallas Texas and when it comes to BBQ I'm very picky and I have to say it feel like home here . The food here is amazing my personal favorite are the tacos. The people that work put a lot of love in to there food and they work extra hard to make you feel welcome. It's not the biggest or the fanciest BBQ spot but it's best when it comes to BBQ and customer service. This is definitely my favorite spot for BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Yl2n8PjFtoUHMRqvgFXoSA.text: I was on vacation in Vegas. I had a hankering for some barbecue be it that I've spent a lot of time in North Carolina and Texas so I was looking forward to this highly rated BBQ stop here in Vegas. I came through the door and was greeted by the nicest warmest person I think her name was Rebecca she provided five star service. I even had to shout out the guy Damien in the back! just a really cool place with really cool people and really great food the baby back ribs are to-die-for OMG!! Thank you Rebecca for the experience! This place is definitely a win

xm3mIDThqJGNu5Y2B16nbA.text: Their sauce is good. Never had white bbq sauce and that was good on their tator tots. The pork sandwich and ribs where good. Only thing I question was why they don't keep the ribs hot. They where just warm. Still will go to and get some food.

rJhSvKPsvsdea8wFWHTd_Q.text: Amazing food and service. Try the BBQ mashed potatoes. Would definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas.

JnnLlztSBR2IHqtmr5SYHg.text: My boss had Jessie Raes BBQ brought in for my birthday lunch celebration and it was AMAZING!  The meat was so tender, the sauce is the best I've had, and the baked beans are straight from heaven.  5-Stars is just not enough: I give them 5 stars, 2 thumbs up, and a 10 out of 10.  It's your girl ChatWithPat at Brydan Solutions

2KClNQCQYY1dSziFcJgC7Q.text: Just bought the maniac fries, I got a order with brisket and also a order with chicken.  Both taste really good but I liked the brisket the best. I'll definitely be going back again. I'll be trying the ribs next.. I tried 3 different bbq sauces all 3 were probably the best bbq sauce I've had in a long time.

FcFhHcuDt-tfAwbVM_WCew.text: Great BBQ experience from beginning to end!! A must try if in Vegas looking for great eat not on the strip!!

nxYOxnsCWD3di92iDM9how.text: I would consider this a mom n pop or hold in the wall bbq joint. But I would have to say the bbq is on point. Cooked to perfection and tender.  I would recommend the brisket and baby back ribs. All the sauces are homemade and they have a lot to choose from.  Definitely will tell people about it.  It's a hidden gem.

s23UFN6Zf9NdPzg6N8iVzw.text: Do not order from this place. I placed an order for delivery for s 2 meat combo with chopped brisket & pulled pork and waffle fries and a 6 oz of their "god sauce" . When my food was delivered, the bag was all oily and dirty and so was the box the food came in. My order was all incorrect.   They put tater tots instead of waffle fries  I paid $3 extra for sauce and they literally put one little 1oz of sauce   The meat was disgusting looking. The meat was soggy and had water all in the plate.   Total rip off and horrible customer service when I called and complained .    I wish I had pictures of the food but I was so pissed off that as soon as I Saw my order was incorrect I threw it in the trash  Why would I want to get another meal free on the house if this meal turned out this bad ? And here is my receipt of me clearly asking for waffles fries, not Tater tots . I also called in 30 seconds before asking if you guys had waffles fries or ran out. The worker said yes we do have waffle fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pyRm3OJdZlWoSpdX8gY-vg.text: Went to lunch with a friend so we decided to try this BBQ place out.  The place is small but very organized.  I ordered a two meet combo brisket and something else (sorry I can't remember what it was). When we arrived it was lunch hour so it was a bit crowded but we found a table pretty quickly. It's a BBQ joint so it isn't fancy at all so don't be discouraged by the decor because the food is pretty good.  I personally think he prices were a bit high for what we were served and the guy that took our order was a bit short with us as we tried to figure out the menu.  The parking lot is crowded so again you will need to be creative or patient.   I think I would like to go back again when I have more time and prelook at their menu.

ynOo_1rA74sVqrvGK7xIPA.text: So far my my favorite BBQ in the city. The Maniac fries are awesome. Their BBQ "God" sauce is legit!

y9lnBsK5nzgpUdy3TR81Ww.text: We love this place! The staff is always friendly, the food comes out quick, the portions are quite large and the BBQ is the best in town. Trust me, I've eaten all the BBQ places in town. This place is the BEST  normally we do the High Roller which is 2 meats and 2 sides. The brisket, chicken and pulled pork are all so amazing. Brisket is probably my favorite smoked meat! Tonight we got something new and different! It's called The Fortress! It's an order of maniac fries, which is a mixture of waffle fries, your choice of chicken, pulled pork or brisket, mac and cheese, and hot link sausage. This is all in the center and a rack of baby back ribs surrounds it. Definitely plenty to share portion wise, my man, my 1 year old son and I all shared it. As far as sides go our favorite is the corn with smoked butter. I don't even really like corn if it's not on the cob but this place does corn right  I'd eat that corn all day, honestly. The mashed potatoes are amazing and topped with something called Alabama Sauce,  its white and is sort of like a different style bbq sauce. It's delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A different view of The Fortress
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fortress

pL6WQLmifOMBdaKaxEiIxg.text: Ok, so I saw Jessie on TV and looked up the restaurant and bamm, close to my job.  So today I had a minute to run and grab some food.  People were super nice and it smelled great walking in the door.  A bit pricey for lunch, but what the heck, I am treating myself today.  So I ordered the 2 meat platter with pulled pork, Brisket and a side of beans.  It came to $18.67.  I couldn't wait to taste it as it smelled amazing in the car.  I get to my shop open up the platter and start and it was literally 40% pure fat.  I am not super picky and understand there will be some fat on BBQ, but this was excessive and I felt it was purposely hidden under the 2 lean slices I received.  The pork I had to go through and pick out big chunks of fat.  The beans and the meat I did get tasted great.  But when your spending $20 for a BBQ plate I don't want to have to throw half of it in the garbage . Oh well back to Dickey's.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is all the fat that was in my plate, 40% of what I got in that dish.

cVK4jbA-urnPqNErH40z7w.text: So i've been meaning to come here for the longest and finally had a chance to try it out. It's hard to say which BBQ place in Vegas is the best after this but this is a serious contender. If Yelp offered .5 star reviews this would be a solid 4.5/5....  I had the three meat combo with:  Brisket - spices on it are good   Baby Back Ribs - fall off the bone and so tender...fire  Rib Tips - so tender, so flavorful, so good and i don't even fuck with pork like that  Mac & Cheese - pretty good however the best I have had  Cornbread - the butter on this was flames...had to be brown sugar and something  Sauces were such boss. That Fallen Angel sauce ain't that spicy but has that shit that makes your soul burn slow and have the flavor that you need for some heat...  It's hard to say whether this is the best or where it ranks in Las Vegas BBQ because of me not eating BBQ in awhile however I can definitely say that it is in the top echelon of BBQ in Vegas...

F9I9xRMQLCTsYDkK1NsVyw.text: Reviews are this good for a reason. I met the owner at work and decided to try the place out. I have been to some top bbq spots in Vegas and this place is my new favorite. Must checkout won't be disappointed. I tried the brisket, baby backs, and chicken. Was impressed with everything.

Kby4pinqCCXX2Qr2U6a7SQ.text: Hot Diggity Dawg!  I must say thanks to my Fellow Yelp reviewers for spreading the word about this place.  Everything was on point from the juicy tender Brisket and Pulled Pork. The creamy Coleslaw,  zesty flavorful baked Beans, Honey buttery Corn Bread and their buttery Corn side...not to mention their oh so tasty bbq sauces. My Stomach and Taste Buds thank you.  Cheers Jessie Rae! keep on keeping on...

Z6tYtrQHxoSlckkzYKPicA.text: Jessie Raes is delicious!! They were kind enough to cater an event for our company and everybody enjoyed their food. Definitely recommend!

2zX0yNobNWc87RBk0AVNkA.text: drove 4 hours to try this place out and it was worth it! i ordered the maniac fries and the fortress. while some might think its pricey, you def get what your paying for. the flavor was amazing and the ribs were tender they fell off the bone. the portions were big and it fed 3 people and we even took some leftovers! cant wait to come back again to try this place again. also shoutout to the lady who took our food she was so friendly and made sure we were satisfied

_jZeUobbR0yDaqw5zgWjCQ.text: The brisket wasn't very good. Seemed dry. The macaroni and cheese was watery and seemed like it was made out of the box, extra water was thrown in, and additional cheese was added to make it cheesier. The only thing enjoyable on the brisket sandwich was the bread. Will not order from here again.

3fikxZcGSmgZdZ4Oi5CO-A.text: Ordered thru Postmates food was outstanding and the portions very generous price easy even with delivery. Three meat combo arrived hot and in order. Looking forward to trying the beef ribs. Good for y'all.

LiojQEDiaTQ0Aus8d3Lhwg.text: Wife and I chose this place on the recommendations/reviews of Yelp, Google and then the trifecta of locals on a poker forum saying it was the best in Vegas. Well, all were correct.   We had a two meat plate with pulled pork and pulled chicken, beans and mac N cheese. Everything was amazing. I loved the Fallen Angel sauce and the wife loved the traditional stuff, though I don't remember the name. The meat was delicious, tender and moist. Beans were great. Macaroni and Cheese stole the show though. Truly the best Mac N Cheese either of us ever had. Very creamy and stayed that way throughout the meal. Usually creamy mac gets coagulated and lumpy as it cools a little but this never stopped being creamy. Seriously, this place has now entered the must stop rotation every time we hit Las Vegas.  Saw someone get a "fortress" and a "maniac fries" on the table next to us. We will be trying the fortress next time for sure as it looked and smelled wonderful. Food so good I've already told my boss where to go when he is in the city next month. Keep up the great work. You've got a couple more customers for life in us.

I1r4EgZxsqQNdkq4SH7vQQ.text: GO HERE!  Oh and try to go early in the day because they SELL OUT daily. We had a 3 meat combo (brisket, smoked chicken, rib tips) with 3 sides (smoked corn, Mac n cheese, BBQ baked beans) , also got three truffles (check out the refrigerated truffle case next to the register).  Everything was really good. Super tender, you don't even really need a knife!  Paid $40 for our meal which also included 3 drinks. Super AFFORDABLE and quite frankly some of the BEST BBQ we've ever had.   Jessie Rae's is a small establishment so if you have a large party (8+) not sure if you can dine in. There's about 5 2 tops and then 2 larger tables that can accommodate 6 and the 8 people, I think. The service is awesome. Recommendations are on point.   Can't wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket (Bottom left), smoked chicken (top) rib tips (bottom right)
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 meat combo (Brisket, smoked chicken, rib tips)

pI14kGaQTGLDNC6r-G18Cw.text: Atmosphere felt southern with quite limited seating. Appeared most customers took their food to go - recommended. Portions were a little less than I'm used to, but nothing on my plate was wasted - we ate it all! And most importantly, the food was excellent! Highly recommend.   As far as eating keto goes, we were able to achieve mostly keto approved foods. We ordered 3 meats + 1 side, and ordered an additional side. What's in the pic is brisket, chicken and hot link, and a side of Carolina red slaw as well as Vegas slaw (both were spicy and fantastic BTW).   Only grievance was we ordered 2 drinks and weren't told they were out of all but 2 of their 6 selections and they didn't offer a refund - but I didn't ask for one either. I feel they should've warned me so I could choose to pass on paying for one. Doesn't change the fact that we enjoyed our meal and it was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seen here are brisket, chicken and hot links, with Vegas slaw and Carolina red slaw, which was really spicy and fantastic.

LydfeAljQb0DBehD5CnsHA.text: Just went to this place for the first time since my son really wanted bbq and I really wanted to love it but unfortunately that wasn't the case our food was dry and not so fresh we ordered brisket, rib tips and hot link I was also surprised our plates didn't come with any bread or corn bread for the price I paid. We also asked for ketchup and was told they don't have any??? I always support small business owners and want them to succeed but unfortunately this place was a let down   Update: Mike, I just read your message but don't know how to respond.

rqQ-ejc6K2kZqz12NPuPzg.text: My first time coming here . It was my boyfriends idea to come here before we left home. I am so happy we came. This place is amazing fire I hope they get a place in California ASAP preferably Orange County :)

7oBSUGZnXld4tIIVfeaxPw.text: Excellent bbq! I finally got around to trying this place via Grubhub.....never have been in the restaurant itself. Ordered The Duke (pulled bbq pork over waffle fries), Mac & cheese and baked beans. Both the beans & pork were delicious. The pork was tender perfection. The regular size portion was huge! My husband and I split it and could not finish it. We both would have preferred a little more sauce so next time I'll have to remember to order extra. The Mac wasn't anything special. It's all about the bbq anyways.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jessie Mac and Cheese &amp; BBQ Baked Beans
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Duke

xwj7TrQUR_UOIj5WjyXWHw.text: Location location location this place will blow up soon good not great owner is a doll  large portions  just hard to give a 5 star coming from Texas

87IY_c9vrErIMR4OsHyjmg.text: Well the BBQ craving hit hard again today and since we have a toddler we decided to be kind to other dining patrons and order delivery instead of eating in. We've ordered delivery from here once before and it was mediocre at best. I don't typically leave reviews after delivery experiences because I like to dine in before making my full assessment of a restaurant. However after a second less than stellar delivery experience, I decided to review.   Based on all the other yelp reviews and being a local joint rather than a chain, I want to like this place. Unfortunately the food just doesn't measure up.   The delivery packaging was very poor so the bag was full of grease when it arrived. Not exaggerating, all of the containers were stained orange and dripping with grease. If you are going to offer a pick up or delivery option for your patrons, you should invest in packaging that doesn't leak or wrapping the packaging in tight plastic wrap a few times is an affordable way to deliver your food in a clean and presentable fashion.   We ordered the full rack of ribs, added a few sides and the hot links. Quickly got an update that they were out of hot links so removed that from the order. Bummer.   Made a note in the order that we wanted dry rub only/sauce on the side and I added on 2 sauces for .50 cents each. When the ribs arrived the container was very greasy and the ribs were sauced. (Lightly sauced thankfully) but still not dry like I had requested. I can't comment on the taste quality of the sauces because I don't know if I received both of what I ordered or just one. It was very lightly sauced and none on the side so couldn't get a good read on the sauces. Thankfully had a bottle of bbq sauce at home to use or else I would have been really bummed.   The corn was undercooked and underwhelming. The beans were extremely mushy, not really even edible IMO, it was more of a bean mash than a cup of beans. Maybe that's the way it's intended but we didn't care for it. I've had baked beans from similar bbq restaurants before and never had ones so mushy. The coleslaw was crunchy and therefore had a good texture but very bland. I was also surprised that the meal didn't come with a roll or cornbread like most bbq joints include when you order a combo or full slab.   Sadly after two attempts and plenty of bbq competition in the Southwest, we won't order again or return.

aknXHR9gB5p8VG-guKwRQA.text: This is one of the BEST BBQ places I've been to in a long time! The restaurant is quaint and off the strip.  When you walk in the menu is on the wall, you place your order before you sit down. There is a great variety of pork, brisket and rib sandwiches and dishes.   We ordered the bbq chicken sandwich with corn side, 2 meat combo (which comes with sides of your choice) with waffle fries and The Belt which is bbq shredded brisket on Mac and cheese!         Everything we ordered was amazing! There are different bbq sauces at your table to use with cute name... we loved *The God Sauce* so much we ended up bought 2 bottles to take home!    A definite recommendation, go before dinner if you want ribs they ran out before we arrived.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The The Jive Chicken with Corn with Smoked Butter
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Belt Buckle...regular size huge and yummy!
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two 2 Meats and 1 Side Combo yummy!

RiXaXsGNeWwtE74KKTC6pw.text: Love the pork spare ribs and the beef brisket sandwich!!! Good flavor, good portion, and friendly service!  #supportlocalbusiness

EAemveZTV_pOZxjCR28dMg.text: An update is long overdue for this one! Since my last review (over 3 years ago), I've come in a handful of times to consistently solid food and service- friends who are fans have invited me here for various deal days (follow them on social media) and to check out new menu items (like the Fortress).  I tend to stick to their brisket as my favorite protein option, but their chicken and ribs are good too. Their mac has a good kick to it and their Maniac Fries are good to share. Sandwiches are crazy-loaded and over the top in the best way- you'll definitely leave with a full belly, a great photo to share on social media, and likely also a takeout box, too.   Staff have been great about accommodating groups despite the small location. Parking lot is also small but adjacent businesses have available space during evening visits- try to go earlier for best selection of meats though, as they often run out of popular items like ribs!  TIP: Their sauces are available for purchase, and they also offer a limited selection of desserts by Chef Malia Ploughman- save room or take them to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6bvaxOLCrqOO5yDdAwU0rw.text: Co workers were starving so this place was right around the corner..  Our plates were Packed! So much food and delicious. Meat lovers will definitely mark this place as one of their top bbq spots. The sauce is also something to talk about as I had to eat it with every bite. I totally forgot what I ordered but I can tell you that there were cross cut fries in it with pulled pork, some kind of delicious sausage cuts, mac and cheese was thrown in there somewhere, gravy all over the place.. it was magical. I had to make sure to work out the next day.. totally worth it.  Come check this place out!

aoE4tJFRY7LbDNArmrAjEg.text: Surprising little hole in the wall.  The place is crappy, the tables are haphazard and miss matched, the line is long, it is crowded.   Don't let any of that deter you.  This is some damn good barbecue!!!  I had the small brisket sandwich with waffle fries.  The sandwich was freaking huge and ridiculously delicious.  The waffle fries were crispy and perfectly seasoned.  I normally dislike seasoned fries but these were outstanding.   The brisket was juicy, moist, and smoky.   The slaw was crisp and tangy.  This joint is legit and you should just go here.  The next best 'que is all the way out in Boulder City.   I will be coming back to this little gem of a barbecue restaurant.

6d2-s-xF8IPEKGYN52ho2g.text: Just had a great brisket BBQ sandwich with equally good slaw! Owner and hostess both very, very nice people as well. I will be going there often before UNLV basketball games as well as UNLV football when they move to Raider's Stadium.   Update - I've eaten there about 10 times in the last 12-15 months, and have tried many different things. All have been excellent and memorable. While the decor is badly in need of a remodel, they have by far the best BBQ I have enjoyed in the LV valley!

7siqik7nMO0B3BQd5YC5-Q.text: Update: the owner is awesome! He reached out to me and offered me a complimentary meal. I went to pick up and got to see the place for myself. I added cheese to The Duke with waffle fries. The lady at cashier was super friendly. They have retained me. I might even plan a company event there. Thank you JRB! I recently order from UberEats. I've eaten here before with stellar reviews. I order my food. Excepting nothing less than exceptional since I paid $17 for fries and meat. I get my delivery and I see this...first pic in the corner. I realized, I didn't even get my extra sauce! I had four to five potato wedges. I call the restaurant and complain about the quality and my missing sauce. The lady on the phone tells me I have to take that up with the Chef. Wtf?!? Like I can just tell him to come to the phone. Worst customer service and I have talked to that lady before with no issues but yesterday I wanted to snap. I didn't because I'm not that kind of person. She said they would credit me 5 dollars. What the hell am I supposed to do with 5 dollars. The meal didn't have ranch sauce, the shredded pork was just scraps of ends no center meat. It was dry. You can clearly see the difference in the photos. I have ordered here numerous times and I never felt so disrespected! I basically gave away money because I couldn't eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The second dinning Area
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Duke with shredded cheese and waffle fries
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front area

SnFq_KogNo9K9kB9-pjGJQ.text: This is my favorite bbq spot in the Vegas valley! Smallest bbq joint and I love that it's pretty hidden!! Definitely a hidden jewel.    I've actually bought the $31 groupon deal twice. Pulled pork, spicy sausage links, bbq chicken for two people along with 2 sides and yeast roll. So much food!! I also ordered some brisket the first time around. Let me tell you, none of those meats I've tried disappointed me. All super tender, flavorful, and good as f*ck!! Excuse my language, but yes. This place is finger lickin' yum!   Try all the bbq sauces they have out. My favorite was the original. Just enough bbq sweetness that really went well with the spicy sausage links. Also the white sauce, which I forgot what it's base is. My little sister loved that one the most and dunked every meat in that one.   We've only tried a couple sides. Had a smoked butter corn *insert heart eyes* and the waffle fries. Fresh and made to order fries.   I did this twice with this groupon and I believe thats the max you can purchase the deal but it was worth it. If you havent found this gem, do yourself a favor and give it a shot. You won't be disappointed. I've already  recommended  Jessie Rae's to so many people and everyone that has gone so far, loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauces!

1Dlw4mM7hcBV30idA7CHNw.text: A delicious place to get your BBQ fix with. They have a detailed menu, filled with options that are quick to make your mouth water. If you need images of dishes (since none are available on the physical menu), you can check them out online via places like here on Yelp. If you do, you will notice that it only adds to the water pouring from your mouth.   The service is pretty good. The wait for your food is a bit, but well worth it, as it delivers just as much as your expectations were waiting for. Similar to Rolling Smoke in quality, making this a stop you shouldn't miss.   They have little space inside, so it can be a challenge to sit if they are busy. Even smaller space for parking. So you might have to figure that one out as you go if it's packed outside (parking lot). Trust me though, it's worth the wait.   This visit, I had a Jessie Mac sandwich. The portion was huge and filled with meat (pulled pork and brisket) on a three-layer bun with coleslaw. It included waffle-style fries that went quite well with their tangy BBQ (they have multiple flavors to choose from) and a drink. Well worth the wait, and although I tried my best to finish it. I missed it by that much.

JSkoziZjwmX8bQ_c-KxIAA.text: Not often do I wish yelp allowed me an extra star to make it a 6 star!   Driving by we missed it as it's such a small hole in the wall that it's hard to find. Busy as soon as I stepped out, I could smell the bbq. For this day, the air had a smell of mesquite with a hint of something lighter mixed in.  Every time I travel for work, there is a good shot of my trying out the local bbq. I've tried everything except for the state of Texas and I know it's going to be good.  We ordered a little of everything. For being one of the last customers, the brisket held its juiciness and moistness. Normally brisket dries out after a few hours but this one was amazing.   The baby backs were meaty and really well done.  Normally I don't like mesquite as the bite is a stronger taste but they balanced out their smoke very well.  All the sides were great, but I found the mashed potatoes the winner as it was slightly different then your normal mashed.  Hot link had a snap and a little kick.  The options of bbq sauce let you have a taste of America.  This is now my favorite bbq joint in America which is a bit crazy to say being in Vegas of all places.   Just super happy to find this gem. I'm guessing they will outgrow the location soon and hopefully don't loose any quality as they grow as I've seen that all too often.

q-rHHYNrrf_TfUtrsD2VLQ.text: Wow, Jessie Ray's BBQ was part of the Pigs for Kids charity bbq Championship at Craig Ranch Park. Every was great and the Fallen Angel bbq sauce was fantastic.  They told their story on how they started a business and shared their mission and vision.  It is great they have to get a bigger smoker because they are constantly selling out.  We will be sure to visit the actual store when we are in the area.    I already know they food and atmosphere will be worth the drive.

srMiisKb4eu3E83afh6tgA.text: Don't go!! It was so dirty, flies everywhere and no soap in the bathroom. We just left and I'm hoping I don't end up with food poisoning. Pulled pork was fatty, chicken was okay, brisket was decent (but not great), but none were hot when served and the sides we ordered (Mac and cheese, bbq mashed potatoes, waffle fries, corn and baked beans) were mediocre at best. Unless you want to roll the dice on food poisoning and spend your whole meal swatting away flies, I would not recommend. Staff was very nice, but I will never go back.

nK6slPGRnyMG9KThNgPRAw.text: The three of us have no idea how this place received the rating it has received. For us, it was dreadful, and we will not return, nor will we recommend. My ribs were totally charred, which means they had carcinogens: very dangerous to eat and potentially cancer causing. I showed one of the burnt ribs to the woman at the cash register, and she brought me one new rib; I had ordered three ribs. The one new rib was charred too. They charge $5.75 for each beef rib, which makes it more expensive than a top rated fine bar-b-q restaurant at the District. One in our party ordered the pulled pork sandwich, and he said it was awful. He ate the meat and left the thick bun; it was mostly bun with not much meat. We paid over $51.00 for three people with only one drink, which included a 15% tip for the server, but there really is no service at all. You order and pay at the cash register, and the server brings the food to a wreck of a table. My husband used the unisex bathroom and said it was a mess. I would give it an F grade and will tell people not to eat there. Find another place to eat in this great city!

HTetHxeosGhK_xVTjBFr3Q.text: My new favorite BBQ place. Only downside is that it's a tad pricey, location is not ideal, and not much seating. But the food makes up for it for sure.

oAyGOljZKv0UEx9QSMaU5A.text: On 12/15/17 I took my car in for servicing at Findlay Chevrolet.  When I picked up my car I was told that there was BBQ lunch for all staff and customers.  WOW!!  How nice of Findlay to go the extra mile at the holidays!!    I walked up to the outside area where the BBQ was set up.  The aroma was fantastic.  The choices were awesome.  I had the BBQ chicken and the beans.  I wasn't sure what to expect.  WOW!!!  The BBQ chicken was tender and practically melted in my mouth.  The BBQ sauce, made from scratch at Jessie's, was incredible!  There are 4 flavored choices of their sauce.  Jessie Rae's BBQ is a MUST for BBQ lovers.  If you're not a BBQ aficionado you will be after tasting theirs without a doubt!!!  I truly recommend Jessie Rae's for any catering event.  I just know your guests will be pleasantly surprised!  The two servers/cooks from Jessie's were pleasant and enthusiastic.  I really enjoyed talking with them.  They were wonderful ambassadors for Jessie Rae's BBQ.

Uzpb6Pt67K9fgVoLuUY65A.text: First time here; had a large portion of the "Belt Buckle", which is an enormous, savory platter of mac 'n cheese smothered in freshly smoked brisket and topped with various sweet/tangy sauces. While a little on the luke warm side of temperature, the dish lacked nothing in delicious flavor. I wish the drink selection included something besides a 5 option soda fountain and water from said soda fountain (maybe some brewed tea and lemonade since it's a BBQ joint), and who doesn't love something sweet after all that savory meat (I'm thinking banana & nilla wafer pudding). Overall a great little BBQ joint in an unsuspecting part of town, with warm, friendly service, albeit a bit cramped inside with all the loyal customers who feel compelled to return. Plus with a delightful slogan of "It's All About the Butt", I definitely recommend Jessie Rae's BBQ!

MxDQgzsMw3cm_M1HDhGvgg.text: This is our third time eating here and we always get a large maniac fries for two people to share and its plenty. At first  the description of the maniac fries sounded like someone that was pregnant had to of come up with these but after having them let me just say there is no shortage of meat on them the sausage is out of this world good and the of combination  waffle fries, mac & cheese, sauce, brisket, and all the other goodies  is off the charts good! My hats off to the creative genius that put that combo together.   This establishment is always busy which to me is a good thing because it means not only is it good but the food is fresh. I would never be upset over a place being too small because it has been my experience that I would rather not have a business owner that has a passion for food waste his gifts on the size and looks of the place and would rather them just serve awesome food in a clean restaurant and thats exactly what you get here. The delivery was really slow but I can't say that it would cause me to not order online if I needed to.   Overall yummy, good tasting, good quality, great sized portions for the price. We will be back!

I had chopped beef sandwich and husband had ribs, for tbe sides we had  and mac and cheese and bbq mashed potatoes, All of it was excellent!  Service was excellent We def. give it 2 thumbs up!!

wZ0ioXvvyifd-LKkeEi4Eg.text: I'm a BBQ snob, and I love this place. I also love that they have Alabama's white BBQ sauce. I got the pulled pork with chips on the sandwich. I can't remember the name, but it was delicious. I'm already craving to place again! Luckily, they deliver to my office.

RGdUcmzYBrGCdRkow2TBfw.text: So I tried this place on a crazy day( yesterday)  when they were running a 50% off promotion. We definitely stood in line and waited quite a while (almost an hour!) for food & ended up being able to take it home. Well let me say it was definitely worth the wait it was really good. We ordered a 2 meat and 3 meat combo. We had baby back ribs, pulled pork, brisket, Hot links & barbecue chicken. I loved all of the meat it was very well seasoned and cooked very well. Their barbecue sauce was good had a little kick to it. We ordered sides of the corn, mac & cheese, coleslaw and some corn muffins. The corn and mac & cheese were just average. Really liked their coleslaw and the cornbread was a little hard. All in all the barbecue food was really great and we will be back since it's so close to the house!

eFv2WD8KclnsF1DRYa1QIA.text: This place is INSANE. The BBQ is exactly what you would want. The meat appears to be made hot and fresh every day because once they run out, that's it. They're really more of a Togo spot but we've eaten inside before. It's small and cozy and the staff is really nice. I haven't had anything I don't like here. We usually get the combo meals with brisket, pulled pork and a side of ribs. Their side of buttery corn is the best I've ever had. I can't say enough good things!! I would eat it every day.
