EUMSRQOudd8CFesaTmHETQ.text: Some of the best BBQ we've ever had.  Highly recommend the pulled pork, brisket, waffle fries, and of course, the God Sauce.  Check this place out, just be aware that there is limited seating in the actual location.

OnU5DEjPgYWT_lAQUhgMUA.text: "I don't think we had an order messed up and I was this happy with it."  New neighborhood, tired from work, decided to see what was on GrubHub. BBQ sounded good, so we ordered two 2 meat combos. We got an extra order of chicken but the pork beans we ordered were missing. Disappointing, but the food was so delicious it was like whatever, and I quote: "Now we have an excuse to go in and try it!" Best pulled pork I've ever had, amazing brisket, and the ribs are nuts. They also forgot the sauce, so that's another thing to come in for.

Fx4uVwCuxWGcYU_Vc6IfxQ.text: Good authentic falling meat off the bones bbq and tender  meats.  Fair pricing for what you get and i always feel bbq has to carry a more premium price than just fast food.  My only suggestion for the meat combo is that it should come with two sides, i like trying the other sides on the menu without paying too much extra.  Highly recommend.

6-qXUfZW6XLfcD2La8iB_w.text: Been living in Vegas for some time and Jessie Rae's is the Best BBQ spot in town!!! Try the Duke and the coleslaw !!

oKqMyOeup_r636To1QPMNQ.text: *NOTE*: Dog-friendly patio!!!!  Absolutely divine barbecue! Having lived in Lexington, KY and a Savannah, GA, I know my way around great barbecue, and the folks at Jessie Rae's are right there at the top!  This is easily **The Most Tender Brisket** I have EVER tasted!  But the real treat is the "What-The-Hell-Is-This" deliciousness of the Maniac Fries: an "American Picnic Nachos", if you will, of waffle fries, Mac-n-Cheese, hot links, and your choice of an additional barbecue meat. We chose to add the pork, which was great, but next time we will use the brisket.  Although the barbecue stands on its own, be sure to treat yourself to some of the "Slammin' Bamma" white (yes, I said white!) barbecue sauce! It's indescribably fantastic.... Amazing flavor!  Jessie Rae's is now in my normal rotation of restaurants to visit, and without a doubt on the "must have for lunch" list when friends and family come to town.   Bonus points for being a restaurant that supports national veterans charities and local firefighters.   Second bonus: this is a great place to hit for lunch before or after going guns & ammo shopping at Ventura Firearms, which is one block to the south.

cNQNQpLnImlP9Zjbn6ei0w.text: Best BBQ I've had yet. Delicious meats with a great variety of sauces and sides. If my boyfriend isn't by my side, he's probably here having ribs. Definite must try!

The restaurant itself isn't much to look at, but the service and food far surpassed our expectations. The owners were so welcoming and explained the menu to us. The food arrived quickly and was delicious. I normally don't love bbq places because I'm just not a huge fan of big plates of meat, but the chicken sandwich was wonderful. I had a side of macaroni and cheese. When it arrived, I thought I'd toss it (wasn't pretty) but it was delicious! A total surprise all around.

46QTZtdZjULb-g15KgYMrw.text: I'll be number 600!! Amazong BBQ. By far best in vegas. The sauces are all unique and taste great as well. Pulled pork is definitely the favorite but everything there is great!! Highly recommend.  Also my name is Daniel. No idea why my profile on Yelp changed to a Jessica??

Q4ZmrHvlvDVyL6S85rGHyw.text: Don't judge this book by its cover. It's rough exterior says nothing about the deliciousness that awaits inside. This place has an amazing sauce selection and all the meats. Service is fast and friendly. New favorite BBQ place in Vegas

siz36IN2njmGswL_CEEDUA.text: Stop playin with me yelp! This spot needs more stars. The brisket fries with 3 sides is the move. I dont go to visit vegas anymore i come to Jessie's raes, vegas is now a bonus

4bIbaIn9mXJWMT3AADIi9Q.text: Have to try the Manic Fries!!!!! Omg I will be back on the weekly for those!!! Everything is delicious! Staff was attentive and friendly. wPPOkzP4o4KkSORAYgg7_Q.text: Theres few things more comforting a good plate of pulled pork or brisket covered in a sweet and tangy bbq sauce.  This place is a family owned local spot.  It was hard to find as it is off by itself.  Show up early as we bought what was left over for the day (which was still amazing) when we showed up around 7 pm.  The staff are friendly and carry a lot of pride in their product. The food is not cheap however I would say it is the best quality and flavor bbq in Vegas I have tasted so far (I have been the The Shed in MS).  The serving size and quality make up for the price.  Once you get the plate, grab different types of bbq sauce which are on the table and dig in.  "God sauce" was my favorite. They also  have a Spicy Reaper, Bama white, Carolina vinegar and Carolina yellow mustard version bbq sauces (most PC bbq joint I've been too). The food here reminds me of getting a plate of bbq in Florida, MS, Georgia,  or Carolinas (Texas in regards to the brisket).  If you are from the South, this is the place to be.  Place is casual so wear shorts and a dark shirt as this place carries a high risk of staining your favorite shirt.  Theres a 10% military discount.  Conclusion: show up early and bring your appetite.

pR-vFFmJvvS3wPqEeQtY-A.text: Stopped here today on the way to the Vegas Golden Knights game, and their food is out of this world amazing! You must try their God Sauce, it is awesome! Such friendly service and great people. Lots of local stars always eating here too. Their ribs are tender and smoked to perfection and not spicy unless you add one of their homemade spicy sauces which is perfect since my wife doesn't like spicy food. This is a must stop if you are in town and it's just on the other side of the freeway from Mandalay Bay and the strip. A $5 uber well worth it to get some great local Vegas bbq if you are on the strip. #GoKnightsGo

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My wife got the ribs and waffle fries and I got the rib sandwich! It is awesome real smoked bbq and so much food!

oGwEWzHK3LCIxbrz17kf-g.text: Great local whole in the wall restaurant where the meat falls of the bones. Their sauce is incredible with just the right amount of heat if that's how you like it. The staff is friendly and very attentive. Definitely worth the trip!

nEpeYdLtK1YhsTYNCzg2NQ.text: This place was amazing! We dropped in for lunch with friends. It was fast, and beyond delicious. Definitely will be back lots!!

dkVycbwm4Qeu3JN3wdbbFw.text: If you're looking for a local rib joint Jessie Rae's BBQ is the place to be. The menu is on the wall and you pay as you order your food. This place isn't super busy and I recommend coming here if you're super hungry.

mjl3ukpDR1pbQQkFR7wvpw.text: I stopped by here with a friend for lunch. When I first walked in there wasn't any where to sit. Inside it is small and there aren't very many tables, but by the time we ordered our food there was a table that opened up. They have expanded some, so there's at least more places to sit than before. Hole in the wall bbq is the best way I can describe Jessie Rae's after walking inside and honestly I wouldn't want any less. Inside was clean and there were different bbq sauces on the table all of which were good. I recently came by with a group of friends for dinner and they were giving half off the entire menu (just for that evening) to celebrate their Best of Las Vegas win. Nice!   Three Meat Combo ($19.99) - Pick 3 meats or triple up on your favorite. This combo includes one side. The pulled pork has been inconsistent when I've visited as far as flavor, texture and look. The hot links are tasty with a nice kick of flavor. It's the brisket though that shines. Tender, juicy and flavorful brisket can be chopped per your request should you like.  Jive Chicken ($8.75 regular size) - Waffles fries piled with smoked hand-pulled chicken? Sign me up! The waffle fries had just the right crispness and held up all the toppings well. The chicken had a great flavor and was well l liked by others in my group also.   The Belt Buckle ($11.25 regular size) - This is like the Jive Chicken, but we asked for tater tots instead of waffle fries on this one. The tater tots were crispy, tasty gems. The brisket was piled high they did not skimp. The tots really did well holding up the juicy brisket. This with either the tots or waffle fries would be a great thing for a group to share and they have a larger size also.   Corn with Smoked Butter ($2.75) - This sounded better than it was. The corn wasn't bad, but it honestly tasted like corn from a can that was heated up in butter.   BBQ Beans ($2.75) - I ate every bite of these beans the first visit and did the very same on the next. They drizzle a bit of bbq sauce on the top of the beans and I could have eaten another side because these beans oh my they were so good!   Mac and Cheese ($2.75) - The first time I came the mac and cheese was very good. This last visit the mac n cheese wasn't at all the same taste or texture. I'd have rather doubled up on beans! Maybe it was just an off night for the mac and cheese since they were so busy, so I won't rule it out again in the future.   They have a variety of sandwiches on the menu and mini cobbler for dessert. There's a private parking lot, but when it gets busy cars park on the street at the side of the building.

dqgZNOKq4vRa2MldocDB8A.text: Words can't describe my satisfaction with this place, everything and everyone was great. I came here on Saturday afternoon for an early Father's Day lunch with my parents and boyfriend. At first I thought my parents were overhyping this little business but it turns out they didn't. My boyfriend and I got a pulled pork sandwich then my parents got a full rack of ribs. The pulled pork was just nice and juicy, knowing myself and how picky I am with pulled pork I was highly satisfied with it. The ribs were amazing as well! The Mac n cheese tasted homemade that I just couldn't have enough of it. Their sauces they carry are amazing, especially the highly recommended "God Sauce".  I would easily recommend this place to everybody!

Wbog54it549LNL0-g7u8Rg.text: I have heard about this place and couldn't wait to try it.  Three of us ordered from work from Grubhub.  A three-meat platter, a two-meat platter and a sandwich combo.  Half the meat on the sandwich was white fat and no soda came with it.  No BBQ sauce.  Three-Meat platter-has specific instructions to have extra extra BBQ sauce on the side.  Came with a tiny small container of BBQ sauce.  Two-Meat container-came with no sauce  I called them and was explained there was already sauce on the meat.  Last time I checked, who goes to a BBQ place and does not use lots of sauce?  Very disappointed.  Going to eat this pretty dry.  Won't go back again.  I would rather spend my $$$ at Rollin Smoke.

CLXjRRnmDmQsVBqxYmuGIw.text: Some of the best bbq I've eaten! Reasonable prices and friendly servers. The selection of sauces was extensive and interesting. I would recommend Jessie Rae's without reservation if craving BBQ while visiting Vegas!

FzrJHCoCTAgrTGSWoMOV9A.text: EXCELLENT BBQ!!! I had a lunch for work catered by Jessie Raes BBQ and it was the best!! Everyone commented on how delicious everything was. We had Ribs, chicken and brisket. Generous sides included were corn, coleslaw AND baked beans - all were 5 stars!! We added Mac n cheese and it was also excellent. The rib meat was so tender and falling off the bone, the brisket was flavorful and perfect, the chicken was the bomb also. Oh, I don't want to forget about the sauce..... it is called ' God Sauce' for a reason!! Delicious!! We had a large bottle and by the end of the day, it was all gone!! We had a happy crew for sure! Jessie Raes made planning this event so easy. From the first call,all the way to delivery, it was perfect. If you are looking for a delicious BBQ place or planning an event, you just found your place!! Call or go to Jessie Raes BBQ right now!! You will be glad you did!!!

2WtYBQWSeRPYxaJCuU-8Iw.text: Jessie's is one of those "diamond in the rough" hole-in-the-wall places. Good value for the price. You get a lot of really great food. I got the jive chicken sandwich with corn and couldn't finish it. They also have a variety of BBQ sauces. It's fresh, fast, and the service is good.

_1_shNQkW4CZxPcgdI8sFg.text: The "Jessie Mac" is one of the best bbq sandwiches I have had in a long time. I highly recommend finding this gem in Las Vegas. Can't wait to come back.

fcCzYgubCtRg-nfdf9UXjw.text: A good friend of mine knows that I do a lot of catering for my office.  He told me about this restaurant and mentioned we should give it a shot to see how we would like it.  Working with Mike was a complete breeze.  He and his team are professional and the food was (from my attorney's)  EXCELLENT!  I was told by one of my partners to definitely put them into our catering rotation as he would love to have them again.  Go try them out!   It's amazing!

abzlxVqnfJRKz35zdTHDJA.text: Jessie Rae's BBQ is a new little BBQ gem in a little area outside strip behind Mandalay Bay. Parking and seating can be limited at times and gets pretty busy certain times of day. Had the awesome Maniac Fries (half order only)  -it was huge, filling, mac n cheese and brisket/sausage on top of waffle fries, I tried a few waffle fries before but the ones here were crispy, crunchy and seasoned, one of the better.                                I tried samples of meats through friends pulled pork/brisket were both tender and flavorful, ribs were tasty. The Sandwich the Jessie mac was huge w/ brisket & pulled pork double decker, it was loaded and high -I had to used a fork & knife for help. What made Jessie Rae's different is the sauces they have to go with the food, sauces like The God Sauce, Slammin Bama and spicy Fallen Angel sauce -all great on everything, My favorite was Alabama and god sauce mix, on waffle fries, brisket, pork on top of cole slaw. I will be back soon.

h4bGs4fJwolB6RhT6V6_8A.text: For a straight forward review, scroll down to the bottom and click "Reviews Not Recommended".  *Update and response to the owner below*: *Is that all you can say? "Get over it", I paid real money so I gave an honest review, everyone else please read my reviews below. It seems like you have a lot to learn on customer service and running a business. Try again next time.

4n1Jj7qEw-decPpTEfoakw.text: This place has good food, and that's about it. The dining area is about as small as a walk in closet. They tried to fit 4 tables in there so you're going to be rubbing your ass up against the shoulders of anyone else that's already sitting and vice versa. Like I said, I loved the pulled pork sandwich that I ordered. It had pork, potatoes chips, and slaw. Definitely the place to get take out.

SyOFFiJvCdsU_U3OumTtjw.text: Visiting from Texas and found this place on Yelp.  Even with the good reviews I was a bit skeptical, but the reviews were right - this place is good. The people are awesome and the food was delicious. If you want some good BBQ in Vegas, it's here.

g5s5sSvAbxMXELLT3uptqg.text: Best BBQ I've had in awhile! Exceptional customer service. They had to wait to unlock the door so the owner came out to our car with menus and took our order so when they could open it was ready for us. A great gem off the strip. Will go again next time in town!

JbGMN7Uhr73deVSO8WGf5g.text: They were out of brisket so that kid of took the wind out of the sails,  I ordered the chicken. It was decent but will likely check out other places.

W4HjFCl-W7H3X0wyTsR01w.text: Great BBQ and their sauces are delicious especially the God sauce.  I stumbled upon this place on my way back from the Outlet Mall and I'm so glad I stopped by.  My husband and I enjoyed the food very much.  The lady at the cash register is super friendly and helpful.

akmA9SCj-w0XPh-qygbcKA.text: What a delight barbecue restaurant!! We found it on Yelp and we're very pleased. The food is excellent and they deliver anywhere in the city. The BBQ master is very creative. He changes his smoking woods weekly. My favorite sauce was the God Sauce. Yummy find.

BGpdRFhTxokUoeoJc9Wjeg.text: This place is soooooooo good. Literally just started eating it and had to write a review immediately because it is hands down one of the best bbq places In the valley. Got the duke waffle fries and a 2 meat combo with Mac n cheese. The pork has such a good flavor to it, not too smokey and sauce was a perfect match. The mac n cheese is probably some of the best Mac n cheese I've ever had. My kid got the small waffle fries and seriously devoured them in five seconds because they were so damn good. Definitely will be back. Owner and staff are super friendly and helpful as well. Thanks guys, derrricccioussss!

I'm not  a really big fan of coleslaw, but mike was more than willing to substitute with plenty of cheese, and then theres the mac n' cheese, unlike any other I've eaten, with plenty of cheese and very creamy ! mike is the man, and it shows in his customer service and willingness to deliver the best bbq that money can buy !

MpQVFephEl3BYIUTlnZYcA.text: One of the best bbq place in Vegas! Other that can compare is John mulls. Brisket was juicy. Ribs fell right off the bone. And Mac n cheese was amazing with dry rub seasoning on top. Must try! Closest thing I can find that can live up to traditional Texas bbq. vgj9rH7Ry_GmxZblSDTFhg.text: The barbecue brisket is amazing! The sauces are delicious and only enhance the already amazingly delicious meat. There isn't a lot of seating, but this is definitely a place to visit while in Vegas. It's quality, delicious, barbecue!

NgiVKvFo6CXP7soJ87QH5g.text: This.is the best BBQ in Vegas. The food is incredible, the people are even better. Everything is awesome. Literally...order it all!! Follow them on social media, they offer deals all the time. But the food is worth every penny!!

4rOFjmdtgYcjXG8jVaz07w.text: Simply amazin been here 2 times now. I love the homey warm feeling i get walking in and all the food and staff are amazing!!!!!

Rv50Kzr8hKsuJcS3qNbCvA.text: Had a friend tell me about this place just after it opened up last September (2015)... I finally got a chance to go this afternoon for lunch (I'm not from Vegas). Let me tell you,  it lived up to all expectations!   Very reasonable prices,  great combo deals,  lots of variety on the menu for a bbq place. Another customer ordered something called Maniac Fries and they looked great.   I ordered a two meat combo with bbq mashed potaoes,  and my buddy got 3 meat with house made mac n cheese.  I made sure to get ribs and pulled pork,  since any good bbq place should do those well.    The food was amazing.  Literally melt off the bone... And the sauces were great.  I can see why the "God's Sauce" has won awards.   I'll be back,  and would definitely recommend this spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 meat combo in foreground, 3 meat combo in background

S4NYm1YdmaKMZf9-CSHrxA.text: I have eaten Jesse Rae's a few times because of parties that I've been to and every single time they have been absolutely phenomenal! I have pretty much tried everything and I can say  that I have loved everything!! I definitely think they are the best barbecue in town! I am from Texas So I like to think that I would know o good barbecue and Jessie Ray's is definitely give Texas barbecue a run for their money. The restaurant is small so don't expect to take a big group there but I would definitely recommend them for any party or catering that you might have! Their briskets are juicy as hell and sides dishes are so tasty. Now let's get to their barbecue sauces because those are the real deal from the hottest one called Fallen angel to God sauce! Which If God eats barbecue I would imagine that's what he would want his sauce to taste like. The names fit the sauces perfectly! Jesse Rae's is the best barbecue in town hands down!!!

GwRN2fSh7Vi1IA4tPEsW8w.text: Amazing place to visit  Real tenders ribs and tips, defining i recommend to try their brisket and cslaw.

j6DAv9WVwOrIU58pI8bBCA.text: Best BBQ I've had in Vegas. Definitely get your money's worth. Brisket is to die for!

_yvHnxamgb80lucoqWcDQw.text: Went here for lunch with my boyfriend. The food was really good and large helpings, but the price was slightly high. The 3 stars is due to the bad service. The lady at the register was very abrupt, rude, aggressive and interruptive. I had barely taken my last bite when she reached across the table and took our food, while asking if we were finished. oD-8ZrSrrNGiO3cmRSIIAQ.text: I had tried to eat at their new Henderson location without luck so when I was near the original location I jumped at the chance.    I called in my order of pick 3 with ribs, brisket and pulled pork.  I wanted to try the sausage but they didn't have it that day.  For sides I picked mac n cheese and baked beans.  I arrived a little after 11 and they were already slammed.  The man I guessed to be Mike was handling everything with ease.  Phone orders, people dining in, communicating with the kitchen.  He did it all while still greeting and chatting with guests.  Great customer service.  After a torturous drive home I dug into some of the best bbq I've had in Vegas.  All the meats were delicious.  Ribs were my favorite.  They need to bottle and sell their sauce.  It's that good.  I was a little disappointed in the sides though.  The mac in cheese didn't have much flavor and the beans tasted like canned pork and beans but with no pork in sight.   Maybe they use that as a base and I got the unfinished version?  Or just an off day?  Whatever the case I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GGmvKMmYY6ORq17yLdo0sw.text: Jessie Rae's BBQ is CONSISTENTLY GREAT!  The sliced brisket is always on point and the ribs are very good.  Wish they had sliced onions and jalapenos like the Texas joints I'm used too, but for legit Texas style BBQ they're worth the stop, plus they've added more seating.

cQF9hJcSJfdFGQeVA9pUvw.text: Best bbq in vegas hands down! They catered my baby shower two years ago and it was amazing! Everyone loved it, people still ask about it! Now I get to enjoy this place with my daughter!

r1oIPzBxeVZv17PSY7mBOA.text: I've eaten here several times and really love it. That God Sauce is just unreal.  Loved the pulled pork sandwiches.  (ask for extra cole slaw on the sandwich)  Also, be sure to get a bottle of sauce to take with you.  My kids aren't big fans of BBQ, but when we use the Jessie Rae sauce they go back for seconds!

qxWhBNs2xoA_Xhgzv1sJ6A.text: You can't go wrong with this food here, fantastic prices and the amount of food is huge. Fantastic staff and very friendly.

SXk2Zv-oEM-S-Wqq2RUTgA.text: I just wanted to say .... I came to Lucille's in California for some bbq and it was a JOKE compared to this place lmao  I miss you Jessie Rae

kVFvNX96dJsukaTXFH-dqw.text: If you like eating food then you will love this fucking barbecue place. It's so goddamn good don't be fooled by the crummy inside or outside it's not important. What is important is how well they make that God damn brisket, ribs, chicken and pulled pork. Sensible prices and decent combos are great not to mention their impeccable sauces. Any place that bothers making their own sauces proves that they care about the food they serve. Do yourself a flavor favor and put Jessie Raes in your face. Only criticism is the Mac & cheese is soggy. Good work everyone.

YS12BXSfY-OOfltiqczZeg.text: My boyfriend and I love BBQ. We have gone to a few BBQ spots in town. This is by far our favorite now. We ordered their maniac fries with pulled pork and side of beans. So delicious. As my boyfriend would say "absolutely magical". We will definitely be going back to try their brisket, and continue going anytime we want BBQ.

xgvbwwSGXk4UDekeMbIzBw.text: I got food poisoning from eating their food. Not sure if it was the mac n cheese, the jerk chicken with mashed potatoes, pulled pork, hot links, or spare ribs. The price for it all was chill but then waking up sick wasn't worth it.. stuck in bed until it passed over  Edit: Not only did I get sick but so did my partner. This was the only meal I had that day. So I'm pretty sure it was the food.  Response: super late but ya. I had one meal that whole day. And whatever I ordered wasn't your whole menu lol pump your brakes. And thanks but no thanks, I don't need a refund from your rude ass. Just wanted to let people know the food here gave me the shits and made me throw up for 8 hours straight.

gThgcMrxhV1O9eM1YHcqDg.text: Terrible,  wrong taco meat. Cold food, missing food item,  waffle fries. Upside the bbq ribs and rib tip are tasty.

nhoB5RDSzct9fgC41vw6PQ.text: Amazing Sandwiches and pulled pork. Great quality meats!! I loved the Double Brisket sandwich and the Loaded fries!!

HGWXKTTKwziIvbkXJhC6XQ.text: Don't let the small storefront fool you, this restaurant is loaded with flavor and character! The brisket and pulled pork sandwich are perfection! I was too scared to try the "Fallen Angel" (made from the hottest pepper on earth) and "Pig Sweat" , the God sauce was perfect for every dish!   Don't pass this place up!!

cANTA-z4Ui5mGf0YjI2VKw.text: Best bbq in town!!! I porked in Vegas and it was amazing! Drove by and there was a line out the door. Had to stop in and it definitely did not disappoint!  Unfortunately we will have to be back for their ribs, which I hear is the best!

KJswl5Vq4-6cRbkUxTFtqg.text: The Best!!!! To be totally truthful there is not one thing wrong with anything.. Every single thing is so good. You could order anything and you wont be disappointed..

tvvbI5RbVMIMSSoCi6uRoA.text: So freaking bomb! I've eaten here three times in the last week. Always awesome food and the owner is very personable.

cwLixZlqX8jNt4Tbqhwqlg.text: 3 of us came in and had to try the pulled pork sandwiches that we saw pictures of. The pork was tender, moist, and full of flavor. There was just the right amount of homemade slaw on top to add a great freshness and texture to the sandwich. God sauce....unbelievable, a must try. I added a little of the Carolina vinegar bbq sauce too for just the right amount of tang. Dont pass this place u!. I hear they do a lot of catering too. Ill keep that in mind for my next event. Keep it up Mike!

0XbRzYIG1fmrxPEPPE8aIg.text: Jessie Rae's never lets me down. Hands down the best bbq I've had in Vegas. James and his whole crew is amazing and is always looking to go above and beyond for his foodies!! This is my go to bbq spot. This place won't let you down, that's for sure!! A must try!

x7kRBvtSqwXo-_6y23POMQ.text: Hands down the best bbq I've ever had. I had the pull pork sandwich with the smoked corn which I devoured In Like 2 minutes. After that I began to pick off my sisters plate. She got the tri tip and sausage combo with Mac and cheese. My sister was getting mad at me cause I couldn't stop eating her food. Jessie Rae's is a must try. I will be back!!

ChXsNJ2i6VYLNauSkBnufA.text: My friends and I decided to try this place out. We've been to some other BBQ places but Jesse Rae's is definitely up there. Definitely in my top 3 places to go. We got the High Roller Combo as well as the Maniac fries. The fries were really good, the brisket wasn't dry and and chicken was really good. I will definitely be coming back.

cK73khusTOoTjLR3-pCqNw.text: We have good BBQ in our state, but this was the best BBQ I've had. And it was cheaper than we usually pay.  Jessie Rae is also a friendly guy.

X0LZ6bUYkMTJBeji4kzsIg.text: Great food. Huge portions. Very good service. Get there early there aren't very many tables.  Cant praise enough. Everything is delicious!

hjk9dSVykXY73AW1GW3Cbw.text: This place is definitely a hole in he wall BBQ joint, and that's what I LOVE about it !! The owner definitely has a passion for top quality bbq. You can tell he uses the highest quality rubs and knows how to cook. Not to mention he is the friendliest guy you will meet. There seems to always be a line so get there early. I had the brisket sandwich and it was stacked, very fair value for your money. If you haven't tried this place yet you need to. I will definitely hit this joint every time I visit Vegas

IO3I4VSQlPUwMoJz6ijEYg.text: Great food and great customer service! Try the pork with the god sauce and some mac and cheese.

8LUnGvLmXdBGX_hUp-1lPQ.text: Easily the best BBQ in vegas!  The Duke fries are absolutely AMAZING and don't forget about The God's Sauce!!!

ucF2wofNN19HqhjGyt5BAA.text: Catered our party.  They did a great job!  We will have them back over and over again

WS_ShMfZDKjtvMymzxMCAQ.text: Mike knows his stuff!!! Ribs don't stay on the bone. At all. Pulled pork was killer, add some pig sweat and BOOM!!! Baked beans, home made Mike's Cole Slaw and all year long green bean casserole were off the chain!!! Will be back, over and over again.

93UlUIxobUIapTufvbqJBA.text: Sorry Guys, not that good. I had the chicken and brisket. The chicken was nice and plump but was way under cooked. I cannot eat snappy chicken. I had a tough time trying to pull the leg away from the thigh. When I did it was still bleeding. The meat was very hard to get off the bone. I put it down and couldn't eat it. The brisket was very tender but was so greasy that it didn't have a good flavor. All I could taste was the grease. It also was inedible. I threw away the brisket and the chicken. They didn't have water in the place at least in the front section and the cooler was just about empty. The beans were good but that's about it. Maybe I got in on a bad day. I would say try again from all of the good reviews but I don't think I can.

jaRJkGb_r1GnxE31G4mmzg.text: Oh my gosh your brisket & pulled pork, coleslaw combo is DELICIOUS.  Brought some home to have for dinner with my husband tomorrow and is he ever going to be so happy after his long work week and travel.  I'm telling you folks, Jesse Rae's BBQ is worth the trip out to the Bruce Trent Wednesday Farmer's Market just to see that smile on your family's faces.  Also a huge congratulations on Jessie Rae's BBQ for their newly opened restaurant!  You can be sure the next time we are in Henderson we will stop by for some ribs.  Yum!  Keep up the Award Winning BBQ, Best, Cristine

c874K4K3D3avmxEfYH9GEw.text: Just happened upon this during a Vegas visit.  Lived in Nashville and this by far was the best Brisket!

nx6_gwIxB5Osr6GG6yNrjQ.text: Friendly and awesome people! BBQ is one of the best I've had in a while! Sauces is just perfect!

gWWaljdZMyrfAZPFp7c_cg.text: Seriously the best BBQ ever!! The service and food are by far the best. The sauce  GAME CHANGER. You don't know BBQ until you come here.

LbTmshr-qPtwnJxsaK_DzA.text: If you're looking for a mom-and-pop barbecue spot this is the place. Hidden Las Vegas gem.

iDOQYbjZLWxZxS15_ZIT-A.text: Went to visit here a few weeks ago with my aunt and it was so great! Such a fun happy place and Rebecca was AMAZING!! She made us feel like we were right at home. The food is to DELICIOUS!!!!

bzsj0FnoOrl9SPIhWintDQ.text: Their brisket is amazing. Great sauces. Tender meats. Mac & cheese is better than most.

9ka8Lt7HCWi2QTvQtZ2vZQ.text: This was beyond a doubt the best brisket I've ever eaten ! Probably the best b-b-que in Las Vegas brisket was moist ribs flavorful the spicy sweet corn was a yummy surprise & the baked beans will make you wanna slap your mama for never serving them to you like this ! This was my 1st time here but I will be a regular customer from now on even if it's on the other side of town from where I live . Well done Jessie Rae well done.

xdVmuHd7tikURO9QhsrxzQ.text: We were so disappointed we missed my wife's coworker friend's BBQ pop-up last week in San Francisco... so, we decided to look for a BBQ in Vegas. We're not disappointed anymore.   OMG! The best BBQ ribs we've had in years. The pulled pork just melts in your mouth... both were so juicy and tender. We actually didn't expect to find anything as good as this in Vegas, but we did. The sauce is what makes or breaks the BBQ and Jesse Rae's BBQ is the place for BBQ. As for the brisket, we prefer a little bit more marbling, but flavor was good. Just a little warning, they only have 4 tables. Suggest that you take out if the place is packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. three meat combo with corn. brisket, pulled pork and ribs. JUICY and TENDER!

EsI93nHrvvnggmTu8mKu8A.text: Being a barbeque snob in Las Vegas is not all swine and charcoals's, believe you me.   It's hard enough having to keep a stash of napkins with you just about everywhere you go, but trying to explain that the spot of sauce on your lapel came from another disappointing attempt at barbeque in this town is about as heartbreaking as it gets. Somedays, I wish I could just go back home to Texas.   Jesse Rae's is not one of those barbeque places. In fact, the meat is pretty damn good. With a few exceptions on some of Mike's selections of sides, Jesse Rae's is damn good 'cue. The Fallen Angel sauce is my favorite (despite being a Carolina sauce), but the ribs are awesome without any sauce at all.  We catered in from Jesse Rae's for about 70 people a few weeks back and I have to say Mike did a bang up job. Certainly some of the best smoked meats you will find in the valley, and if Mike keeps perfecting his technique, he is not far from  being as good as you'll find anywhere in Texas.  Keep up the good work Mike, and thanks again for making our event a great success. Everyone loved it.

kk7rr14JHlVtb0MxAhndXA.text: You're better off heading to the frozen food aisle at your local grocery store. The WORST Mac n Cheese I've ever tried (1 bite was all I could stomach), tasted like the store bought, boxed, powdered mix kind, I think they must've ran out of their own & thought the box would suffice, AWFUL. Paid $2 for a 12oz glass of watered down coke, what a waste. The sauces were great but thats honestly the ONLY decent item I tried so I must admit I was shocked to see this place had 4+ stars. And No Napkins or Ketchup (which I specified in my order). Needless to say that I Will NEVER be ordering food from them again.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

giHHWzuguXtO7IsmuzaVhw.text: I eat a lot of bbq. I've come to the conclusion, there are only 2 BBQ places in Vegas worth going to. Rollin' Smoke and Jessie Rae's. In my opinion, Jessie Rae's is better by a hair. Unless you're judging by sauce, then they're better by the entire race! Jessie Rae's has the bbq sauce I've tasted in my life! You put Fallen Angel on a dog turd I'd probably be able to choke it down.  I've tried most of the stuff on the menu, it's all delicious. The best thing on the menu is the maniac fries. Get it with tots instead of waffle fries, and put loads of the white sauce and fallen angel on it. Take one bite and you'll be in heaven! Make sure to get your hand stamped on the way out to guarentee reentry upon death. YES I AM CLAIMING MANIAC FRIES ARE SO GOOD YOU'RE GUARANTEED A SPOT IN HEAVEN!  Portions are generous. Prices are good ....when you consider how expensive bbq usually is. So get your ass over there.

lcWXHr5kG-ITmcAcMDfxBQ.text: They have one huge, unforgivable flaw at this restaurant: they close at six! Who does that? I can only go here on my weekends because I don't make it for dinner when I am working. Jessie Rae is the boyfriend who lives in another state just to keep you interested.   Once I get over the betrayel to my schedule that is closing at 6pm, I love this place. I love the hole-in-the-wall, home town barbeque vibe. The place is really small, I didn't see a maximum occupancy sign but I assume anymore than 15 people would be some sort of fire hazard. There are only four tables covered in plastic table clothes, which is what I like in my BBQ joints! It's the down to earth backyard BBQ realness that I crave. My only complaint here is that I did not see or could not find any wet wipes or hand sanitizer. I left with my hands feeling pretty sticky which is uneccesary in our day and age of magic, one-time-use disposable hand cleaning clothes.   The loaded plate was literally everything. Tater Tots and waffle fries with cheese and pulled pork and BBQ sauce. Next time I get this I am going to ask for some sauce on the side so I can SMOTHER it. It was delicious.   The mac and cheese was good too, as well as both of the meats on my boyfriends plate. The only thing I would not get again is the green bean casserole. I thought this came out watery and the only friend onion crunch was on the top. I make green been casserole every year for my family's thanksgiving so I am some what of an expert - lol - avoid this for the other delicious sides offered by Jessie Rae's

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious,  delicious tots.
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The haul.
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YASSSSSS GAWD LOADED PLATE

JLacOCM5yxYCOy_XJ0e28A.text: So today I drove 45 minutes to get to this place very family ,, soon as I walked in the customer service was really nice the vibe that they got there it's pretty cool the lady who help me up a front counter and the owner of the restaurant are really nice people I highly recommend you guys to take a minute and go check this place out when I open the food in my work is really good smell good and taste good I highly appreciate it the good service that you guys give me , my name is alex and I say first this guy is going to places with this restaurant

Zy9uWzJiGOLQtcqadZJI1g.text: Samantha was awesome! The burnt ends and ribs were fantastic! True hole in the wall to visit if you love bbq.

3zdLfQ6m0hW_pdBPXdP13g.text: Just a few thoughts about Jessie Rae's. My only complaint is that they are not closer to my home. I have been to nearly every BBQ restaurant in Las Vegas and many throughout the southwest. I can say without reservation that this is the best of the best. The portions are generous and the sauces taste homemade.  The only thing that would enhance the experience is a cold beer with the meal.  I'm hooked for life.

LI_PiWUtO5tJFphTE8g7WA.text: This is unfortunate and a tough review to write. The food was good. I'm not sure it's as amazing as a lot of other people claim, but it was very tasty. Great variety of BBQ sauces. Each one very different and very distinct. Good amount of food for the price? Not so much. But hey, it's a tiny little house made BBQ joint, so that's to be expected. I was in there when a construction worker ordered his lunch...$18! Ouch!  We ordered the pork'd in Vegas sandwich & the Jessie Rae. Pork'd in Vegas is the clear star. Hearty, balanced. Everything you want in a BBQ sandwich. The Jessie Rae is served on sandwich style bread, very light, very airy. It had potato chips in it along with other unnecessary ingredients. I didn't think this sandwich was filling or balanced.   But the real reason why I could only give two stars....the flies. The amount of flies flying inside and landing on us as we were eating was one of the most unpleasant dining experiences ever. Even if it was the absolute best food I've ever had...even if the entire world proclaimed this place as the holy grail of BBQ, I couldn't return or even order to go...if there were that many flies in the dining room, one could only imagine what was going on in the kitchen.  Jessie Rae, best of luck to you...you make a darn good pork sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Jessie Rae. Bread is too light. Too airy. Not filling.
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We pork&#39;d in Vegas. Very nice.

10eu1E7S6F4-CjWaSd6oCw.text: Best BBQ in town! Blows Rollin Smoke out the water! The brisket was tender and flavorable, ribs fall off the bone,  the bbq sauce is delish!   You must try the Belt Buckle. It has crispy, seasoned waffle fries, brisket and sauce. Seriously the best thing I have eaten.   Service is friendly as well :)

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uycKZP92l12NOkKKxcPKkQ.text: This is an amazing find. My friend wanted BBQ and I wasn't even really feeling it until I got my food. Jesus, dude. I was in the zone...  I ordered the Jive Chicken and the guy behind the counter said they were out of chicken, as they just fulfilled a large catering order, so he actually pulled one of the chicken dishes from the catering order for me! Thanks guy!  Our waiter was also super cool and personable. I would absolutely go back to Jessie Rae's. I wish I was there right now...

B5cMKxKsL2EhfSXOFNi-wA.text: Jesse Rae's BBQ ie some serious "CUE". I had the brisket sandwich 2 ways which was delicious. My wife had the pull pork which was excellent and the Mac n cheese was the bomb. I also had the sausage links, and they had a kick with some great flavor and that "snap" which all good links have. Definitely 4 thumbs up. A definite visit if you're looking for great reasonably priced food in Las Vegas.

Erifd2zPjsYFFi0RT7T2xw.text: The good: Food is amazing. I had the two meat combo with brisket, spare ribs, and coleslaw. Everything tasted great. The barbecue sauce is also phenomenal.  The bad: edited pending 2nd Visit :)

JNxhRYBiG2L7f8-21PIYMQ.text: I'm torn whether I will come back or not.   Being a BBQ lover, and my first time here, I ordered the three meat combo (brisket, rib tips, and tri-tip) with waffle fries. The presentation was terrible. The size of the basket was very small for 3 meats and the fries were spread across the plate. I couldn't see what was under the fries. All the meats were wet and drizzled with some kind of sweet sauce. Anyway.. The chopped brisket was good. I wasn't expecting it to be chopped but it was still good. The rib tips were very fatty and hardly any meat on them. I know rib tips can come with some fat and cartilage but these were way too fatty. The tri tip was just ok. Very chewy and almost as if it was not cut against the grain.   Biggest complaint was that all the meats came wet with some kind of sweet sauce (maybe from the waffle fries) and the terrible presentation.  Perhaps the three meat should come on a different plate or the side should be served separate.   On a side note, all of the sauces on the table were great. But again all my meat came wet and sweet already so I didn't really get to enjoy the sauces as much.

3tb2j9Tvz-WuD04J072Ehw.text: We were looking for some good BBQ for dinner and found this place.  We really lucked out. The food was GREAT! The spareribs were melt in your mouth tender. The chicken was delicious and the brisket flavorful and tender. The sausage link was really spicy so make sure you can handle spicy food.  The service was top notch also. Owner came out to greet us and made sure everything was good. Would definitely recommend this place.

AeXaszCcR3uBVfMj62q9OQ.text: 5 Stars is a must, if there was 10 stars then i'd give 10. I have tasted some great food working in Las Vegas the past 10 years , But Jessie Rae's BBQ, just jumped to the top of my list of MUST TRY !!!!!!! The food and flavor is OUTSTANDING and service was great. Defiantly be back. Do yourself a favor and go try Jessie Rae's BBQ

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 meat combo. Food is outstanding. MUST TRY

GYCPywbPDlDTygYAk4jX8Q.text: Ordered 2 meat combo, chopped brisket and hot link with waffle fries. Used God sauce all throughout my dining  I gave them 2 stars because the chopped brisket looked like it was not smoked. I did not see any smoke rings and the brisket was chewy. I do not eat that much hot links but the one I got tasted like a regular hotdog. Not making another trip back here I think.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-gWnKAAAF25UjL_-vxHtdg.text: First time visiting and most likely the last. Came in after the 4th of July holiday. Even though the meats was good, cornbread muffin was a little cold and hard, probably refrigerated. But overall good flavored the meats.   The customer service is not so good. Came in after the July 4th Holiday. Walked in, the female workers asked if I had been here before. I said no (since I was visiting from out of town) then the older lady behind the register said there's the menu (pointing to the wall) there's some on the counter as well. I said ok, thanks! She asked for my name and asked if the order was to go or dine in?   Just wanting to try something quick and simple, like pulled pork or brisket with a side of mac. So I told her, I'll take the belt buckle fries, for $11.75 (listed at the bottom of the wall menu). Then the lady pointed to the menu mounted on the counter and said ok, but which combo? I was confused.... she said go look at the wall menu, you need to chose two meats, still bit confused because the fries appeared to look like they come with brisket. I was advised that I needed to select a minimum of two meats for my fries. So I ordered brisket and sausage, added a drink. Next thing I know is that my total was about $23/$24 bucks. Since I already felt like I was being pressured to order a minimum, I didn't feel like asking about the price increased, since she seemed really pushy about a minimum order for meats.  My question, are the belt buckle fries listed on the bottom of the wall menu priced without the meats? Or was this a slow day and the lady was trying to up sale/ increase sales for the day and was sold something different or different size?  I'm thinking a moderate total price for the belt buckle fries with a drink should've been around $16/17 bucks.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belt Buckle Fries.

387Rdtj6HyRnEvA3x58-Cw.text: I've been looking for a real cue shack in Vegas forever and I finally found one. My 'guardians' got mad cuz I snuck a fair share of spare ribs. You can tell a real cue shack by its spare ribs and they were delish. My only small critique is the sweet corn with smoked butter was a little salty but it's great.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spare ribs and rib tips. Can&#39;t wait for me &#39;guardians to look away so I can sneak a bite.

DoWSxdghxfhjbyIxzpKKcA.text: Good ribs, over priced for about it food maybe a little overrated. Beans were not great, Mac n cheese seemed to come out of box not sure how they known for Mac. Good BBQ sauce choices. Brisket was decent.

gBLREPymp5_l9c_MO7S-sA.text: Solid good hole in the wall BBQ restaurant. This place is small like 6 or 7 tables small. You order your food at the cash register and they bring it out to you. The BBQ sauce was delicious. I loved the super spicy hot one. The Beef BBQ ribs  were ok nothing great a little too fatty. I loved the Mashed potatoes BBQ brisket bake. It's was delicious and full of flavor. The potatoes were real not instant so that's always a positive. The portions are huge here so come hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket BBQ potatoes bake so good!

cnTyAKkqZ57Afx5D-0b7HA.text: Great little hole in the wall bbq joint.  Friendly staff on Sunday night. Like 10 tables.  Sauce is amazing.  Pork and chicken both great.  We got a platter for the family.  Highly recommend if you are nearby.

zdftrnIntNkTAbcUd6F3xQ.text: Our new face BBQ joint in Vegas area. Hands down the best Brisket & Spare Ribs we've tried. Ribs were falling off the bone, very meaty & just right amount of fat. Can't remember ever having better Brisket. Both were very tasty with large portions, along with excellent God's Sauce, Carolina Vinegar & White Bama sauces. BBQ Mashed Potatoes were on point. Only down sides, very small portions with all sides & neither the Corn or Mac & Cheese were anything special. We'll surely refer many others to Jessie Rae's & will be back for sure.

TteZOZ_01Qr35aUtYFDzVQ.text: Was looking for Groupon's for my upcoming trip when this place caught my eye. It was for pulled pork, chicken, hot links and two sides and two drinks value $48 that I paid $21 for.    We were staying at Mandalay Bay and it was a short drive away. It was a small place with a huge menu. The girl at the counter that took our order was very friendly and very nice. You could either eat here or get it to go. When she brought out our food I was shocked, so much delicious looking food! We are from Texas and know BBQ and this was the real deal, soooo good.     I don't even like BBQ sauce normally but I couldn't stop trying the various ones offered. Those waffle fries, they were amazing, unlike any I have ever had. Run... don't walk to this place for some amazing BBQ and for some amazing service.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w1bPwF6JNH02aX01dN8mGg.text: Bomb bbq. Restaurant space and atmosphere pretty small and sad. They could definitely benefit from a larger place and better location. Parking is a bitch too but the food is worth the hassle.

iHleqfu4Tb2nHhaLQ-uYIw.text: Delicious southern style BBQ!!! We got the 1/2 of brisket that melted in my mouth which was enough for 2. The maniac fries are out of this world delicious, you can choose your meat on them we chose pork (this one is a MUST try) and enough for 2 people. My favorite part is that both dishes were nicely seasoned not to salty or sweet. If you need more sauces they have 4 to choose from.

z0Pq1zEeYlYu6eiSDHuJmQ.text: Haven't tried the food yet, smells good, but yo, Jessie Raes, when you deliver food, to a hotel, A. Would be nice if the juices from said food were in the containers, not spilled all over and soaking through the paper bag, and B. Yea some napkins and utensils would have been fabulous and so helpful! K Thanks So tried the food, average BBQ , .. and by the way to the one who responded, we ordered off your website to be delivered, so I have no idea who delivered it, that's on you, or you should specify on your site it's a third party delete service... doesn't matter, your food is overpriced and over rated ....4 1/2 stars???? No thanks

cBMMD_nVoigjnLu_zqBZHQ.text: When it comes to what to have for dinner, Mom always knows best. That was definitely the case at Jessie Rae's BBQ. I was playing at tournament at the Rio when I started craving ribs. Asking the experts at the hotel - security - one name echoed enough times to send me straight to Yelp. Jessie Rae's not only came up instantly in paid ads, smart, as well as a good sign but it was also close by. And it's reviews were terrific.   My flip flop got stuck under the front door as it closed behind me and it took me three attempts to free it. "I hate when that happens," the lady behind the counter said, removing my embarrassment after a clumsy entrance. Owner Mike Cross wasn't around, after all it was Sunday night, but his mother, Samantha was. "Are you visiting, this your first time?" She asked. I was a virgin. But If the food was good as the customer service was, I'd be luckier here tonight than at the casino.   As I eyed the menu wall, Samantha offered "Whatever you order, you have to try the god sauce, you'll be back for more." I was studying the Wall, I began drooling while choosing, a good sign. The smells were teasing me. Her words still ringing in my ears, my choice got easier because I was told I'd be back. I'd try the "Big Belt Buckle, brisket covered waffle fries covered in cheese" and the pulled pork sandwich another time. "Ribs, pulled pork and Mac and cheese for my side" was my order. "Help yourself to some sauces and I'll bag you up", Sam advised. I chose the house BBQ, which Sam told me was the god sauce. I doubled down.   Back in my hotel room, surrounded by pig bones, mouth slathered in a mess of god sauce and rib bits, my hands sticky with it too, I'm one happy man. This is the best barbecue I've had in years, possibly ever. The meat separated from the bone as if under its own will. And the flavor? Delicious fails this food, it's too weak a word. This BBQ will make you want to slap your Grandma" as my buddy Rusty used to say. That and "The cook is legit," said Yelp reviewer MIchael R, also from Long Beach. I couldn't say it better. Just go.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You could miss it, GPS it
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sam and the famous god sauce
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can eat in, it&#39;s super casual

p7R14cwGPgeUZQkfES1ZZA.text: I had Jessie Rae's BBQ cater for a group of about 20 executive and life coaches Friday night.  The food was phenomenal.  I've heard friends raving about it, so had to try it.  We got massive quantities of chicken breast, beef ribs, pulled pork, with corn, beans, and coleslaw for the sides.  Everything was amazing.  What I loved most was that the meat was tender, moist, and smoky and the different types of BBQ sauce were available on the side.  Even the chicken breasts were super moist.  And it was great for those of us trying to get in shape for swimsuit season as we could put as much or as little sauce on as we wanted.  I didn't try the corn or beans, although others raved about them.  I went back for 3 helpings of the coleslaw!  If you haven't tried it, this is by far the best BBQ in town!!

JH-6YyDfh_pWiAEs-mxxtw.text: Are you freakin kidding me! This place has amazing BBQ! It is the BEST I've had in Vegas, and I've had some good BBQ in Vegas! It's a little hole in the wall, and you might miss it if you're not careful. However, if you make, it you won't be disappointed.  I'm so full!

Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sxLVqKmr4HpfmeKy7eEKrA.text: Went here to try it out, I got the 2 meat choice with a side. I ended up choosing the brisket and pulled pork. Both were a little dry, but the addition of the sauces they had to offer kind of made it better. I chose their Vegas Slaw as the side, and the cashier hyped it up so much that when i tried it, I wasn't impressed by it. It was actually kind of dry. I wasn't disappointed and I wasn't wowed, it was just ok.

0dQBZ61im3R55uPUWiz3bA.text: This place is a winner. For my barbecue taste it does not get better than this. Mike and his crew take so much pride in their product but there's no way you will not enjoy eating there and they just increased the space by double if not more.  Make sure you go there on a day that ends in Y. Seriously when you get there try the brisket beef rib rib tips in the spareribs. The coleslaw on top of the tater tot's and brisket with some pulled pork is well, will change your life. I truly cannot recommend this place highly enough. It is truly down and dirty great barbecue!

Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tb-SjXZRdOwk8alEJuXG5w.text: So I've been here before almost a year ago and it was decent bbq food so I wanted to come back and try something new. When I get there, 3 hours before they close, almost everything on the menu is sold out which probably means they're that good and they had a busy day. So I ordered the spare Rib Sandwich. They basically just put 2 big slabs on with pickles between 2 buns that seemed a bit stale. Almost half of the ribs were fatty and the meat was dry and hard to chew. Thank God for the sauces that helped with the dryness. I had to breakdown the meat with my hands and remove all the fat just so I can get a decent bite. I wish they would slightly toast the bun but no. They forgot to put onions on it(which says it comes with on the menu). When I asked for the onions, the girl gave me about 8 chopped up pieces so I asked for more and another small amount of chopped onions came lol(see photos) It would've been nice to atleast offer a free drink since almost everything was sold out. I've worked in the restaurant industry for over 10 years and was very disappointed on the quality of the food and lack of customer awareness. I really hope management steps up and improves this place a bit. Would love to maybe go back one day and give it one more try. On the bright side The coleslaw was the only good thing I had

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. When I asked for the onions that were missing they gave me one of these and then another when I asked for more lol
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spare rib sandwich. Had to break up the meat myself to get a decent bite. Forgot to put onions

F28cdvAn2UuIASgdU4jZqw.text: I've eaten at literally hundreds of BBQ joints across the nation, and even a few overseas, and I can honestly say that Jessie Rae's is a top contender. The pulled pork was moist, yet retained a good bite and held its flavor throughout. Folks from Georgia would be reminded of home and that familiar taste of a quality roadside pork joint. Brisket was delicious, tender, well seasoned and a blend between the lean and fat. Some folks don't want their brisket chopped and demand sliced, but Im of the school of thought where taste is king and I don't care either way. Neither meats needed sauce, but you can't help but pour some on there as they are made in house and are quite well thought out. The sides we had were as expected, good compliments to the meal, but not gonna blow your mind. That's okay though, as the meat is the star of this place, owned and operated by a local young man. Desserts on hand were unique, decadent, and locally made. I can't wait to come back to Vegas to try more of the dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double brisket Sandwich
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jesse Mac Sandwich

lycSv5hZ7B3yy26BFOEM8g.text: I just stopped in here today to have lunch with a friend, and I was blown away.  I had never even heard of this place, but who could turn down trying a new BBQ spot?    As soon as I walked in the smell hit me and I knew that whatever I ordered was going to be amazing.  Turns out I was right.   Everything here tastes darn fresh and homemade. This is definitely not a fast food type place.  The quality of the food is top notch and everything feels like home cooking. I went for the micrib sandwich and waffle fries.  The rib sandwich was so generous I could barely hold onto it.  Giant pieces of ribs, "god sauce", between two BBQ soaked buns.  What's not to like?    One of the signature experiences at Jessie Ray's is the sauces.  There's 5 BBQ sauces on every table, all of which you've gotta try!  I especially loved the fallen Angel and pig sweat; but the god sauce is most people's favorite.  Either way, all of it was amazing.  If you like BBQ I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Micrib sandwich and waffle fries

PoE5Bpx3pyl9mTtug_sh9Q.text: If you think you have had BBQ in Vegas and you haven't been here then you are missing out. This place is HANDS DOWN THE MOST AMAZING BBQ in town. Service is amazing very casual, limited seating but well worth it. I had the Jessie Ray sandwhich, man oh man was this the best thing in town. No matter the distance Jessie Raes is the only place I go for BBQ from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jessie rae sandwhich

1RWw66ERjpErAfXeubwREw.text: Food was tasty. Rebecca was the best. We walked in and she greeted us right away. She asked if it was our first time there and we told her it was and she explained the menu and was super friendly. This place is laid back. We shared the Maniac fries and a 3/4 rack of spare ribs. Our friend ordered a pulled pork sandwich and Mac & Cheese that she liked her Mac & cheese so much she ordered a second one after finishing her first cup. (Didn't get a shot of that)

bYKKg1EpWkNipbEdOOdwdQ.text: I can see how they won Best BBQ in the Vegas newspaper ratings.  So good.  Ordered the brisket over tater tops and the pulled pork over mac and cheese.  The brisket was very good but the pulled pork was incredible paired with the mac and cheese.  So good.  Small location with only a little dine-in space and limited parking so do take-out or choose when you  go to dine in carefully.

Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 different sauces, I like their award winning one best, fallen angel was a hotter but their award winning has better sweet/hot balance.

48q_SKRRnDW35N1E83L9GQ.text: Took pops here today an hr b4 they closed. First time for both of us. We loved it! Got The Duke & Belt Buckle reg. The chopped brisket was so tender moist & flavorful same w the pulled pork super tender moist the smokey flavors on both meats are really good. We tried all of the sauces except the spicey one the god sauce was our favorite. The waffle fries underneath was hot & crispy just right! It's a cool little place tucked a stones throw away from the new Raiders stadium & Hwy15 not a big place but just right u see all of their bbq competition trophy's next to the register it was cool! We ended up taking some home I didnt know that 1 reg order could feed like 4 people & we got 2 regular trays & it was just me & pops. Took some leftovers home for tacos or sandwiches for the week! Overall our experience here was excellent 5/5 I'll be taking friends and relatives here when they visit & we will be back no doubt about it!!!

UKI62b_bVY7_J2FFpDKkpg.text: Had the jive chicken and the duke this time. As always awesome food here - best BBQ in Vegas and only a couple of miles from the Strip.

S2jpTveK91kTsOwZod8RmQ.text: Yumm!! Great little bbq place kinda hidden from the masses! You gotta know good bbq to smell this place out!! Had a Jesse Rae sandwich it was awesome!! Not a lot of room to dine in but this place is worth the trip!! Great job!!

XZ7INwawGeaTUdvZmaQtFQ.text: Absolutely delicious. Loved everything...best brisket around, and if you know me, you know I am brisket obsessed. Husband and I ordered way too much food but who cares because the brisket tacos were GREAT alongside of the spare ribs and the sandwich. I'll probably ask to come back to this place for dinner like five times in the next week, and I can guarantee I'm ordering those maniac fries next time.

QZr5RLIoym6nRDmIzpmQsg.text: First time here, but didn't feel very welcoming. Although either the lady or cook got my order wrong I absolutely loved the food.  I almost ate every bite up until I got full. I can say their food portions are pretty large. The place isn't that spacious, but good thing they do have outside seating. I would recommend anyone going here, just be specific when you order! Lol

EJtbElTv-6C_XhwQLGkpGQ.text: SOOO GOOODDDD!!! Not sure why there's bad reviews at all because this is one of the best BBQ I've ever had!!! This says a lot since we always try different BBQ joints and this is comparable to the famous Phil's of San Diego.   Food: GET THE BRISKET!!!!! I've never liked brisket it's always so dry or flavorless but I read on yelp that this brisket is good and it's THE BOMBB!! SO TENDER! I still dream about the meat there and the God Sauce. My boyfriend and I got the baby back ribs with the brisket and we were so full! Wish I ordered more brisket but too bad it wouldn't have made it back across the state border lol  Also ordered the brisket loaded fries which were so good!!! Wish open late or else they would be great as "late night post clubbing hangover" food. One star away from 5 because of the portions. Please make the portions larger  because it's kind of pricey. FREE CORNBREAD IS A PLUS!! Also Mac and cheese was really good and dense. Too bad my boyfriend ate all mine.   Service: really fast service here and clean!! This is a small hole in the wall joint and there isn't much seating but who cares? THIS FOOD IS THE BOMB I CRY TAKE ME BACK PLEASE

Vi63pU4_M8XPob7msaBNqA.text: I had a BBQ for 56 people catered by Jessie Rae's last Friday and it could not have been any better. They arrived with the food a little earlier than planned, but that worked to our advantage. Everything was absolutely delicious. We had a huge tray of the brisket and before the night was over that tray was completely empty. Also had the pulled pork and chopped chicken. Everything was amazing, including the dinner rolls. Wow! the dinner rolls, imagine Hawaiian rolls on steroids, these things were as big as the plates and sooo good. The sides were equally as good too, especially the mac n cheese. Very creamy and cheesy, it was the co star of the night with the brisket. Everyone at the event commented on how good the food was, and many have said they will be visiting there soon.  Can't say enough good things about the whole experience, from creating the menu, placing the order, the delivery and quality of the food. it was a great experience. And let's not forget about the sauce, they gave us a huge bottle of their "God Sauce", their special BBQ sauce. It is delicious, a great addition to all of their meats. I highly recommend Jessie Rae's for lunch, dinner or a large group, you won't be disappointed.

VbfIDBU3aJzkO0Z35_Q2qQ.text: I just ordered the full slab of baby back ribs and I have to say they were the best I've ever had.  The meat was perfectly cooked and just slid off the bone, as it should.  Can't wait to try more items on their menu.    Update 12-23-2018 Ordered Jesse Rae's baby back ribs tonight from Postmates.  I can't believe they let that terrible slab of meat out the front door.  90% of the rack was as dry as beef jerky.   Like I literally almost cracked a tooth on some of the meat.  Disgusting.   I guess Jesse and his wife have lost their touch.    Another one bites the dust.   Too bad, I really liked this place.   Won't return.   Guess I'm back on the hunt for good Las Vegas baby back ribs.   You'd think they'd be easier to find in a town built on food and entertainment.  Update 12-23-2018 (a few a hours after the WORST BBQ IVE EVER EATEN) Owner replies to my review "trust me buddy, my touch has gone nowhere, and it's Mike actually".   Must be nice to have so much business that you don't give a shit about someone who was a long time fan of your food and then had a bad experience.  Well Mike, believe me my business has gone elsewhere.   And all of my friends, colleagues and clients, will be directed elsewhere too.  This is Vegas.   Your doors will be closed in less than 5 years.  I'll give you one thing, Mike sounds much more like a guy who thinks his BBQ is better than it is.   Jesse sounds like a guy who knows how to cook.

LP92E4BPMASs-lWUIFyo8w.text: We stopped in yesterday for lunch. The young gal working was so nice and very helpful with my hubs in a wheelchair . The food was pretty good. I loved the sauces, I tried them all . Brisket was good and so were spare ribs. They were out of babybacks. The only thing I would suggest. Is more meat on the sandwich. I got alot of fat not so much brisket. I think I like sliced over chopped. Otherwise the closest thing to Kentucky bbq here in Vegas.  We will go back for more

QwmDTtYABFumXOnqeAheFA.text: Get there early or they might not have it,  they sell out some times so get there early.  I've been to Jessie Rae's a half dozen time and each time I've left stuffed. I get the brisket, pulled pork and burnt ends with a side of VEGAS slaw!

W0GXOzW6hMi05Fw19pV9Fg.text: I just had a brisket, rib tips and country mashed potatoes delivered. Both meats are very very dry :( the mashed potatoes are tasty but this BBQ makes me sad. Dry and flavorless meat is NOT what BBQ is about friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry rib tips, dry brisket (go figure) and pretty tasty mashed potatoes

QriOxvh8KnrLIvo-0F4CcA.text: Amazing food!! Seriously for a party of 7 we all enjoyed everything we got. You have to try the pull pork sandwiches and the fries!! You can't leave with trying the loaded fries. It was enough for 4 of us to share! We definitely recommend and will return.

CX06OXsMKapwZywUIBRlaQ.text: This is definitely a hole in the wall, blink and you will miss it.  This is a no frills, no ketchup zone, so don't take it to heart but the service can appear abrupt and rude.  Now that we got that out of the way, let's talk about the meat. The brisket was tender, juicy and flavorful and maybe a little bit of their award winning BBQ will enhance the flavor a bit more, though not necessary.  The rib tips, though a bit fatty, was again really tender and I expected crispy ends- but I must have mistaken.  I tried all different sauces that was offered and the award winning one tasted the most traditional and my preferred sauce. The belt buckle- with my choice of waffle fries and tots as my base, I was really disappointed that they were not crispy at all.  I did not enjoy any of the sauces that were laced over the dish, but I managed to pick out the brisket to get a better taste of it.  Next time, I'm ordering just the meat and skipping all the carbs including the sauce and adding my own.  The belt buckle reminds me of hangover food.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belt buckle- base comes with mac n cheese, but I added tots for an extra $1.50. The brisket is awesome,  but the sauce was not so good.

hrc7dxpBpdsoy-6pgdEAOw.text: So Vegas BBQ is a real thing! I've had all of their competitors and this stuff is the REAL DEAL!  I'm offered God Sauce with every order however I only use it about 50% of the time because the smoked flavor is incredible and doesn't necessarily need it. The sandwiches are also as delicious as the meat combos! Get here before noon during weekdays to beat the lunch rush because there is limited seating.          A True locally owned and operated business with strong ties to the community I've seen the owner personally get involved with numerous local charities which to me speaks Mountains about his character and the reputation he's building in Vegas. Keep Up The Excellent Work

Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meeeeaaaat!
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scored a piece of their &#34;WOOD&#34;

54K2-pVOcrEd8i6_ranggw.text: Came in with a client based on the reviews and our mutual desire to get some BBQ.  Small establishment located in a tiny strip mall with limited parking but the trip was worth it as the BBQ was creative and fantastic. I went with the Household of Three sandwich which consisted of smoked pork sausage, pulled pork and beef tips served on a brioche roll with slaw and onions.  It was certainly one of the better BBQ sandwiches I've ordered and the combination, while sounding daunting, worked well together as the various barbequed meats worked nicely with each other and the spicy scotch bonnet BBQ sauce they had tableside. I tried a few of my guests waffle fries as he could not finish them and also enjoyed these.  Only reason it was not 5 stars was owing to every table we tried to sit at was filthy was sauce spills and crumbs from the previous diners.

C1jamQUcA5GiZpP1I_1eVw.text: Saw this place on I believe it was Fox Morning News. It looked so good on TV I wanted to see if it was all talk or the real deal. Well as you can see by my 5 star rating this place was the real deal. If your looking for legit BBQ you'll really like this place. The BBQ we ordered was smoked and seasoned perfectly. Sometimes I go to these BBQ spots and the meat looks good on the outside but ends up being dry and not so tender on the inside. BUT not this place.. it was juicy and tender and full of flavor. They offer I counted  7 different BBQ sauces you can try at your table but to tell you the truth their BBQ was good enough without any extra sauce/seasoning. Also the pricing was reasonable for what you were getting. Definitely try this place if your craving some BBQ. I'll definitely be going back! Oh and also they do catering... I'll be using that service in the future as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket sandwich!!!!
Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three meat ... Hot links ..rib tips.. and brisket.

XtI5mgXlvW2bSE2bfPyvHA.text: Fake Reviews!  I've ordered from this place twice - once for take-out, once for dine-in.  Prices are extraordinarily high for what you get. Take out order of $35.00+ is enough food to feed a hummingbird.  Dine-in experience was the same (overpriced) except I got to witness how messy they keep the place. Owner (I think he was operating the register) very smug and full of himself while the (empty) tables had previous diners' scraps/trash left there.  I don't get all the 5-star reviews...

ngRAXYgoT_3NPxFI0WVbYw.text: Went here for a pulled chicken sandwich. Sandwiches are expensive. Price would have been okay if they came with a side but sides are extra. Pulled chicken sandwich was not pulled it was just big pieces of bbq chicken. Tasted good tho. Loved the smoke flavor. Wish they had fried okra. The buns are soft and buttery and they bbq sauces tasted pretty good. The lady at the counter who I will leave unnamed was a character to say the least and not in a good way. The place is cluttered with junk and dirty. Needs some love and care in the FOH. Seems like they do a lot of catering and ToGo orders. Dine in was not the best experience.

6U3Vl4ptejLhlioq5J3hNg.text: I had to upgrade the star count to 5 stars, because now Im convinced the maniac fries are drizzled w/liquid crack cocaine on top... OMG these maniac fries are the life of my stomach right now. Im convinced Jesus spit in the BBQ sauce, and thats why the Gods sauce is the greatest BBQ sauce Ive ever had. Shoutout everybody at Jessie Rae's!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorry, been eating the maniac fries nearly 10 minutes before I remembered to take a pic. But I remembered a pic this time!

avxtwy4wvoDbI8R4cm_pTA.text: The best BBQ and smoked food here. Having lived in the Carolinas it was hard to find a good BBQ place in Las Vegas and finally we found it.  This is a very small place with about 4-5 tables and about 15 seatings. It's good for take outs.  I love their Maniac fries and I have to say their Pig Sweat Sauce is the best Carolina sauce I have had in Vegas . The other 2 sauces are Fallen Angel and God Sauce.  We also had pulled pork, ribs and cole slaw. The pork was close to the best I have ever had. It was really tender with a great flavor.  My boyfriend had mentioned about coming here the first time and talked to the owner. He said he was really nice and wanted to go back as he loved the food. This time he wasn't there but the girl at the counter was very nice.

OR7tPr9KhqhF7Y99Mtlqbg.text: GREAT BBQ and huge portions but with a small dining area. They mostly deliver I guess but it is worth it. I had the brisket, ribs and pork combo with Mac and cheese and it *should* have fed three people...but I ate it all. Highly recommend. Only gave 4 stars because of the dining area. Have them deliver.

Jck_lS3NkNOIWfYdpFlNaw.text: The food was awesome and the service was amazing!  The best bbq we have ever had!  Thanks, Rebecca!

I8L7dD81QsSF2tw1Xnd1GQ.text: Never stops impressing me. We were posted in the area again and decided we needed some more delicious food and stopped by. Ordered and quickly got the food! Always generous servings and will put you into a food coma!! Will recommend them to anyone looking for BBQ or just some great food in general! Keep it up!!!

1-ZwKY-ImRckm45MsmWjMg.text: Ordered delivery and it was all incredible. I tried the chicken sandwich, brisket, and ribs. Everything had so much flavor and every bite was juicy, not a dry piece of meat. My sides were mac and cheese, beans, and corn and those were all very good.

WVBY54-akpo0JPEXvqZcxw.text: Amazing rib so tender they fall off the bone and the service is amazing would recommend for any rib lovers

523HerUtZZXRF02IhkCGsA.text: 2 wkks ago we came for the 1st time and Daryin made our meal we got the double brisket and sausage sandwich is was delicious.  TONIGHT 12-20-16 WE CAME WE GOT THE BLACK COOK  AND GOT THE SAME THING IT WAS GREASY GARBAGE THE OIL WAS SOAKED THROUGHT MY BUN.   I don't know maybe he was upset because be had to remake the food IDK but it sucked tonight and the fries were limp not crispy like last time.    The only good thing about tonight the evening cashier is super nice with great personality we seen her both times!   Thanks Cashier

photos.caption: Photo of Jessie Raes BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ohhh yes finally this brisket is sliced right fries with golden and the fallen angel &amp; god sauce is delicious!

_uR8yrWmkGYwvGzKWKcCkA.text: Best pulled pork sandwich and fries. Meat absolutely tender and seasoned well. Great customer service. Definitely would recommend to anyone looking genuine food that is locally owned and operated.

R6fTY-5yJhNOGMANOS9t0Q.text: OK take a look at the pics, enough said. Fine I'll make it longer.  Jessie Rae's BBQ is a small BBQ joint that you'll should try if you haven't already done so. Yea they're small 10 slim people could maybe fit inside. There were only 2 tables and a few stools on the inside and a few tables on the outside. They get busy during lunch and I've heard they do run out so come early. Got there at 11:30 am no one was there but a few minutes later it was packed.  Obviously when it comes to BBQ everyone is gonna have their favorites mines ribs and brisket and of course that's what I went with. The ribs here were tasty. It had a nice bark, a good smoke ring, and was real tender. Mmm I'm craving these ribs right now. The brisket I got were served a little cold, not sure if that's how they usually do it but would've enjoyed them warm or hot at least. Will need to try again.  If you like sauces on your BBQ they have three of them. The Pig Sweat which is their Carolina style vinegar sauce, the Fallen Angel which is their spicy sauce made from Carolina reaper peppers supposingly one of the spiciest peppers out there, and their God Sauce which I didn't get to try. Enjoyed the Fallen Angel and didn't care to much for the Pig Sweat.  They also have these things where it starts with a pile of waffle fries, mash potatoes, or mac n cheese then top it with sauces, cheese, spices, and meat. Doesn't look like its good for you but I want one.   I'm for sure going back.

27BiXvuT0TI_Xe6nto077w.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I usually go for the ribs, pulled pork and brisket but this time we tried something different. We got the Maniac Fries and a side of corn!!!! OMG! It should be against the law! It was soooo good!! We topped out Maniac Fries with the best sauce we've ever tasted (God Sauce) this stuff is addicting!! Give them a try! Mike's always super nice! Thanks guys!
